loans.name: Masimba Group

texts.en:
This is Ruth.  She is 43 years old and a widow from Masvingo, Zimbabwe with three children aged 25, 21 and 19 years.  In addition to her three children, Ruth also takes care of her sister's child who is still attending school. 

Ruth is in the business of buying and selling clothes from her residence in Masvingo.  She has been in business for 10 years with the help of her children, two of whom form the sales team while the other does the administrative work for her business.  She has requested a loan in the amount of $400 to buy additional items of clothing for resale.  With the profit generated from this loan she will be able to provide for her family.  She says high competition in the market is the major challenge she faces in her business. Her vision in the next five years is to open a shop in town.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Adalid

texts.es: Carlos tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. El comenzó a trabajar con su papa desde hace 20 años, se dedica al cultivo de sandia y maíz, el horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 3:00 pm. La ventaja es que cuando el tiempo climático es favorable la cosecha le resulta muy productiva y la desventaja es la venta de su producto que el precio suele ser bajo. El préstamo que Carlos esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de semilla de sandia y pago de mano de obra de sus empleados. Con la ayuda de este préstamo tendrá mayores facilidades para sembrar ya que tendrá el capital necesario para invertirlo en la siembra. Los problemas que enfrenta a la hora de la cosecha son las diferentes plagas e insectos que dañan la producción. Su meta es tener una cosecha muy productiva que le pueda dejar ganancias para ayudar al sustento de su familia. Es su primer préstamo solicitado en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Carlos is 40 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He is a very hard-working and responsible person. His wife devotes herself to household tasks. He started to work with his father 20 years ago. He grows watermelon and corn, and his work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. The advantage is that when the weather is favorable the harvest is very productive. The disadvantage is selling his product, since the price tends to be low. Carlos needs the loan he is requesting to purchase watermelon seeds and to pay for his employees' labor. With the help of this loan, it will be easier for him to plant, since he will have the necessary capital to invest in the planting. The problems he faces at harvest time are the different infestations and insects that damage the crops. His goal is to have a very productive harvest that can give him income to help sustain his family. This is his first loan requested through FAMA and he hopes to be punctual with his payments.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon seeds and to pay for labor

loans.name: Alicia Raquel

texts.es:
Alicia es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Alicia se encuentra estudiando una carrera técnica de Administración, en sus ratos libres le gusta ingresar a internet y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Alicia trabaja como asistente en una pequeña cooperativa de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días un aproximado de 8 horas, Alicia se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Alicia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de su un tratamiento médico y la compra de medicinas que necesita para mejorar su salud, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de ser una buen profesional y tener su negocio propio.
texts.en:
Alicia is a 20 year old single woman who lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who who has a great desire to succeed. Thanks to her hard work and the support of her parents, Alicia is currently studying a course in Business Administration in college.  In her free time, she likes to get on the internet, and sometimes she cooks a delicious Ají de Gallina (spicy chicken stew) to share with her family.

With a great deal of effort and dedication, Alicia works as an assistant in a small cooperative in her city.  She works for about 8 hours daily, and Alicia feels happy with her work and thinks she is doing well because of her hard work and the kind treatment that she shows to others.

Alicia is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva, since it is thanks to their help that she will be able to cover the costs of her medical treatment and buy medicines that she needs in order to become healthy again.  In this way, she will be able to continue working and make an effort to get ahead and achieve her dream of being a professional with her own business.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her medical treatment.

loans.name: Aya Duku

texts.en:
Aya operates a provisions store business in her village of Domenase near Elmina. Aya is a widow with three children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Aya uses her income to provide for the entire family. Aya will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. 

As a junior high school graduate, Aya understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions for her store.

loans.name: Cholponbu

texts.ru: Чолпонбу, 38 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. На протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. У Чолпонбу среднее образование. По хозяйству активно помогают дети. В хозяйстве имеет 15 овец. Также есть земельный надел, 1,76 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Совокупная прибыль Чолпонбу составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Она является участником группы "Келечек Озгоруш", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Чолпонбу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян фасоли, что позволит ей развить бизнес и увеличить доходы.
texts.en: Cholponbu is 38, married, and a mother of 4 children.  She's been a crop and livestock farmer for many years.  Cholponbu has a secondary school education.  Her children actively help her with chores.  She has 15 sheep on her farm as well as a 1.76-hectare plot of her own land for growing beans as a cash crop.  Her total profit is around 12,000 som.  She is a member of the Kelechek Ozgorush group, which includes two other people aside from her; there are three members in all.  Cholponbu has requested a loan of 30,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy fertilizer and beans for sowing, which will allow her to develop her business and increase her income.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, fuel and seeds to grow organic haricot

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Mary who is a 40-year-old smallholder farmer from Nkubu in the central region of Kenya. Mary owns a half-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. The mother of two keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has seven years of experience in farming. Mary is seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her banana farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her banana output because of the ready market in her region.

Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Nkubu. Few organizations, such as Juhudi Kilimo support, farmers like Mary. Through a group of 15 members called Mwangaza, Mary has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which uses the group-based savings as collateral. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Mary. Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: To buy seeds and expand her banana farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a business

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Born on August 19 1970 in Glidji in the county of the Lacs, Mrs. E. Jeanne is married and the mother of 2 children, she is also responsible for an additional person. Her principal activity is the trade of hardware merchandise. Thieves have looted her husband, a reseller, so he does not have anything left. Mrs. E. Jeanne is now in the obligation of caring alone for her family.

She is soliciting today a loan of $800 to develop her hardware business. She wishes to rent a small warehouse to maximize her profit and to better provide for her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 19 août 1970 à Glidji dans la préfecture des Lacs, Madame E. Jeanne est mariée et mère de deux enfants et a à sa charge une autre personne. Son activité principale est le commerce des produits de quincaillerie. Son mari un revendeur a été pillé par les voleurs ce qui fait qu’il se retrouve sans rien. Madame E. Jeanne se voit dans l’obligation de s’occuper seule de la famille. Elle sollicite à ce jour un crédit de $800 pour développer son commerce de quincaillerie. Elle désire louer un magasin de stockage afin de réaliser un profit maximum et mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use:
Opening a hardware store

Ouvrir un magasin pour la vente des produits de quincaillerie

loans.name: Jesus Fidel

texts.en:
Mr. M. installed a vulcanizer in his home and wishes to make the necessary adjustments to it so he can sell new and used tires. "I need a good room to make my business more orderly and so I can make a distinction between the work area and the sale area. To achieve this, I need a loan of $1,200."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. M. instaló una vulcanizadora en su vivienda y desea adaptarla de acuerdo a las necesidades requeridas, además vende llantas usadas y nuevas. "Necesito un buen cuarto para tener mas ordenado mi negocio y así definir el área de trabajo y la de venta para lograr esto se requieren de $1,200.00 dlls.

loans.use: To construct a room for tire sales and make adjustments to the vulcanizer.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva lives in an anticretico rental property with her husband and children on Avenida Buenos Aires in the San Martin zone of the city of La Paz. She is 51 years old, and since a young age has worked in the production of specialty sweets for sahumerios. (Sahumerio is a traditional ceremony passed down by Eva's ancestors, the Incas, where one sets a small bonfire to honor Mother Nature and to ask her blessings.) Eva works with the chifleras (people who sell products to honor la Pachamama [Mother Earth]). Eva does not work alone. Her sister-in-law helps with the production of the sweets and recieves a salary for her work, which shows that Eva's business generates employment.

Eva asks for a loan to increase her merchandise, and also to be able to work in a more comfortable environment with suitable tools.

Eva's past history with Impro qualifies her as a very good client. This will be her third loan, and the previous two were paid off entirely, consequently allowing her access to new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Eva vive en anticretico con su esposo e hijos en la Av. Buenos aires de la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 51 años de edad y desde muy joven se dedico a la elaboración de dulces especiales para sahumerios (sahumerio es un acto tradicional que viene de nuestros antepasados los Incas y que consiste en prender una pequeña fogata para honrar a la Madre Tierra y pedirle sus bendiciones). Ella trabaja con las chifleras que son personas que venden productos para sahumar a la Pachamama (madre de la tierra). Este trabajo no lo realiza ella sola; su cuñada (hermana de su esposo) le ayuda en la elaboración de los dulces y recibe un salario por dicha ayuda, lo cual indica que Eva genera empleo en su negocio.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su mercadería y también poder hacerlo en un ambiente más cómodo con herramientas adecuadas

Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como muy buen cliente; este será el tercer crédito que solicita y los dos anteriores han sido pagados en su totalidad y consiguientemente puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and build capital

loans.name: Neba Christabel

texts.en:
Born in 1973, Christabel is married and is a mother of four children. She has suffered from challenges, such as family problems, ill health, and an attack by an armed robber who made away with some of her precious items.

Her husband has been sick for a while, so he could not work to make enough money to provide sufficiently for his family. His wife therefore decided to support him by starting a business so she could raise money to pay school fees for the children and buy food.

With a loan of $100, she plans to open a provision store near a residential area, to shorten the distance neighbors will have to go to buy goods. Through this business, she will raise money to pay school fees for her children.

Christabel will repay her loan in 15 months. Her first installment repayment will be made on the date her loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
Mrs. Diana belongs to the Banco Comunal Las lomas de Yarina, del Jr. Adolfo Lobo 139 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali [a community bank]. She is 35 years old, she has two children, her husband works in the logging business and he is only at home two times per month.

Ivonne looked for a job without luck and that’s how her neighbors suggested she contacted Kiva by the Manuela Ramos Foundation to start a business. She sells the seed of Camu Camu (fruit of the zone). She has a planting bed in her house where she plants the seeds all the way until the seeds germinate and then she sells them.

With the loan that she is requesting to the Manuela Ramos foundation of S/. 1,500 (US$ 500 Aprox.), which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy another planting bed and she will also buy 1 bushel of Camu Camu seeds, 3 bushels of wood mulch, and spare wood to close the plantings beds, to keep animals away.

She is pretty excited to be able to financially contribute to her house and her ultimate goal is to save enough money to be able to buy a lot, and to plant the Camu Camu seeds herself.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ivonne pertenece al Banco Comunal Las lomas de Yarina, del Jr. Adolfo Lobo 139 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su pareja viaja al monte para trabajar en el negocio de la madera, donde 2 veces al mes puede estar en casa, dado que la necesidades son diarias.

Ivonne buscó oportunidad de trabajo no pudiendo encontrarlo, fue cuando sus vecinas le sugieren que con la ayuda de Manuela Ramos puede poner un negocio, por ello decide vender Semilla de Camu Camu (fruta de la zona), para esto instaló unos almácigos en su casa. Ella hace todo el trabajo de la germinación de la semilla, quedando listo para que los agricultores los siembren y así poder venderlo.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500 (US$ 500 aprox.) el que será pagado en 5 meses, instalará otro almácigo en su casa, además comprará 1 saco de Semilla de camu camu, 3 sacos de aserrín, madera para cercar los almácigos, evitando así, que algunos animales los malogre.

Ella esta muy contenta de contar con un ingreso para cubrir los gastos de la casa, por otro lado tiene la meta de comprar un terreno para sembrar estas semillas de camu camu.

loans.use: To buy seeds and other materials

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn D., 38, hawks tie and dye cloth. She has been very successful in her business, but it comes with a costs to her health. Hawkers walk around under the scorching Ghanaian sun, selling what they carry and balance on their heads. Evelyn expresses frequent fevers from being outdoors for such long periods of time. It causes her to be exposed to diseases and viruses carried by mosquitoes, including malaria.

Once she earns enough money, she will find an alternative to hawking. However, her first priority is taking care of her 10-year-old son.

Evelyn is a member of the lending group, Hope. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To purchase tie and dye cloth

loans.name: Shukur

texts.en: Shukur is 59 years-old and is farmer who raises sheep in a southern small village in Imishli region. He raises and sells sheep to the local businesses and traders.  He has more than fifteen years of experience in breeding sheep. He is married and has six children. It is very hard to cover the family’s needs, as breeding sheep is the only income in his family. Now he needs $1200, he will repay it in 18 months. He needs this amount to buy more sheep to continue to expand his herd.  He thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: Going to build sheep herd

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
For 4 years, Fernando has been unemployed. Since he could not find any work, he started to sell the tools he owned and saw that people were buying them. He saved money to buy a van and then, he went from house to house to buy merchandise off them and resell the goods at the marketplace. Little by little, Fernando started to become familiar with this business.

However, the van that is used to move his merchandise does not serve its purpose well because it's an old vehicle. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of $475 which will be paid back in installments over 6 months. This loan will be used to repair his van as well as buy merchandise for resale. And with this money, he will be able to pay for his two children's education. With your help, Fernando will be able to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Hace 4 años que Fernando quedó desempleado, y al no encontrar trabajo comenzó a vender las herramientas que tenía, al ver que la gente le compraba la mercancía. Ahorró un poco para poder comprar una camioneta y así poder pasar por las casas para comprarles mercancía y revenderlas en un mercado. Poco a poco el señor se está dando a conocer en este negocio.

Sin embargo la camioneta que lo mueve para buscar sus productos ya no sirve puesto que es antigua. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Y con este dinero podrá reparar su camioneta, además de poder seguir comprando mercancía para la reventa. Y así con este dinero podrá pagar los estudios de sus dos hijos que están estudiando. Con tu ayuda la familia de Felipe podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: repair his van and buy merchandise

loans.name: Najiath

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Najiath I., who is married with four children, aged between 12 and 21, and has one other dependent.

In 2005, Najiath established a business selling shoes and African batik cloth. Working 5 to 8 hours a day, 6 days a week, and assisted by her husband and five employees, she earns about $40 per month from this business. Najiath has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan of $450 to purchase additional stocks of cloth and shoes in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $65. In the future, Najiath also plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of African batik cloth and shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Natig

texts.en: H. Natig, a taxi driver, is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Aghdam. He rents a car from his neighbor to use for his taxi service. His neighbor offered to let him to pay four months' rent in advance and get one month for free. He needs this loan to take advantage of this agreement, which will save him $250, enough to send his children to the village for one month of the summer holidays.

loans.use: To rent a car for his taxi service

loans.name: Edgar  Vicente

texts.es:
Has been working with this institution for three years and has received six loans. The last three have been used to improve chicken production since he now owns a farm that produces short quantitiies. He hopes to continue working on this and develop it into something big. He works with his father-in-law since he knows about this kind of business. He's married with a young child, wife is unemployed. He also works as a bill collector for his city.
Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace tres  años se le han otorgado seis creditos de los cuales los ultimos tres han sido para mejorar la producción de pollo ya que cuenta con una granja la que produce en pocas cantidades y la que espera poder llegar a desarrollar con el tiempo, el trabaja en conjunto con su suegro ya que este conoce de este tipo de negocio, casado con un hijo pequeño, su esposa esta desempleada, el ademas del negocio trabaja como gestor de cobro en una institución de la ciudad.

loans.use: Reactivate a farm and purchase of chickens, food, and vitamins

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Señora Tomasa is a partner of the Communal Progress Bank of Caluyo "Banco Comunal Progreso Caluyo" in the community of Villa Santa Rosa in the sector of Sakakatani, Department of Puno. Since she was young, she has been in the business of purchasing and selling starch made from corn, potatoes, broad beans, and quinoa. Because of this, her business has been very profitable. She continued with that business while she was raising her family, but her income was not enough to cover her household's expenses. It was for this reason that she decided to change businesses.

Now, she raises cattle. With the encouragement of her maid of honor, she used her first loan of 300.00 Soles to purchase two sacks of bran, two sacks of soy, and growth hormones. She has done this since 2005.

With a loan of 1,700.00 Soles ($600), which she will repay in six months, she will buy a two-horned bull to raise and two sacks of bran.

Her business is going much better now and she is content with the income she makes by selling. Her husband works with a tricycle in the city of Yunguyo and he supports her unconditionally in her business.

She is thirty years old and has studied through the third grade in school. She has one son and three daughters, three of whom are studying in the community's education institute. She hopes to have a stable to raise and buy more cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Tomasa, es socia del Banco Comunal Progreso Caluyo de la comunidad Villa Santa Rosa sector Sakakatani, departamento de puno ella desde joven se dedicaba al negocio de compra y venta de chuño, papa, habas y quinua. En ese entonces su negocio fue rentable. Cuando tuvo su familia continua con su negocio pero no le alcanzaba la ganancia para cubrir los gastos del hogar, por ello decidió cambiar de negocio. Actualmente, se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno, gracias a su madrina de matrimonio quien la animó para que invirtiera el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 en la compra de concentrado como 2 sacos de afrecho, 2 sacos de soya y más las inyecciones de engorde, esta actividad la hace desde el año 2005. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará un toro de dos dientes para engorde y 2 sacos de afrecho. El negocio le va mucho mejor que antes, por ello ella esta contenta con la ganancia que obtiene de la venta de ganado, y su esposo trabaja con triciclo en la ciudad de Yunguyo y le apoya incondicionalmente en la actividad económica. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, ha estudiado hasta tercero de primaria y tiene un hijo y 03 hijas de los cuales están estudiando 3 en Institución Educativa de la comunidad y ella sueña con tener un establo para el engorde y comprar más ganado vacuno.

loans.use: Purchase of a Bull

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela T. is 28 and has been married to her husband, Luis Alberto, for eight months. They don’t have children yet, but Mariela says she wants to have a girl and a boy.

Mariela is a native of Espartillar, in the city of Carapegua. Her father was a cattle farmer who was very well-known in the area. In 2003, he started a small store for her downtown, but six months later he died in an accident. Mariela had to close the store since she is an only child and was left to care for his property (animals and land). She sold some of it to be able to reopen her business, which has been running now for two months, located in the same building as before, but in a different area. Her store is much larger now and she also sells appliances and motorbikes. Thanks to all of her efforts and hard work, Mariela is able to support her mother, covering living expenses that wouldn’t be paid without Mariela’s income.

Mariela is now seeking a loan in order to purchase additional merchandise, such as applicances and motorbikes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Mariela T. tiene 28 años de edad y esta casada con el Sr. Luis Alberto hace 8 meses todavía no tienen hijo pero según comenta su objetivo es tener una nena y un varón.

La Sra. Mariela T. es oriunda de la compañía de Espartillar de la ciudad de Carapeguà, hija de un ganadero muy conocido en la zona, en el 2003 su papá le había montado una pequeña despensa en un salòn en el centro de la ciudad, 6 meses después su papá falleció en en un accidente por lo que tuvo que cerrar de nuevo su despensa, ya que era hija unica y se quedó al cuidado de su los bienes que dejó de su papá ( animales y propiedades ), comercializó una parte para poder rehabrir su negocio, que actualmente tiene montado hace dos años en el mismo local pero con otro ramo y es mucho mas grande ( ventas de electrodomesticos y motos ), Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo está manteniendo a su mamá y la casa que depende directamente del ingreso de ella.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (Electrodomesticos y motos).

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as motorbikes, blenders, mixers and coffee makers.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Santa Rita Village Bank. She is married, fifty-eight years old and the mother of seven children, two of which live with her in Tambo, two hours away from the city of Ayacucho. Margarita has a store in her house where she sells paint, plastics, tubing, nails and hardware. She purchases these products in Ayacucho, transporting them in rented cars. Her husband also sells hardware in the city of Monterrico in the Ayachuchan Jungle.

Margarita is seeking a loan of 1600 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in more tubing, nails and sackcloth.

Margarita's dream is to improve her business and educate her children to become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase more tubing, nails and sackcloth.

loans.name: Rubaba

texts.en: Rubaba lives in Khachmaz town. Her brother is pictured. She was born in 1952. Rubaba is a mother of 2 children. She is a widow. Now she needs a loan of  $1200 to buy 2 calves for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Daliborka

texts.en: Daliborka J. was born in 1979. She lives in the village of Lipac near Doboj. She has two children. Unfortunately, her husband died last year. He had supported their family, and they now live on his retirement of 150 KM ($112 USD). Fortunately, Daliborka has her garden and a field where she grows different kinds of vegetables, some of which she uses to feed her family and the rest she sells. Daliborka wants to produce more vegetables for selling, so she decided to take out her first loan from Women for Women International in the amount of 600 KM ($450 USD). She will use this loan to buy seeds for autumn sowing. Daliborka hopes that she will be able to earn enough money to pay all her family’s expenses.

loans.use: To buy a seeds

loans.name: Fadila

texts.en:
Fadila was born in 1954 and she lives in a suburb of Gračanica, in Bosnia. She is divorced and has an adult son, but she lives alone. She raises and re-sells chickens, for which she earns about 200KM/month. This is equivalent to roughly USD$132, and is barely enough for her to survive.

Fadila hopes to start raising cattle. She requests a 1,000KM loan from Women for Women International, which she will use to purchase one cow. She hopes to sell milk and milk products in order to supplement her current income so that she can cover her basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase one cow.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Mrs Tran Thi H. is 40 years and lives in Nghe An Province. She has 4 children, 1 of whom is  grown-up.  She has been in TYM for 3 years. The fist time she borrowed 1 million to invest in raising pigs. Now this business developed well and this is the main income for her family. With an income of about 2 million per month her family has more money to invest in the children’s education and improve their living.
Now she wants to borrow 10 million to buy more cows and chickens for raising.

loans.use: buy more cows and chickens for raising.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La Sr. Maria tiene 59 años de edad, habitante del barrio Villa Reconciliación  en la capital de Managua de estado civil soltera,  con ochos hijos todos independizaron de ella. Sus planes es tener una vivienda segura y protegida. 
Dona Maria tiene su pequeño negocio situado en su casa de habitación de cafetín desde hace nueve años lo posee, inicio con fondo propios y vende refrescos, café, pan simple y pan dulce, cosméticos y de todo un poco, así ella se ayuda económicamente. Sus metas es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda para ofrecerles a los clientes mayor comodidad, seguridad y protección. También oto objetivo a  futuro incrementar las ventas con nuevos productos en su cafetín. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque y otros materiales permitiendo hacer su casa, y así poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes en su casa, pero una casa digna.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria is 59 years old, lives in the neighborhood Villa Reconciliación in the capital of Managua, her marital status is single and she has eight children who are independent from her. Her plan is to have safe and secure housing. Ms. Maria has a small business, a cafeteria, located in her home. She has had it for nine years, beginning with her own funds and selling drinks, coffee, simple bread and sweet bread, cosmetics and a bit of everything, which helps her economically. Her goals are to improve the infrastructure of her place to offer customers better convenience, safety and protection. Another objective for the future is to sell new products in her cafeteria. Thanks to the loans from Afodenci she has purchased materials for construction such as: cement, iron, blocks and other materials that will allow her to make her house and give good service to her clients in her house, a worthy house. .

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to finish constructing her house

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib A. is a 39-year-old married man who lives with his wife and three children and owns a small farm. He lives and works in the small village of Saatli, Azerbaijan. Sahib has a business raising and selling calves. He has more that 20 years of experience in this field. Because calf-raising and -selling is a profitable business, Sahib has become a very successful businessman in a very short period of time. He works very hard and spends all his time with the calves, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now, Sahib wants to expand his business and buy more calves, so he has applied for a loan of 1200 USD. With your help, Sahib can get ahead.

loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mr. Lai K. is a bed maker from Chroek Rom Deng village in Kampong Cham province. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing a timber saw and timber wood to make more beds. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living condition. 

His wife, Mrs. Ouk Ran, is a bed seller. Mr. Lai K. is a 29 year old father of a young child.

His wife is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To purchase a timber saw and timber wood to make beds

loans.name: Abra Nousimédi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’adidogomé, elle pratique comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, actuellement son stock de charbons de bois est épuisé c’est pour cela qu’elle  s’adresse à wages pour demander un prêt afin de pouvoir se réapprovisionner en stock de charbons de bois, elle est mariée et  a deux enfants, son mari est à la retraite donc son activité lui permet d’aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Adidogomé district. To earn an income, she does commerce in charcoal. Currently, her stock of charcoal is exhausted. That’s why she is enquiring with WAGES to ask for a loan, so as to resupply herself with charcoal. She is married and has two children. Her husband is retired, so her business enables her to help him with daily expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, del Sector Tauccamaya, en el distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; ella tiene 42 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 06 hijos. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 05 años, ella se dedica al acopio D. ovejas y su posterior engorD. y venta, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. ovejas para engorD., afirma que le va bien en sus negocio.  
Actualmente ella requiere un préstamo adicional D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con dicho préstamo podrá adquirir mas ganado (ovejas y toros) para continuar en su negocio D. engorD. D. ganado, su mercado es la feria ganadera D. Zepita donD. venD. sus ganados engordados, su anhelo es comprarse mas ganado y educar a sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the “Urbano Central” cooperative bank, located in the Tauccamaya sector of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and has six children. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. She dedicates herself to acquiring sheep to later fatten and sell. She invested her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles into the purchase of sheep. She affirms that her business is going well. She currently needs an additional loan of 1,500 soles, which she commits to repaying in 4 installments, to invest in purchasing more livestock (sheep and bulls) to continue her business. Her market is the livestock fair of Zepita where she sells her grown animals. Her wish is to buy more livestock, and to educate her children so they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more livestock (sheep and bulls).

loans.name: Badenya  (La Parenté) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badenya est composé de cinq  femmes toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 5 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies dans le  quartier Sogomougou de la  ville de koutiala (région de Sikasso république du Mali).
 Elles se sont  connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et exercent  presque la même activité de vente de savons, de collier, de boucle oreille, de chaîne  et autres parures. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Badenya a décidé d’intégrer   l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
 Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter  divers produits cosmétiques et de parures. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Bamako (la capitale de la république Mali) auprès des grossistes. Les produits sont  vendus au  grand marché de Koutiala à la maison et en ambulant à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen 65 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Elles ont pour ambition  de diversifier les activités et agrandir leurs fonds  de commerce.
texts.en:
The group Badenya is composed of five women who are all married. They average 32 years of age and 5 children, and they live in large traditional extended families in the Sogomougou district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). These women know one another through community ties and do almost the same work selling soap, necklaces, earrings, chains, and other ensembles.

In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-increasing number of customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan (group loan). They intend to use this loan to buy various cosmetics and ensembles. Supplies of goods are gotten in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. The goods are sold at the grand marketplace of Koutiala, at the house, and door-to-door to customers essentially composed of women.

The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 65,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be use to make loan interest payments, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in business. Their ambition is to diversify their businesses and to expand their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and ensembles

loans.name: Lucila Florentina

texts.es: Lucila Florentina H. B. vive en Soyapango departamento de San Salvador, Lucila es madre soltera de una hija. Lucila se dedica a su negocio que es una pequeña tienda ubicada dentro de su domicilio, Lucila obtiene buenas ventas ya que su tienda está ubicada en una buena zona;  donde no hay competencia cerca. Lucila quiere invertir más en su tienda, tener mayor cantidad de productos y más variedad, es por ello que está solicitando un crédito para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucila Florentina H. B. lives in the Soyapango neighborhood of San Salvador. Lucila is a single mother and has a daughter. Lucila makes a living through her business which is a small store that is located inside of her home. Lucila's sales are good since she lives in a good area and there is not any competition close to her. Lucila wants to invest more money in her store and have a greater quantity of products and more variety. For this reason she is asking for a loan to be able to fill her store with more merchandise.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with more merchandise.

loans.name: Marlene Ines

texts.es: Muy contenta se encuentra la señora Marlene T. porque gracias a sus esfuerzos en su negocio de venta de golosinas ha logrado salir adelante beneficiando a su familia. Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente comerciante en su localidad pero tiene la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de las golosinas y así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión inmediata.
texts.en:
Marlene T. is very happy because, thanks to her efforts in her business of selling sweets, she has been able to get ahead and help her family. In her area she is know to be an excellent businesswoman. But, she needs to invest in her business. She is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy sweets. This way she can get ahead in her business, which needs immediate investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LA FLOR DE LA CANELA 2”, con domicilio en la  Urbanización Municipal Mz. G8 Lt. 7 tiene 33 años de edad y vive con  sus cuatro hijos menores.
Se inicio con la venta de comida hace varios años, la primera vez que obtuvo un préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 con el cual compró más víveres para la elaboración de sus alimentos, lo cual le permitió ganar mas clientes.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 invertirá en arreglar su puesto de comidas y también comprará  víveres y utensilios para la cocina.
En el Tiempo que trabaja con Manuela Ramos se siente muy feliz porque gracias a ello su negocio esta creciendo  y sus hijos pueden estar en una mejor situación.
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the communal bank "La Flor de la Canela 2", located at Urbanización Municipal Mz. G8 Lt. 7. She is 33 years old and lives with her four small children. She began selling food many years ago. The first time she obtained a loan of 300 soles, she bought more supplies to create her dishes, which allowed her to bring in more customers. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will invest in repairs for her business and will also buy supplies and utensils for the kitchen. She has been happy working with Manuela Ramos, because thanks to them, her business is growing and her children can live better.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and utensils for kitchen; infrastructure improvements

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. sells bottled water in the fishing harbor in Takoradi. Mary has finished junior high. She is divorced and has 2 children. Mary has been selling bottled water since 1995. She is responsible solely for the feeding the children. Her loan will be used to support her business in water trading. She hopes to re-invest the new profit back into the business.

loans.use: To support her business in the water trading.

loans.name: Las Estrellas De Ccenhuacucho Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Ccenhuacucho son D. la comunidad D. Ccenhuacucho, Distrito D. Vinchos, Provincia D. Huamanga, las actividades principales D. la comunidad son la agricultura D. papa, cebada, trigo, olluco, también la piscicultura, crianza D. ganado vacuno  y ovino.
Celina es casada, tiene 7 hijos, Celina compra y venD. animales menores, quesos, productos que comercializa en las diferentes ferias D. la región con l ayuda D. sus hijos y esposo, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. quesos y animales menores. Los sueños D. Celina son incrementar su capital para mejorar las condiciones D. vida en su familia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
Mientras que Doris es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos, Doris tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, también un restaurante, además Doris venD. combustibles, actividades que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo, hijos y hermana, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. combustible. Los sueños D. Doris son educar a sus hijos y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The members of the Ccenhuacucho Community Bank are from the Ccenhuacucho community in the Vinchos district in the Huamanga province. The primary activities in the community are potato, barley, wheat, and olluco (root vegetable) farming. Also, there is fish breeding and the raising of cattle and sheep. Celina is married and has seven children. Celina buys and sells small animals and cheese in the different regional fairs. She does this with the help of her children and her husband. The loan is to buy cheese and small animals. Celina’s dreams are to increase her capital in order to improve her family’s living conditions and to give her children a good education. Doris is in a common law marriage and has six children. Doris has a store in her house where she sells general groceries. She also has a restaurant. Doris also sells combustibles. She does this with help from her husband, children, and sister. Doris’ dreams are to educate her children and improve her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains, cheese, small animals, rice, sugar, and combustibles

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga.
Isabel es casada, tiene 59 años y 3 hijos, Isabel vende comida en un local alquilado que se encuentra cerca de un paradero de transporte publico, donde también vende bebidas variadas, Además los días sábados y domingos vende comida en la feria de San Juan.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, fideo, azucar.
Isabel sueña con tener un restaurante en un local propio.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the communal bank group “Morenita Huamanga”. She is 59 years old, married and has 3 children. Isabel sells food and beverages from a rented space near a bus stop. In addition, she sells food on Saturdays and Sundays at the San Juan market.

Isabel needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy rice, noodles and sugar. She dreams of having her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, noodles and sugar.

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es: Viviano es un hombre muy atento, dedicado a la agricultura, tiene 36 años de edad y hace poco terminó de construir su casa propia, donde vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijos. La siembra y el cuidado de sus cultivos es su mayor placer, ya que desde niño su padre le enseñó a tenerle gratitud a Dios y a la tierra. Al ver fructificar sus plantas se regocija mucho, puesto que cuando coseche tendrá la oportunidad de comercializar sus productos directamente en un mercado importante de la ciudad de Lima. La decisión de enviar sus cosechas a la capital es porque le genera mejores ganancias y ello le da la oportunidad de pagar el alquiler de la chacra y la compra de fungicidas en aras de prevenir el acecho de las plagas. De terminar sus labores agrícolas, Viviano busca trabajar en las chacras de sus vecinos, para de ese modo cubrir los gastos de alimentación diaria de su casa, ya que por ello le pagan 15 soles al día y a su esposa 12 soles. Por el momento, Viviano seguirá trabajando arduamente para el bienestar de sus hijos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos anteriores demostró ser una persona muy puntal en cada uno de su pagos, por lo que todos los integrantes de su banco comunal lo reconocen; asimismo, menciona sentirse muy bien con todos ellos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus chacras de arvejas, donde posa para la foto.
texts.en:
Vivian is a very thoughtful man dedicated to agriculture. He is 36 years old and has just finished building his own house where he lives with his partner and mother of his two children. The planting and care of his crops is his biggest pleasure because, ever since he was a child, his father taught him to give thanks to God and to the earth. Upon seeing his plants bear fruit he rejoices, as when he brings in the harvest he will have the opportunity to sell his products directly to an important market in the city of Lima. He sends his harvest to the capital because this generates the best income and gives him the ability to pay the rent for the farm and buy fungicides in order to ward off plagues. Upon completion of his own agricultural labors, Viviano looks for work on his neighbors’ farms. With the 15 soles a day they pay him, and the 12 soles a day they pay his wife, he is able to cover the household’s daily costs of food. For the moment, Viviano will continue to work arduously for the wellbeing of his children. This is his fifth loan with MFP. In the previous series, he demonstrated he was prompt in every one of his payments. All the members of his communal bank recognize him and, in the same manner, he feels good with each of them. With the money that he is currently requesting, he is planning to invest in the purchase of chemical fertilizers to improve his pea fields, where he is posing for the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Hellen Jepkogei

texts.en:
Hellen K. is 34 years old and married to Vitalis. They have three children. Her dairy business is located in Chembulet along Iten-Eldoret road in Eldoret Town. She has been in the dairy business for the past three years now.

She was introduced to KADET by a member and with the loan she has borrowed from KADET, she intends to buy animal feeds for her dairy cattle. In the future she intends to grow her dairy business and be able to supply milk to Kenya Cooperative Creameries (KCC).

Hellen intends to open a wholesale business and be able to pay school fees for her children.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds for her dairy cattle

loans.name: Juna

texts.en:
Juna P. is from the village of Maquilao, Tangub City in Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Juna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Juna raises and sells fish. Juna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Juna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juna is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Juna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Dios es Amor son  María Cruz G., María Cecilia M. y Juana I.. Ellas viven en barrio San Judas de Managua.

María Cruz G. de 56 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella comenzó vendiendo ropa  usada, hoy en día  vende ropa nueva, zapatos, nacatamales, sopa, plátanos y frijoles.  Además de distribuirla en su barrio, ella lleva a vender a la Isla de Ometepe considerada una de las maravillas del mundo. Su meta es tener su propio tramo en el mercado.


Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Cecilia M. Padilla quien vende sopa, nacatamales, vaho y frijoles cocidos y Juana I. quien vende ropa, helado, fresco y hielo.
texts.en:
The members of the Dios es Amor Group are María Cruz G., María Cecilia M., and Juana I.. They live in the San Judas de Managua neighborhood. María Cruz G., 56, is the coordinator of the group. She started selling used clothes. Now she sells new clothes, shoes, "nacatamales" (a traditional Central American dish similar to a tamale), soup, bananas, and beans. In addition to distributing them in her neighborhood, she takes them to sell on the Isla de Ometepe, which is considered to be one of the wonders of the world. Her goal is to have her own space in the market. María Cecilia M. Padilla, another member of the group, sells soup, nacatamales, “vaho” (a mix of meat, green plantains and yuca cooked in banana leaves), and cooked beans. Juana I., a member of the group, sells clothes, ice cream, soda, and ice.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Pura

texts.es: La señora Pura, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y 03 hijos, uno que ya viene en camino y dependen de ella.Se inicio con un capital de S/. 500.00 junto a su esposo emprendieron su negocio de fabricación y venta de ladrillos.  En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio que ofrece a las instituciones publicas y privadas que son sus principales.Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 comprará leña y galones de petróleo para quemar los ladrillos igualmente  moldes de acero para la fabricación en serie del producto.Se siente orgullosa de aportar económicamente al ingreso familiar y verse realizada como mujer y como empresaria. Agradece infinitamente al Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Comprará petroleo y leñas

loans.name: Ana Rabeca

texts.pt:
Ana M. nasceu em Maputo, província de Maputo, tem 35 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 03 filhos de 19, 14 e 11 anos de idade, os dois mais novos e que vão à escola. Estudou ate 6ªclasse parou por falta de condições por parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria e para alem dos filhos sustenta também o irmão que vive com ela.

Nunca mudou de cidade, sempre viveu com a família no Bairro Khongolote, é comerciante permanente há 12 anos, faz 08 horas diárias e não tem nenhum empregado. Aprendeu a fazer o negocio com seus pais há 12 anos. O seu rendimento mensal varia de 10.000,00MT a 12.000,00MT com o qual sustenta a família e poupa algum para investir na sua obra.

Este e o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku, mas já trabalhou com outra instituição de credito denominada FDM onde se beneficiou de três financiamentos para reforçar o seu negocio. 
Conheceu a Hluvuku através da oficial de credito da mesma tendo aproximado e solicita o presente empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00MT, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia e outros).

Pretende concluir o seu empréstimo sem problemas, para poder aceder a mais créditos a fim de concluir a sua obra e compra de uma Geleira.
texts.en:
Ana M. is from Maputo, Mozambique. She's 35 and a single mother of three children aged 19, 14 and 11. The two younger ones are students. She finished 6th grade but had to drop school because her parents could no longer support her. She lives in her own house and in the top of her children she also supports a brother who lives with them. She's been working as a salersperson for the past 12 yeras. She works 8 hours a day and has no employees. She learned the business with her parents. Her monthly income varies between 10.000,00MT and 12.000,00MT (U$340 to U$400), money that she uses to support her family and finish building her house. This is her first loan and she's asking for 15.000,00MT (U$525) in order to buy construction supplies (cement, iron, sand and others). She plans on paying this without a problem so she can ask for other loans to finish the house and buy a freezer.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 58 años de edad, es separado y vive junto a un hermano que tienes necesidades especiales en el caserío El Morante, distrito de Olmos, ubicado a tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 40 años se dedica a la críanza de animales menores (ovejas, cerdos y chivos) los cuales ofrece en venta a los compradores que lo visitan en su caserío. Esta es la única fuente de ingresos con la que Manuel afronta los gastos económicos familiares y apoya a su hermano.

El ha pensado en ampliar su negocio con la compra de más ovejas para criarlas y venderlas, ya que cuenta con suficiente espacio para su pastoreo. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es tener un establo implementado para la crianza de ganado vacuno. El es una persona muy conocida y estimada por los vecinos de la zona que lo consideran un hombre honrado y trabajador.
texts.en:
Manuel, 58, is separated and lives with a brother, who has special needs, in the El Morante farmstead, Olmos district, located three and half hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 40 years he has raised small animals (sheep, pigs, goats) which he then offers for sale to buyers who visit his farm. This is the only source of income with which Manuel meets his family's expenses and suppots his brother. He has thought of expanding his business by purchasing more sheep to raise and sell since he has enough space por pasture. For this reason, he is asking for his first, 1,000 sol loan, from Edpyme Alternativa. His greatest desire is to have an equipped cowshed to raise cattle. He is well-known and liked by his neighbors who consider him to be an honest and hard-working man.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rebeca Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia YOLANDA pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia tiene 34 años D. edad, es divorciada tiene dos hijos y es padre y madre para sus hijos. La socia y sus hijos viven en la provincia D. Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte D. la ciudad del Cusco. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda D. venta D. celulares y una librería. Ya son varios años que trabaja y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la librería papel D. regalo, peluches y tarjetas naviD.ñas y para la tienda D. celulares accesorios para celulares alusivos a la navidad, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Vilcanota”. She is 34 years old and divorced, so she has to be both mother and father to her two children. Yolanda lives in the province of Urubamba, which is north of the city of Cusco. She has a bookstore and a small shop where she sells mobile phones. Yolanda has been in business for a number of years and has done well thanks to all of her efforts. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who wants to succeed for the sake of her children.

Yolanda is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her bookstore such as gift wrapping paper, stuffed toys, and Christmas cards. For her mobile phone shop, she will purchase phone accessories that are difficult to find during Christmas. The increased business capital will help her generate more income so that she can proviD. her children with a better quality of life.

Yolanda is grateful for this opportunity and promises to submit her payments on the scheduled due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire merchandise for her bookstore & mobile phone shop

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia Macaro is a 48-year old single woman who lives in the village of Brgy Alimango Escalante City Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by fishing. She dreams that her business will continue to help her family and she wants to buy another fishing boat.

Rosalia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 to help improve the quality of life of her family.  With the help of her loans she has increased her family's income. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000.

Rosalia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 17,000 was used to fund operations of her fishing business and it has had a positive impact on her business and family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 10th cycle loan, Php 17,000, to use on fishing.  Rosalia is working  hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family; to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.
--------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros  Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of  thousands of women through Project <i>Dungganon</i> (a Hiligaynon  word that means <u>Honorable</u>). Through the alleviation program,  NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to  achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path  that will ultimately make them <i>Dungganon</i> - a title of esteem  that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through  a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for fishing.

loans.name: Alma Yamileth

texts.es: Alma Yamileth T. C. de 20 años de edad, reside en el municipio de El Transito, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive en la casa de sus padres, junto a ellos y su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad. Ella posee un comedor en el cual elabora desayunos y almuerzos. Debido a que dicho negocio esta ubicado adentro del mercado de El Transito, posee muy buenas ventas ya que este es un lugar el cual es muy visitado por las personas. Alma solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar verduras y granos básicos, las cuales le permitan elaborar mayor variedad de alimentos, así mismo comprar bebidas y golosinas.
texts.en:
Alma Yamileth T. C. is 20 years old and lives in El Transito township in the Usulután district. She lives in the house of her parents, together with them and her life partner and their little 4-year-old child. Alma has a market stand where she prepares breakfasts and lunches. Thanks to the location of this business inside the market of El Transito, she has very good sales, since this is a place that is visited by many people. Alma is applying for a loan with which she will be able to buy vegetables and basic ingredients, which will allow her to prepare a greater variety of foods, and also to buy drinks and candies.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables and basic ingredients

location.town: El Transito, departamento de San Miguel

loans.name: Cheang

texts.en: Cheang L., 24, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She has one child living at home to support. Cheang weaves silk scarves and sell them at the local market to earn a living. She is able to make about $2 USD of profit each day. Her husband, pictured with his wife, is a back hoe driver and makes $5 USD a day. Cheang L. is asking for a loan of $500 USD for her husband to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: La Trinite De Grand Basin Group

texts.en:
“La Trinite de Grand Basin” is comprised of fifteen male and female entrepreneurs. After successfully repaying their first loan, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with their second loan. 

Roseline D. is one of three representatives for the group. She is a married woman with 4 children ranging from 9 to 20 years old. This hard-working mom is a long time business person who splits her time between two business activities. She sells unprepared food, including rice, beans, oil, and sugar, in the local marketplace. Then, in the evening, she sells fried foods in the town square. 

She is thankful for the presence of Esperanza in the area because they have allowed many people to get back on their feet. She dreams of being able to build a house with her increased business profits and leave something behind for her children. On behalf of Roseline, La Trinite de Grand Basin, and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, and vegetables

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana M. is from the village of Barangay 18A, Gingoog City. She is 56 years old. Mariana is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a food stall (painitan), selling snacks and offering coffee in the local community. Mariana has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mariana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Mariana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family and to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Sam Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam Ol S. is 34 years old and a villager who lives in Damnak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Rattana Sen, is a taxi driver who earns a small income to support his family.

Mrs. Sam Ol S. is now requesting 2,000,000 Riels from AMK to purchase a cow for cow breeding, and the rest of the loan she will use to purchase two wheels for her husband's car. This couple has three children:  two of them are students in the local school, while the youngest one stays at home.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzvimindfa B. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay. She is 50 years old and married with seven children. To make a living, she manages her business making sawali (woven split bamboo mats used to construct walls). This project helps her improve her family's status. Both adults work on this project but their main source of income comes from their own farm. They earn more from their business during the summer season. Luzvimindfa joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 5,000 from PMPC which was used to expand her business. As of now, she has a new loan of 7,000 from PMPC. This loan is intended for additional business capital.

loans.use: Additional capital for sawali making

loans.name: Khadiatou

texts.en:
Khadiatou Konaté is 33 years old, unmarried, and responsible for one child. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" Diamaguene1 for two years and has always paid back her loans.

Madame Konaté sells a wide range of products, mainly groceries and sanitary products. She will use the loan to bolster her shop with more products, namely rice and oil.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and oil

loans.name: Mario José

texts.es:
El señor Mario José C. V., es casado y con un hijo, él señor C. tiene la edad de 28 años, y radica en el barrio de la borgoña, su esposa es secretaria, y le aporta a los gastos del hogar, ellos son agricultores desde hace 12 años.

Dentro de las necesidades que los agobian como pareja, está la remodelación de su vivienda, que amenaza con la seguridad de la familia y la salud de los mismos, ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra  de fertilizantes y fungicidas que le brinden un mantenimiento óptimo a las tierras y garanticen una buena cosecha, a fin de alcanzar un aumento en las utilidades y con esto la posibilidad de realizar las remodelaciones a su hogar  en bien de su pequeño hijo. Este es su tercer préstamo gracias a los fondos Kiva, ha sido gracias a estos préstamo que ha invertido en su cosecha, pero la buena administración del dinero le ha brindado la posibilidad de realizar pequeñas mejoras a su vivienda, a futuro espera tener los recursos necesarios para terminar con las remodelaciones a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sr. Mario José C. V. is 28 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in the neighborhood of Borgoña. His wife works as a secretary and helps with the household expenses. They both have been farming for 12 years.

One of the pressing needs for this couple is the renovation of their home because its current condition threatens the safety of their family and their own health. Mario is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and fungicides so that he can maintain his land to ensure optimal conditions for a good harvest. This will allow him to increase his earnings so that he can proceed with the repairs to his home for the sake of his young child. Thanks to the funds from Kiva, Mario will be receiving his third loan. He is appreciative of this investment in his crops and good money management will help make small improvements to his house possible. In the future, he hopes to have all the necessary resources to finish the renovations to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & fungicides

loans.name: Huth

texts.en: Huth H. is a 42-year-old village woman wH. has worked as a fish catcher since she was single. She goes with her husband to fish along the river. When she is done fishing, she sells the fish, which allows her to earn approximately $4 a day. The humble couple has six children:  two are married and the other four are single. As fishing season approaches, the river is full of fish but the family lacks fishing equipment. Huth H. is applying for a loan to purchase additional fishing supplies to support her business activities.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment in order to support her business activities.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Casablanca, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope, un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayoría de su población dispersa en zonas rurales dedicadas pincipalmente a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y quince minutos de camino desde la ciudad de Chiclayo.

De dedica desde hace cuatro años a labores relacionadas con la agricultura, se dedica principalmente a la crianza y venta de animales: el cría aves de corral, cerdos, chivos y vacas en unos corrales ubicados cerca de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen desarrollo son vendidos a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de veduras: el compra verduras a los agricultores que siembran por la zona y las vende los fines de semana en el mercado de su distrito. Estas actividades le ayudan a solventar la economía familiar. 

Edilberto desea comprar alimento balanceado para mejorar la calidad de sus animales y de esa manera poder venderlos a un mejor precio, para lograr su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles.

Edilberto es un hombre que siempre está buscando la manera de sacar adelante a su familia, su esposa también trabaja vendiendo pescado los fines de semana y juntos planean seguir trabajando para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edilberto, 34, is married and has four children; he lives with his family in Casablanca, a rural zone that is in Mórrope district, a district noted for having most of its inhabitants scattered among rural areas dedicated mostly to farming and animal-raising. It is part of Lambayeque province and is located an hour and fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has been in farming for the last 4 years, principally raising animas, barnyard fowl, pigs, goats and cows, in some corrals located near his home. When the animals reach proper sales weight they are sold to merchants that regularly come by the area. In addition, he sells vegetables that he buys direct from farmers, at his area’s weekend markets. These activities help him meet household expenses. Edilberto wants to buy nutritionally balanced feed to improve the quality of his animals so that he can sell them for a better price. To reach this goal he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for his first, 1600 new sol, loan. Edilberto is a man who is always looking for ways to get his family ahead in life; his wife also works selling fish on the weekend and together they intend to continue to work to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Santos M. M. tiene 62 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos que dependan de ella, todos ya se casaron, una vive en los estados unidos de quien recibe remesas cada mes.
Maria vive en la Aldea Bajos de la Flor Langue Valle, tiene mas de 57 años de vivir ahí.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar refrescos al por mayor, desde hace unos años tambien vende granos basicos al por mayor
su deseo es que las ventas se mejoren ya que debido a las constantes lluvias las ventas estan bajas.
\
texts.en:
Maria Santos M. M. is 62 years old. She is single and has no dependant children as they have all already married. One of them lives in the USA and sends her money every month. Maria has lived in Aldea Bajos de la Flor Langue Valle for over 57 years. She will use the loan to buy soft drinks in bulk. She has also been selling basic grains in bulk for a few years. She hopes that sales will improve as they are currently down due to the constant rain.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks

loans.name: Segnon Marie

texts.fr: H. segnon marie a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail des bassines et des des produits cosmétiques, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2005, sa clientèle se compose en grande majorité de femmes. Elle veut se réapprovisionner et réaliser des chiffres d’affaire plus élevés ; elle sollicite du crédit pour l’achat de 16 bassines en plastique et divers produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
H. Segnon Marie earns her living retailing basins and cosmetics. She has been in this business since 2005, and her clientele is mostly composed of women. She wants to restock and raise her turnover. She is asking for a loan to buy 16 plastic basins and various cosmetics.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of plastic basins and cosmetics

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.es:
Ambrosia es soltera, tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la universidad y su mayor sueño es que ellos culminen sus estudios, Ambrosia vive en una casa alquilada y su meta es ahorrar lo suficiente y comprar un terreno para construir su casa. 
Ambrosía es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca y durante este tiempo aprendió a ser puntual y sobre todo a ahorrar, Ambrosia vende emoliente (bebida caliente de hierbas y semillas de lino con propiedades curativas), actividad que realiza por las mañanas y noches, cuenta con una carreta con la cual se ubica en un jirón transitado. Además en sus tiempos libres Ambrosia trabaja en una empresa embolsando productos. Ambrosia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y hierbas.
texts.en:
Ambrosia is single and has two children studying at university and her biggest dream is for them to finish their studies. Ambrosia lives in a rented house and her goal is to save enough to buy land and build her house. Ambrosia is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca." As a member of the bank she has learned to be punctual and above all to save. Ambrosia sells "emolliente" (a hot herb drink with flax seeds and healing properties), which she does in the mornings and nights from a cart she stations on a well traveled street. In addition, in her free time Ambrosia works for a company bagging products. Ambrosia needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of sugar and herbs.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and herbs.

loans.name: Buenaventurada

texts.en:
Buenaventurada R. is from the village of Mitimos, Rizal. She is 59 years old, married, and has two adult children. To make a living, Buenaventurada grows corn and sells it in the local community. Buenaventurada has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Buenaventurada joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Buenaventurada has successfully repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP. Buenaventurada is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used for corn production. This loan is Buenaventurada's eighth loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to help Field Partners continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for corn production

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson S. is from the village of Sta.Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 52 years old. Nelson is separated from his spouse and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Nelson owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing mechanical services, "motor repair", to local community members. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Nelson joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for his business. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Nelson from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:
