GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Erving Manuel

texts.es: El señor Erving Manuel A. C. es un joven de 24 años vive en la comunidad de los Ríos, es soltero sin hijos trabajador desde muy temprana edad, con el apoyo de sus padres pudo adquirir un terreno para laborar en esta actividad, ahora tiene  una experiencia de más de 15 años, uno de sus planes primordiales para el negocio está la diversificación de sus cultivos, pero para llegar a realizar esta inversión desea brindarle un mantenimiento optimo a sus terrenos, y para esto solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insumos vegetativos que permitan atacar la afectación de plagas y los problemas del suelo, esta inversión favorecerá su economía para la inversión a futuro de nuevos fuentes de trabajo o la reinversión a su negocio, y de esta mnera irse labrando su futuro y estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Mr. Ervin Manuel A. C. is a young man, 24 years of age, living in the community of Los Rios. He is single and has no children. He has worked since a very young age and with the support of his parents he was able to acquire a plot of land to cultivate. He has 15 years' experience in the business. One of his primary goals is to diversify his harvests. But to be able to have invest in such a venture he needs to carry out some needed maintenance to his land. To this end he requests a loan, to purchase fertilizers, fungicides, and agricultural products that will help him combat the pests and to enrich the soil. The investment will translate to better earnings, for the creation of new sources of income or reinvestment in his agricultural business. This way he plans on forging a future for himself and achieve financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his plantations.

loans.name: Bùi

texts.en:
T. Bùi Thị (20213050022) is a 26 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, T. owns a furniture business, making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  T. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month. 

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA used to purchase raw materials to expand her product offering. T. is requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. The loan will be the fourth taken out by T. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Bùi Thị (20213050022) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở T. phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena D. is 64 years old and married with two children. Her eldest son is a graduate of Marine Engineering while her daughter finished high school. Elena is an active member of Ahon sa HIrap, Inc. (ASHI) – MFI partner of KIVA in the Philippines. Elena's prime sources of income are her variety store and her business of buying and selling sandals, slippers, barbecue sticks and charcoal. After almost 3 years of operating these businesses, her income is good and can provide for the family's daily needs.

Elena is applying for a new loan to provide additional capital for her buying and selling business and variety store. She will buy barbecue sticks (sticks made of bamboo), more slippers, and sacks of charcoal to sell and display in her store. She will also use part of the loan to buy additional grocery products for her store. She hopes that she can continue earning profits so that she can provide for the family's daily needs. Her dream is to live in a nice house and have stable income.

loans.use: to buy slippers, charcoal, barbecue sticks and grocery products

loans.name: Buenaventura Vivar

texts.es:
Buenaventura Vivar Sánchez M. tiene 50 años. Es casado  vive con los hojas y la esposa, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Buenaventura pertenece a la Ventanilla Dole ubicada en el recinto del mismo nombre perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría al cultivo de banano esta ventanilla tiene 16 miembros.

Buenaventura trabaja en la agricultura siembra banano en una hacienda que arrienda,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener una casa y dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Buenaventura Vivar Sánchez M. is 50 years old.  He is married and lives with his children and wife.  He lives in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Ríos Province.  He has 2 children.  

Buenaventura belongs to the Dole communal bank located in the precinct of the same name belonging to the Puerto Pechiche parish, Pueblo Viejo canton. It is a group that is dedicated to farming crops with a short growing cycle, mostly the cultivation of bananas.  This group has 16 members.  

Buenaventura works in agriculture.  He sows bananas in an estate that he leases. He buys the seeds in Guayaquil and sells his bananas in the areas near his house and in the market of Ventanas.  

He requests the loan for the purchase of merchandise to expand his business.  The support of the loan would help him economically to supply his needs.  His dream is to have a house and to be able to send his children to school.  

He likes to work in the country.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Fiorella Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. H. G. Fiorella Patricia no tiene carga familiar y vive con su madre. 
Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y además también trabaja en una botica de un hospital. Cuenta con un negocio en su mismo domicilio, el cual tiene afluencia de público.
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio para la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
H. G. Fiorella Patricia is single without children and lives with her mother.

She works selling beauty products and also works in a pharmacy in a hospital.  She runs her beauty products business out of her home with a storefront that is open to the public.

She is seeking a loan to invest in her business for the Christmas season.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Primera Esperanza 5 Group

texts.en:
Martha is the coordinator of her group 'Primera Esperanza 5', which translates as 'First Hope 5'. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Martha lives in the Hato Mayor region of the Dominican Republic, located in the east of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture. Martha's community, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from a constant shortage of running water and electricity. As well as Dominicans, Haitian immigrants make up a large proportion of Martha's community.
  
She has owned an underwear business (selling a variety of garments) for three years now and is applying for a loan to invest in stock to try and grow her business. She has previously taken out loans with Esperanza International (Kiva's Field Partner in the Dominican Republic and Haiti) but this will be her (and her group's) first Kiva loan. Martha will use her first loan with Esperanza to set up her business. She says that, since then, subsequent loans have allowed her to successfully grow the business. As a result, Martha says that her family has benefited, as has her local community, because now they don't have to travel so far to buy underwear. 

Martha says that her favorite pastimes are studying and spending time with her children. She also says that her most difficult challenge is finding the money to complete her studies. Her dream is simple, and applies to both the present and the future. She simply wants to keep doing things that make her a good person.

loans.use: To invest in underwear business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia B. is from the village of San Jose. She is 54 years old. Delia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 40000 PHP per harvest.

In 2007, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

Delia is requesting a new loan of 37000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Delia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane E. is from the village of Acad, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 26 years old. Jane is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jane owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Jane is just starting this business.

In 2008, Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Jane is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the third loan taken out by Jane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Yeni

texts.en: Yeni belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 38 years old and single with no children. Yeni is a street vendor selling toys, clothes, and shoes. She will traves to Tacna, Peru, a town on the Chilean border, to purchase more toys, clothes, and shoes once she receives the loan. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her toy, clothes, and shoe sales business

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is from the village Dos, Katipunan. He is 46 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. He operates a family member's business in the food sector, making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. He has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month.

In 2010, Danilo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used in expanding his business.

Danilo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials for his food stall. This will be his 2nd loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his food stall

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu N. lives in the Makerere Kikoni neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members, her mother and father.  

Nulu has a business knitting sweaters.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Nulu sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale and retail.  Nulu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more threads and needles. 

She also generates additional income as a Director of Makerere Aids Widows Development Association.  The main business challenge(s) for Nulu include defaulting by school heads and ever increasing prices of threads.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a registered company for sweaters and to get big tenders from big schools and to own a car.  Nulu lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more threads and needles.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 38-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and four kids. Bilal has worked in construction for 25 years. He is an expert in his domain, as most of his neighbors and those who deal with him claim. In order to improve his business and to benefit from the construction revolution in the region, Bilal is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy more wood and iron pillars that are necessary in any construction field.

loans.use: To buy wood and iron pillars

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to purchase medicines

loans.name: Robelita

texts.en:
Robelita A. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 38 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Robelita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Robelita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Robelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Robelita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Robelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Manuel Arcenio

texts.es:
Manuel Arcenio G. Q. tiene 57 años, es casado  vive  con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS esta constituida por 12 socios esta se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de mora, tomate y maíz, son agrícolas por mas de 10 años los mas antiguos y otros miembros que están comenzando con esta actividad.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, tomate y maíz en grandes cantidades, las compras las realiza en Chillanes en Agro y las vende los días domingos en la feria de Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.


Le gusta hacer deporte y estar junto a su familia

El señor que esta con camisa a cuadros es Don Manuel junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel Arcenio G. Q. is 57 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.  He has two children.

The communal bank "V.R.C. COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS" is comprised of 12 members and located 20 minutes from the office in Chillanes.  The members work as farmers and mainly grow mulberries, tomatoes and corn.  Some of them have been in agriculture for over ten years while other members are only just beginning.

Manuel grows mulberries, tomatoes and corn in large quantities.  He makes his purchases in Agro in Chillanes and sells his produce on Sunday at the Chillanes fair.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  This financial support will help him meet his needs.  He is up against challenges such as plague, sickness and weather change.  His dream is to have his own house one day.

He enjoys sports and spending time with his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase furniture for his hotel

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loA. consists of eighteen members. Mr. Sok, born in 1956, is a village bank president. He was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

He and his wife, Mrs. Eam, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow rice for supporting their family. They would like to grow rice in the dry seasO., but they do not have enough money to cultivate it. Thus, in order to improve this farming, Mr. Sok would like to ask for a loA. to buy a water machine and fertilizers for growing rice. Aside from farmers, Mr. Sok also earned for living by working as government worker. 

They have four children: three are seamstresses in the garment factories and the last one is laborer.

loans.use: To buy a water machine, fertilizers for growing rice.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa C. is married and has eight children. 

For the past 10 years, she has been supplementing her husband’s income by selling kenkey in the fishing town of Elimina. Kenkey is a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough. It is usually served with pepper sauce and fish.
 
Theresa is keen to expand her food business and plans to use her Kiva loan to purchase more maize. This will allow her to prepare and sell more kenkey. She plans to save up any extra money she earns for her eight children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more maize.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 2 children aged 12 and 10. Vivian is a farmer and a hog-raiser. She grows rice and corn. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Vivian sells her harvest and fattened pigs at her town's market. Vivian wants to earn more to better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Eulalio

texts.es: Eulalio de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijas en casa propia. El posee ganado con el que se dedica a la venta de leche y además cultiva maíz, ya posee mucha clientela surte leche a varios negocios del lugar y vende maíz a un buen precio. Eulalio es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo siempre se encuentra muy activo, él piensa que con pequeñas cosas logrará realizar grandes metas en su vida. Eulalio necesita mantener muy bien alimentado su ganado para poder mantener su negocio, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar concentrado para el ganado. Eulalio tiene la esperanza que con su negocio lograra mantener a flote la economía de su hogar y lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Eulalio, forty four, lives with his common-law wife and their daughters in their own home.  He owns cows and he sells the milk and also grows corn.  He has many business customers to whom he supplies milk, and he sells the corn for a good price.  Eulalio is dedicated to his work and is always very active.  He thinks that one can achieve big goals in life with little things.  Eulalio needs to keep his cows well fed so that he the business will continue, and that is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL.  He will use the loan to buy concentrated feed for the cattle. He hopes that his business will keep supporting his home and succeed in giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy concentrated cattle feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth vive en Guanacaste, específicamente en la bella comunidad de Ostional.
Ella vive de la agricultura, pero su salario no es suficiente para arreglar su casa, y el problema es que ya se aproximan la época lluviosa. Es por eso que necesita un préstamo de ₡600 000(seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de  Zinc, madera y los materiales necesarios para reconstruir su techo.
Ella es  socia de la empresa de Crédito Comunal de Ostional, una de las 110 empresas de crédito socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Guanacaste, specifically, in the beautiful community of Ostional.

She earns a living from farming, but doesn't make enough to afford repairs on her home. This is a problem because the rainy season is approaching, so Elizabeth needs a loan of 600,000 CRC to buy corrugated iron sheets, wooden beams, and other materials to reconstruct her roof. 

She is a client of Crédito Comunal de Ostional, one of 110 Community Credit Enterprises (CCEs) funded by EDESA microcredit services in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy corrugated iron sheets and wood for roofing.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 38 years old and married with 4 children.  She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 6 years, and also earns some income from selling rice.  She works hard to provide for her family.

Vilma has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. She has borrowed – and repaid – 11 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla donde desarrolla una actividad comercial y vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 5 años. Su negocio lo inicio hace 13 años vendiendo mercancía variada con un mínimo capital. Gradualmente con el apoyo de un familiar logró aumentar su capital de trabajo y fue agregando poco a poco otros productos como dulces y  artículos para el hogar, perfumes, accesorios femeninos etc., con los que también fue incrementando su clientela.  Judith mediante su vinculación a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ha logrado fortalecerse como emprendedora, mediante programas de capacitación en los cuales ha participado,  formalización empresarial y sus créditos le han permitido incrementar su capital y todo ello su  visión empresarial. 
El sueño de Judith ahora se concentra en continuar  trabajando fuertemente en su negocio, para lograr tener su  casa propia y para eso planea su postulación al macroproyecto Villas de San Pablo en la ciudad,  promovido por la Fundación en el cumplimiento de su misión de desarrollar comunidades sostenibles.  Su mayor desafío es el manejo del tiempo pues también debe responder a sus responsabilidades de madre y esposa.  Mientras sus sueños se cumplen Judith continua esmerándose por sostener una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor de 29%, que planea aumentar con su credikiva con la cual inicia su trabajo y lo dirigirá a la compra de cubrelechos, perfumes y accesorios femeninos, que tiene encargada y generaran muy seguramente una experiencia exitosa debido a su disciplina y gran experiencia en la seleccion de clientes rentables, para lograr ventas a crèdito sanas.
texts.en:
Judith lives in the city of Barranquilla and this is where she carries out her business.  She lives with her husband and two children who are 3 and 5.  She started her business 13 years ago, selling a variety of merchandise with minimal capital.  Gradually, with the support of a family member, she managed to increase her working capital and she gradually added other products such as sweet treats and home products, perfumes, ladies' accessories, etc.  At the same time, she increased her number of customers.  Through her links to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Judith has managed to become a stronger entrepreneur, through the training programs which she has attended.  Her loans have allowed her to increase her capital and her business vision.

Judith's dream is now focused on continuing to work hard in her business so that she can manage to own her own home.  She plans to apply to join the Villas de San Pablo macro project in the city which is run by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo as part of the fulfilment of their mission to develop sustainable communities.  Judith's greatest challenge is managing her time as she must also meet her responsibilities as a mother and a wife.  While she achieves her dreams, she continues to ensure that she maintains a profitability on her sales of no less than 29%.  She plans to increase this figure with her Kiva loan.  Judith will use her loan to buy bedspreads, perfumes and ladies' accessories that she has orders for and this will be a successful experience thanks to her discipline and her great experience in selecting profitable customers, in order to achieve healthy sales on credit.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, perfumes and ladies' accessories that she has orders for

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil and building materials for her business

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan is 45 years old and has been living in Kompong Charm Province, Cambodia for a long time.  Nhan strives to provide the best for her family. She works hard for them in her fields, which are planted with rice and bananas. She has been in this line of work for many years on land that she owns. She feels very committed to her work because thanks to her daily effort she can now enjoy seeing her farming business developing and she is obtaining good profits from it.  

Nhan lives with Phan, age 46 and five children. One of her children is married and lives in a separate house, and other four are single.  Presently, three of her children are employed in Phnom Penh city where they earn a salary each month. To improve the family's living, Nhan would like to ask a loan from Kiva in order to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Yulissa

texts.es: Yulissa es socia del Banco Comunal Paraiso, tiene 34 años, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su recreo (lugar campestre para eventos), es socia de FINCA Peru hace 2 años y recuerda que antes vendía comida en su casa, ahora ella se compró un terreno y su meta es poder construir para poder tener una instalación mas adecuada para su Recreo y eventos. Da gracias a Finca por todo lo que le han enseñado en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en: Yulissa is a member of the “Paraíso” (Paradise) communal bank.  She’s 34 years old and asked for the loan to invest in her “Recreo” (a place in the countryside for events).  She’s been a FINCA Perú member for two years and reminds us that she used to sell food at home but now she bought a piece of land and her goal is to be able to build on it to have a more adequate installation for her recreo and for events.  She thanks Finca for all they’ve taught her in her communal bank.

loans.use: to do some building improvements.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 45 years old, married and blessed with six children in school.  She operates a retail shop selling spare parts.  She was not available to have the photo take at the business, so her husband is in the photo.
Margaret says that she has gained a lot of knowledge on how to run her business through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya.  Her dream is to stock her shop so as to meet her customers' demand and grow her business.  She has requested for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more vehicles' spare parts. (Margaret runs the business with her husband, she was not available to be taken a photo hence the husband photo was taken.)

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Jesus Reel De Bras De Lance Group

texts.fr:
Fred est marié et il a 10 enfants.

Fred habite dans la région des perches d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Il a dirigé son commerce de bois pendant les dernières 6 années.

Fred voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le bois. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce.

Des autres membres de perceverance ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vente de produits alimentaires et cosmetiques.

Fred dit que son défi principal il n y a pas des acheteurs constants. Fred dit que son rêve c`est d` acheter une camion.
texts.en:
Fred is married, and has ten children. He lives in the area of Perches, Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is extremely limited.

For the last 6 years, he has managed a timber business. Fred would like to use this loan to invest in wood. He hopes that the loan will allow him to expand his business. The other members of "Perceverance" need loans for activities such as selling food and beauty products. According to Fred, his biggest challenge is that he doesn't have regular customers. His dream is to buy a truck.

loans.use: to invest in wood.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33 years old, married, and has three children. Rosemarie has been running her sari-sari (general) store for five years. She earns about 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a day. 

According to Rosemarie, through the income generated from her business she has been able to pay daily allowances to send her children to school. 

She wishes for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy grocery items such as canned goods  and noodles to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Ologolimot

texts.en:
Ologolimot is a 33-year-old married man with four children. He does mixed farming where he rears livestock and does wheat farming. He has been doing this for the past five years.

He learned about KADET from the KADET staff. He is currently applying for his third loan after he repaid his previous loans well. He plans to spend part of the proceeds on his wheat farm and the remainder to purchase more sheep and goats for fattening.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children. He dreams to expand his farm.

loans.use: to plant on his farm and buy more livestock.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 40 years old. She is married and has two children. She is in the business of buying used clothing ("ukay-ukay") and selling it in a retail setting.  Some of the used clothing, like gowns, is intended to be rented out. She has had this business for three years. 

Jenelyn has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more used clothing to sell or rent.  She became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell or rent.

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Livingstone, age 27, owns and operates a retail shop in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He and his wife have three children. He is requesting a loan in order to buy flour, sugar, salt, and other general merchandise to offer for sale. 

He dreams of educating his children and eventually starting up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt, and other general merchandise to offer for sale

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married with six dependents. Her husband is a carpenter. Adjoa has sold banku (fermented maize served with fish) in Dompoase for the past 10 years now. She supports her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Adjoa will use her loan to buy bulk maize and fish for her banku. Adjoa will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bulk maize and fish for her banku (fermented maize served with fish).

loans.name: Cristo La Solucion Group

texts.en:
Sonia is the coordinator of her group, Cristo L. Solucion (Christ the Soluction) 1, 2 & 5. Her group is located in the areas surrounding L. Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their 7 children. Only 6 of the children are living together with their parents.

Sonia is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She runs a beauty salon and a miscellaneous store. She will buy some products such as beauty and cosmetic products, clothes, accessories and many other items for economic activities. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. Since she started taking loans her business has been growing and now she has a good inventory and clients.

She said that her most important challenge is to keep her businesses growing. Now she is also dedicated to developing a Colmado: a small grocery store. Her dream is to have an improved general store. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products like clothing, shoes, accessories, beauty and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Ayom

texts.en: Ayom, a 30-year-old married woman with two children, two of whom are in school, has operated a business selling milk in Bor South Sudan for two years. Ayom is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase milk, and plans to use the resulting extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fresh milk for sale.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en: Ayen is 32 year old and married with five children — three of them in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for four years. Ayen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jeanne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeanne est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Jeanne a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Jeanne est mariée à un certain Bertrand. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés dont un est à leur charge. Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Jeanne vend depuis cinq ans, des tissus par le système de distribution. Jeanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The MAHUGNON group is made up of three friends. This is the third time this group is seeking financial aid from ALIDé in order to increase the level of its business. The group representative, Jeanne, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Jeanne is 29 years old and lives in Benin. Jeanne stopped attending school in elementary school. Jeanne is married to a man named Bertrand. The couple has two children, both of whom attend school and are in their care. Jeanne lives with her husband and children. In order to meet the needs of her family, Jeanne has been selling fabrics through the distribution system for five years. Jeanne stocks up at a market in Benin. In the goal of satisfying her clientele and increasing her revenues, Jeanne is seeking a third loan with ALIDé with the other members of the MAHUGNON group. The first two loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Ajah

texts.en:
Ajah is a 28-year-old married woman with three children. Two of them are in school. Ajah has been selling food in a hotel in Bor, South Sudan for two years.
Ajah is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for sale.

loans.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en:
Baby is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. A native of Sanda Tandarin village in Northern Sierra Leone, Baby is thirty eight years old. She is married to a fisherman and the couple has five children together. Three of their children are attending primary school, one is in secondary school, and the other is in college.  

Baby has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells drinks, tied plastic water, plastic bags, etc. With the help of this loan, Baby and her teammates will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Baby will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy drinks, tied plastic water, and plastic bags in bulk to add to her inventory

loans.name: Luisa Alejandra

texts.es:
Ella es luisa Alejandra tiene 19 años, este año empezó a hacer un técnico en atención a la primera infancia en campo alto.
Le gusta esta carrera por qué sabe que le tiene paciencia a los niños, porque  puede compartir con ellos todo aprendizaje y toda enseñanza, desde muy pequeña le ha llamado la atención de ser maestra y hasta llegar a tener el propio jardín, además sabe que en un futuro puede colaborarles a los abuelos, ya que son los que la han criado y han visto por ella durante todos estos años, a la madre la cual se encuentra en estado terminal y complicado de salud y a los hermanos, los cuales se encuentran de los 9 a los 16 años de edad y necesitan apoyo económico como académico, esta carrera significa mucho para ella ya que como lo dijo anteriormente es el anhelo desde muy pequeña, le interesa saber y descubrir muchas cosas sobre esta carrera y podre demostrar las capacidades al estar ejerciéndola y mostrarles a muchas personas que si se puede alcanzar los sueños. 
En el futuro al ya estar laborando se ve con las propias cosas cumpliendo todas las metas soñadas las cuales sabe que con ayuda de Dios, de los abuelos y del propio esfuerzo sabe que cumplirá todo aquello que se ah propuesto a hacer durante todo este tiempo. 
Ella solicita el convenio con kiva ya que los gastos son bastantes y el dinero en la casa es un poco escaso, ella desea terminar esta carrera para así mismo en un futuro ayudar económicamente a la familia.

loans.use: Para pagar un semestre de matricula

loans.name: Fadson

texts.en:
Fadson is a 38-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle fattening along with produce and farming to earn a living. He started this business to look after his family. He has hardships of the lack of capital, theft of his cows and insufficient grazing land. However, he has a vision of buying a fuso lorry.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To roof and fence her business premises and to purchase more timber stock

loans.name: Amidou

texts.en:
Mr. Amidou B. is 46 years old and lives in Agoe-Fiovi where he is active in the commercial sector. He has four children and lots of mouths to feed, given he is from a large family that is very poor. Although trained as an electronics repair technician, he specialized in business right away due to a lack of resources. He has been in business for 16 years. His previous loans were wisely employed and have been repaid. But we must take note that, times as they are, he cannot make ends meet for his family. To do so, he is requesting a new loan in the amount of $950 to bolster his business by making volume purchases at a much lower price.

Translated from French by David Pigott and Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteers.

Monsieur B. Amidou a 46 ans et vit actuellement à Agoè-Fiovi ou il exerce dans le secteur commercial. Père de quatre (04) enfants, il a beaucoup de bouches à nourrir étant donné qu’il est issu d’une famille large et très pauvre. Technicien de maintenance et électronicien de profession, Monsieur B. s’est très tôt spécialisé dans le commerce faute de moyens pour une fonction qu’il exerce depuis 16 ans. Les prêts antérieurs reçus sont utilisés à bon escient et sont remboursés. Mais force est de constater que les revenus de ce dernier ne lui permettent pas de subvenir totalement aux besoins de sa famille. Pour ce faire, il sollicite à nouveau un crédit de $950 pour renforcer ses activités en achetant en gros les articles.

loans.use: To bolster his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in maintenance and repairs for the shop, such as maintenance on the bread oven, which has been in use for nearly a decade

loans.name: Dal Jan

texts.en:
Dal Jan lives in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all of the members of her family. She is a tailor. She wants to help her family because her husband is jobless, and her son is in university. She is the only one who supports her family. 
She wants to take a group loan to buy new sewing machines. She wants to expand her business and make a good monthly income to solve all her problems. She is happy.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Yol

texts.en:
Mrs. Yol O., 60, lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support her family, she works selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her community, earning US$ 3 a day, whilst her husband works as a teacher and generally makes around $1 per day. One of their children works on a farm plowing and growing crops; another one is a worker, and the other two are students.

Mrs. Yol O. is humbly requesting a loan to purchase a hand tractor, which can be used to assist them in plowing and working on their farmland . She plans to use the remainder of the money to increase her inventory by adding more products to better meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase a hand tractor, which can be used for plowing and working on their farmland

loans.name: Ni Wayan Subeg

texts.id:
Although economic condition is difficult, however will power are still high. Together with her husband I Nengah Rabig, they agree to have an extra income by raising pigs. Although their day to day routine work as tenant farmer, income from farming could not cover daily expenses, since they have one child as their responsibility. Making a simple stall behind the home, Ni Wayan Subeg is raising 1 mother pig, and 2 fattening piglets. With persistent they raise and feed their pigs. Every morning, afternoon and evening they take turn to feed them. Profit within 6 months are about Rp1,800,000 (about US$200). Ni Wayan Subeg already have customers who buys their pigs. Ni Wayan Subeg likes to add another 1 mother pig. For future loan, Ni Wayan Subeg hopes to expand the business and to save for their children's education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun keadaan perekonomian yang sedang sulit tetapi semangat untuk berusaha tetap tinggi. Bersama suaminya, I Nengah Rabig, mereka sepakat mencari tambahan lain dengan cara memlihara babi. Meskipun mereka sudah memiliki pekerjaan rutin sebagai petani, hasil dari bertani ini tidak mencukupi untuk biaya sehari-hari karena ada 1 orang anak yang menjadi tanggungannya. Dengan membuat kandang yang sederhana dibelakang rumahnya, Ni Wayan Subeg memelihara 1 induk babi dan 2 bibit penggemukan. Dengan tekun mereka memelihara dan memberi makan babi peliharaannya. Setiap pagi, siang dan sore, mereka kadang bergantian memberi makan. Keuntungan yang diterima dalam enam bulan sebesar Rp.1.800.000,-. Ni Wayan Subeg sudah memiliki langganan yang akan membeli babinya. Ni Wayan Subeg berkeinginan menambah induk babi lagi 1 ekor. Untuk pinjaman selanjutnya, Ni Wayan Subeg berharap usaha ini akan berkembang dan bisa menabung untuk biaya pendidikan anaknya.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig, so that animal population could increase

Membeli induk babi sehingga populasi ternaknya akan bertambah

loans.name: Guzmán

texts.es:
Since childhood, Victor has always demonstrated a love and special interest in planting and cultivating fruits. As an adolescent he learned to work in this field and through much effort has become a diligent farmer and has cultivated his fertile land to receive nature’s best products. Through these activities he’s been able to support his home which is comprised of two young children with another on the way; because of the pregnancy he had to help his wife with her seamstress work. Now in the prime of his 34 years, he continues to work for his children and his family. He already knows how he will go about increasing production and sales of his products, thus working towards a better quality of life as the products will be in high demand in the area. This way they’ll be able settle the household expenses and save enough to offer his family comfort and well being. He hopes to count on your support to complete his plans through a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Víctor, desde pequeño siempre mostró un gran cariño y especial interés por las labores de siembra y cultivo de frutas, ya de joven aprendió a pulir esta capacidad y con mucho esfuerzo llegó a convertirse en un diligente agricultor y a obtener los mejores productos que le ofrece la naturaleza a través de sus fértiles tierras de cultivo.Con esta actividad ha podido contribuir satisfactoriamente con su hogar que esta compuesto por dos hijos menores y uno que esta próximo a nacer por lo cual, Víctor, tuvo que dedicarse a apoyar a su esposa en su labor de costurera, sin embargo ahora en la plenitud de sus 34 años de edad, continúa esforzándose por sus hijos y su familia.Y ha contemplado el proyecto de incrementar la producción y venta de sus productos otorgándoles mayor calidad por la buena demanda que estos tienen en la actualidad, para que de esta manera puedan solventar los gastos de su hogar y ahorrar lo necesario para ofrecerle comodidad y bienestar a su familia. Cuenta con vuestro apoyo para llevar a cabo sus planes a través de un préstamo.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of seeds and fertilizers for his farming land.

loans.name: Ni Komang Warti

texts.id:
Ni Komang Warti as a mother has a hobby of farming pigs. With an initial capital of Rp5,00,000 (translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00), Warti bought 2 piglets to be fattened. Warti feeds the pigs 2X/day, mornings and evenings. Besides feeding rice and wheat shell clippings, Warti also feeds additional food, like Banana or talas leaves, and banana trunks. Before feeding, she bathe her pigs till clean. After subtracting feed cost, Warti profits about Rp200,000/piglet. This profit was used to pay for living expenses, and also to pay for her 6th grade child's education expenses. Warti's husband, Ketut Kawiarta, who works in a workshop, also helps in fulfilling living expenses. The house was built simply on rented land. Loan from Dinari are expected by Warti to improve the stalls, and buy additional pig feedstock.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Komang Warti seorang ibu rumah tangga yang mempunyai hobi memelihara babi. Dengan modal awal Rp. 500.000,- Warti membeli 2 ekor bibit babi untuk penggemukan, Warti memeberi makan babinya 2 kali sehari, pada pagi dan sore hari. Disamping memberi dedak padi dan dedak gandum , Warti juga memberikan makanan tambahan seperti daun pisang, daun talas dan batang pisang. Sebelum diberi makan babinya dimandikan dulu sampai bersih, dan kandangnya dibersihkan juga. Setelah bibit babi dipelihara selama 6 bulan, laku terjual seharga Rp.1.000.000,- perekor. Setelah dikurangi biaya pakan Warti memperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp.200.000,- perekor. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya, dan juga untuk biaya pendidikan anaknya yang duduk di kelas 6 SD. Suami Warti, Ketut Kawiarta, yang bekerja sebagai bengkel, juga ikut membantu pemenuhan kebutuhan hidupnya . Rumahnya dibangun sangat sederhana dan tanahnya masih berstatus kontrakan . Pinjaman dari Dinari diharapkan Warti untuk memperbaiki kandangnya agar lebih bagus dan membeli bibit babi lagi.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock

Membeli bibit babi

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
A. Mahbuba is a 36-year-old mother of three children. 

Mahbuba's husband is a secondary school teacher, earning most of the family's income. In addition, Mahbuba earns money selling the national bread called “lepeshka” at the local market. The business has been quite stable so far, and has allowed Mahbuba to improve the family's living conditions. 

Mahbuba is asking for a loan of US$ 400 to be repayed in 6 months. She plans to purchase flour and the national bread “lepeshka” for sale. This is the first time that Mahbuba is taking out a loan. She promises to pay it back in time and is thankful for support.

loans.use: Purchase of flour and the national bread “lepeshka” for sale

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
I am Irshad B., the group leader, from Lahore, Pakistan. I am 54, married, with one boy and one girl. Both of my children are married and live outside the family home. My husband has a catering business and he needs to purchase new crockery and carpets for the upcoming wedding season.

I have several other women in my group who are also in need of loans: Zakia S.’s husband is a construction worker; Zubaida I. will buy a machine which is used to make paper envelopes; Rani B.’s son is a jeweler and wants a loan to expand his business; Haneefa B. sells rice to his neighborhood clients; Khalida B. will invest her share of the loan in her family’s business. All these women are hardworking and need your help to improve their economic status.

loans.use: Purchase new crockery and carpets for a catering business

loans.name: Doreen's Mikoroshini Group

texts.en:
Doreen is 28-years-old and is married with one 4-year-old child. She and her husband also take care of one other person. Doreen has been selling cloth since 2004. She works from 7AM to 11PM and earns a monthly profit of $350.

Doreen has taken out one successful loan to expand her business. She now hopes for another to purchase more inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Zaituni, who has a cafe business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for clothing sales

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura has been a member of the communal bank Milenio for 6 years. She is 36 years old, and married with 2 children, 8 and 6 years old. Together with her husband, Maura makes a kind of bread typical to the region. They use a rented oven and sell their bread around the Santa Clara market.

She is requesting a loan to buy more flour, sugar and butter. She needs her savings to take care of necessities and to grow the business. Her dream is to have her own capital put aside to be able to improve their home and better educate their children.

Maura pertenece al Banco Comunal Milenio, Hace 6 años.

Maura es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos de 8 y 6 años, Maura junto a su esposo panifican panes “chaplas” que son típicos de la región, actividad que realizan en un horno alquilado, sus ventas son realizadas en el mercado Santa Clara de manera ambulatoria.

Maura necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, azúcar y manteca.

Sus ahorros son para alguna necesidad y para incrementar el capital de su negocio. Los sueños de Maura son tener un capital propio, construir su casa y sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FLOUR, SUGAR AND BUTTER TO MAKE THE BREAD THEY SELL IN THE MARKET.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea M. is a grocer and farmer in Chamkar Sleng Villlag in Kampong Speu Province. These businesses activities are good, but Mrs. Kea M. still cannot support the family. In order to improve her family's situation, Mrs. Kea M. now wants to start a husbandry business, so she needs a loan to buy cows for breeding. She is 29 and the mother of two children, all of whom are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Touch Sam, is a motorbike taxi driver, and he usually assists his wife in the field, too. Last year, Mrs. Kea M. got typhoid, so the family spent a lot on unforeseen expenses. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cows for breeding

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristhian M. is 29 years old and married to Lourdes Natalia. They do not have any children yet. Cristhian worked for many years as an employee, but with the help of his parents he opened his first shop in the market. Later, with the money he saved and the help of his wife, he opened two more shops selling CDs and electronics. Today, his business is one of the shops with the most customers, as it is well located in the city market.

In the future, he would like to open a shop selling household appliances. He would also like to study at university, since he was not able to do so while building his business. He will use the loan to purchase cd s, cassettes, dvd s, radios, calculators, sunglasses, and other items he sells.

El Sr. Cristhian M. posee 29 años esta casado con la señora Lourdes Natalia Godoy de 24 años y no tienen hijos todavía.

El señor trabajó como empleado varios años, con la ayuda de sus padres abrió para su primer local en el mercado. Luego con los ahorros que tenia y la ayuda de su señora abrió otros 2 locales de ventas de Cd´s y artículos de electrónica. Actualmente es uno de los locales con mayor clientela ya que esta ubicado en el mercado de la ciudad.

En el futuro le gustaría abrir para su casa de venta de electrodomésticos y estudiar una carrera universitaria ya que no pudo por que tenia que trabajar y sustentar a su familia.

El préstamo es para la compra de cd´s, casetes, dvd´s, radios, calculadoras, anteojos para sol, etc.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HIS STORE SUCH AS CD S, CASSETTES, DVD S, RADIOS, CALCULATORS, AND OTHER ITEMS TO SELL.

loans.name: Farashu

texts.en:
43-year-old Farashu is a single mother with four children, aged 16, 14, 12 and 8. Since 2005, she has been working daily from 7am to 6pm, selling charcoal, firewood and coconuts. She earns a monthly profit of $125 from her sales.

Farashu now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal, firewood and coconut for her business.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Aisha  Heri Ina Mungu Group

texts.en:
Aisha is 27 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 10 and 7 years old. She has been a clothes and fried fish seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

In the past, Aisha has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Aisha is now requesting a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Tatu and Salha, who have businesses dealing with selling bites and clothes.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan Sidibé a 50 ans et vit avec ses sept( 7) enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire à Sogomougou un des quartiers de la ville de koutiala(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
N’ayant jamais été à l’école comme la plupart des femmes de son âge, Madame Assitan Sidibé fut initiée aux activités commerciales depuis sa tendre enfance par sa mère. Evoluant dans le secteur de la nourriture, notamment la vente de la pâte d’arachide, elle a un grand sens des affaires grâce à une trentaine d’année expérience accumulée dans l’exercice de cette activité. Pour obtenir de la pâte d’arachide, les graines d’arachides sont triées, grillées dans un four (très souvant frabriqué localement), épluchées, vannées puis amenées au moulin (pour avoir la pâte). La pâte ainsi obtenue est mise dans des seaux en plastiques.
Pour élargir son activité Assitan Sidibé decida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il ya de cela  4 ans. Après 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement remboursés ; elle est à son troisième prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 1.000 kg d’arachides et  50 seaux en plastique (pour le conditionnement de sa pâte d’arachide). Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Koutiala auprès des commerçants grossistes faisant le stockage des céréales. Elle vend sa production en détail, au comptant et à crédit à son domicile et dans les différents services à une clientèle généralement composée de femmes (ménagères et revendeuses) et de salariés. Son  cycle d’activité (achat, transformation et vente) est d’un mois.
En raison de la qualité de sa pâte d’arachide, Madame Assitan Sidibé jouit d’une grande réputation dans cette activité de transformation des graines d’arachide en pâte. Elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout auprès des revendeurs et des familles désireuses de faire un stock afin de palier  aux fluctuations de prix.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 90.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.Dans l’avenir , elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique afin de faire le grosssiste dans la vente de la pâte d’arachide.
texts.en:
Ms. Assitan Sidibé is 50 years old and lives with her seven children and her husband in a nuclear family in Sogomougou, one of the districts of the city of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Never having gone to school, as is true for most women of her age, she was initiated into commercial work at a tender age by her mother. Developing in the food sector, notably in selling peanut butter, she has much business sense, thanks to 30 years of experience accumulated through doing this work. To obtain peanut butter, the peanuts are sorted, roasted in an oven (very often built locally), peeled, winnowed, and then taken to the mill (for converting into a paste). The peanut butter obtained in this way is then put into plastic buckets. To expand her business, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program four years ago. After four solidarity loans (group loans) that were all correctly repaid, she is on her third individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy 1,000 kg of peanuts and 50 plastic buckets (for conditioning the peanut butter). She gets her supplies locally in Koutiala from wholesale merchants who stock grains. She sells her production at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, out of her home and with the difference public services, to customers generally composed of women (housewives and retailers) and salaried workers. Her business cycle (purchasing, production, and sales) is one month in length. Because of the quality of her peanut butter, Ms. Assitan Sidibé enjoys a great reputation in this business of making peanut butter. She receives many orders, especially from retailers and from families wanting to stock up against price fluctuations. She intends to realize a profit of 90,000 francs per month that she envisions using for covering the loan interest and for helping with the day-to-day expenses of the family. In the future, her ambition is to open a shop to become a peanut butter wholesaler.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Hajrija

texts.en:
Hajrija was born in 1959 and lives in Rainci Donji, a village near Kalesija.  She is married and has a 25 year old son, who is employed and continues to live with her.  Hajrija's husband has a steady job, but he earns just 450KM/month (roughly $300USD/month), which is not enough to support the family.  As a result, she grows vegetables and corn in the fields behind her house and sells the products to her neighbors to generate additional income.

Hajrija requests a loan of 1,200KM from Women for Women International to buy a cow.  This will be her first cow and she plans to sell its milk and milk products at the local market.  All additional income will be used to help meet the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Chok

texts.en:
Mr. Chok T. is 49 years old and lives with his wife and five-year-old child (shown in the picture) in Krang Roung village in Takeo Province. He is an ice cream seller. His wife, Mrs. T. Ny, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice to earn a living.

Because their income isn't sufficient to support the family and build a kitchen, Mr. Chok T. decided to ask for a loan to build a new kitchen.

loans.use: To build a new kitchen.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes C. is a loving mother and entrepreneur who sells vegetables in a market in Carabayllo, a northern suburb of Lima, Peru.  She is requesting a loan, paid back over 4 months, of 500 soles to buy more vegetables to sell.  She has been working for 10 years but is only a recent participant in microfinance; this will be her second loan with EDAPROSPO.  Lourdes buys vegetables wholesale and sells them in the market from 4am to 10am every morning.  With her current level of sales, she makes around 200 to 300 soles in profits a week.  Her dreams rest on her two year-old son.  In the short-term, she hopes to make enough to build her house and buy clothes for her son.  Her life's dream, however, is to work hard enough that he won't have to work in the market like her but instead go to school and become a professional.

loans.use: To Buy More Vegetables

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: A. Chantal s’est mariée avec MIDOHOUNFO Martin. Elle est née a 1979 et elle a un enfant de 15 ans. Elle gère ses activités depuis 20 ans quand elle a commencé sa vente des liqueurs et des vivres. Le crédit lui a permis de s’approvisionner en gros et d’ajouter les vêtements. Elle aimerait acheter les divers en gros dans le futur.
texts.en:
Ms. Chantal A. is married to Mr. Martin MIDOHOUNFO. She was born in 1979 and has a 15-year-old child. She started working twenty years ago selling liqueurs and staple goods. This loan will enable her to get supplies in bulk and to include the sale of clothing. She would love to buy various items wholesale in the future.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple goods

loans.name: Jiguignouma (Bon Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Jiguignouma sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage.
Elles exercent la même activité de teinture et vente  d’habits (bazin), par ailleurs,  elles font de la coiffure et sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. La coiffure est pratiquée chaque jour à la maison à la demande de la clientèle
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Jiguignouma a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des pièces de bazin en gros à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali) des colorants etc. Les bazins ainsi colorés  sont vendus en détail au marché  de koutiala.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 110 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus  telle que l’ouverture d’un salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Jiguignouma group are all married; they have an average age of 35 and on average, 3 children. They live in big traditional extended families in the Hamdallaye district of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know each other because they are neighbors. They work in the same trade, dyeing and selling clothing (made out of "bazin" a kind of damask); they also do hairdressing and are very much in demand. Hairdressing is done every morning at home on the request of their clientele.

In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-growing clientele, the Jiguignouma group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). Both the preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to buy lengths of "bazin" wholesale in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) as well as dyes, etc. The dyed "bazin" is sold retail in the market in Koutiala.

They each hope to make an average profit of 110,000 F CFA over the course of this loan cycle, which will be used to repay the loan and cover the expenses of their extended families, investing any remainder in their businesses. Their ambition is to diversify their businesses by taking up other income-generating activities such as opening a beauty salon.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: dyeing, purchase of "bazin" cloth, and coiffure

loans.name: Mariana Lucia

texts.es: Doña Mariana tiene 55 años de edad, reside en Villa flor sur, estado civil casada con dos hijos de 24 y 26 años de edad, su esposo es ingeniero civil,  ella se desempeña como promotora social desde hace ocho años, uno de sus hijo es casado y el menor esta cursando una carrera universitaria de ingeniería civil, con esta solicitud la Sra. Mariana va ha invertir en materiales de construcción para terminar de construir un caraje. Sus planes a futuro es poder ayudar a su hijo que culmine su carrera, así como seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Mariana is 55 years old and she resides in Villa Flor south. She is married with two children aged 24 and 26 years of age. Her husband is a civil engineer. She has been a social worker for the past 8 years. One of her children is married and the youngest is completing a university career in civil engineering. With this loan request Mariana will invest in building materials to finish the garage. Her future plans are to help her son finish his studies, and to improve their home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to finish building a garage.

loans.name: Melly Rosario

texts.es:
La Sra. Melly C. tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera, ella es comerciante y estudia en la universidad, esta sacando Adminisracion de Empresas, ella tiene 4 años de vender su producto, el cual lo vende mucho en la universidad, ahi es donde ella tiene su mayoria de clientes.
ella vive con sus padres pero el dinero de las ganancias lo necesita para pagar su estudios y comprar libros ya que ellos no le pueden ayudar y necesita salir adelante.
ella necesita el prestamos para comprar mas mercaderia ya que se vende muy bien pero no tiene  capital para comprar mas, .
su meta es poder obtener su licenciatura lo mas pronto posible y asi poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Melly C. is 32 years old and unmarried. She is a business woman, majoring in business administration in college. For the past four years she has sold her products for the most part at the university, where she has the majority of her clients. Melly lives with her parents, but the money she earns is needed to pay for her studies and to buy books since her parents are not able to assist her. To improve her prospects for the future, she needs this loan to purchase more merchandise because, although it sells very well, she has not got the capital to buy more. Melly's goal is to be able to get her degree as quickly as possible so she can improve her lot in life.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of lotion, perfume, creams, talcum powder and deodorant

loans.name: Sabougnouma (La Bonne Cause) Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Sabougnouma sont toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Darsalam 2 de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté. Elles exercent les activités de vente  de bois de chauffe  de beurre de karité. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Sabougnouma a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter du bois de chauffe et du beurre de karité. Elles s’approvisionnent en bois de chauffe dans les villages de  Sirakélé, Signe et Karaba,  à bord de charrettes  d’ânes. Quant aux beurres de karité sont achetés  aux villages et stockés pour être vendus au marché  en détail et  au comptant. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice  de 55 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women from the Sabougnouma group are all married. They have an average age of 34 and an average of four children each. They live in large traditional extended families in the Darsalam 2 neighborhood of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through neighborhood and family connections. They sell firewood and shea butter. They are very much in demand in this business. In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-increasing clientele, the Sabougnouma group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution with whom they are requesting their first group loan. They intend to use this loan to buy firewood and shea butter. They stock up on firewood in the villages of Sirakélé, Signe and Karaba using carts pulled by donkeys. As for the shea butter, it is purchased in the villages and stored for resale at the market for cash. During this loan cycle, each member of the group expects to make a profit of 55,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan interest, provide for the needs of the extended family and the remainder will be invested in the business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shea butter and firewood

loans.name: Thinh

texts.en: Thịnh Thị Nguyễn (no:010105060029)was born in 1985 and she and her husband have 2 children. Her husband works and they have a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. Her family has a fishpond and she wants to borrow 4.142.000 (or 233 USD) to breed duck and fish.

loans.use: to breed duck and fish

loans.name: Josefa Antonia

texts.es: Doña Josefa Antonia García, reside en un barrio de la capital Laureles Norte, tiene 55 años de edad, con cinco hijos mayores que habitan independiente, su esposo es jubilado y recibe su pensión. Este es su cuarto crédito en Afodenic el cual ha invertido en hacer mejoras a su vivienda, con este préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo ya que esta en mal estado y no quiere mojarse en este invierno, ella es ama de casa y su esposo e hijos ayudan con los gastos para la alimentación como para dar el abono en la institución y poder seguir adelante con sus proyecciones.
texts.en:
Josefa Antonia García lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital. She is 55 years old and has five adult children who live independently. Her husband is retired and receives a pension. This is her fourth loan with Afodenic, which she has invested in home improvements. With this loan she is going to purchase construction materials to replace the roof, as it is in poor condition and she doesn't want to get wet this winter. She is a homemaker and her husband and children help with the expenses for meals as well as the deposit with the bank and to be able to move forward with her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to repair the roof of her home with is in poor conditions

loans.name: El Peñon Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Simona de la Cruz V., María Petrona H. V. y Johana Isabel  G. L..

El grupo solidario El Peñón está conformado por las señoras: Simona V. L.
María Petrona H. V., Johana Isabel G. L.. Todas ellas son mujer trabajadora, originaria de la comarca La Reforma, ubicada en el departamento de Masaya, sus condiciones de vida son humildes, trabajan con Adim porque les gusta que confían en ellas, expresaron..

Doña Johana es una joven de 23 años, casada, madre de cinco hijos de las edades 9, 5, 3, una gemelitas de 9 meses. Doña Johana se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas de frutas, las cuales las va ha vender en el mercado de Managua. Ella sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casita, puesto que actualmente vive con su suegra, hacer que crezca su negocio, y darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
Con los créditos obtenidos ella expresa que ha podido capitalizarse y ha incrementado sus ventas.

Este grupo está comprometido a pagar puntual y así seguir obteniendo créditos con Adim, están seguras que con el crédito saldrán adelante porque incrementan sus ventas y así sus ingresos.


Este grupo abona los días Lunes porque, se considera que es el mejor día para abonar, esto porque las ventas del fin de semana son las mejores.
texts.en:
Photo (Left to Right): Simona de la Cruz Vasquez, Maria Petrona H. Vasquez, and Johana Isabel G. Lopez.

This group is named "El Penon" and it is made up of these members. They are all hard working women, originally from the La Reforma region located in Masaya. Their living conditions are poor. They work with Adim (Kiva Field Partner) and they all agreed that they feel great to receive this trust.
