Johana is a young woman of 23 years. She is mother to five children, aged 9, 5, and 3, and baby twin girls, only 9 months old. Johana buys and sells fruit harvests. She goes to sell in the Managua market. She dreams of buying a stretch of land where to build a little house. Currently they are living with her mother-in-law. She dreams of making her business grow and to provide her kids with a good education. With the loans granted to her she has managed to capitalize and increase her sales.

This group is committed to be on time with their payments and so to be able to receive further loans from Adim. They are sure that with the loans they will be able to increase their sales and their income.

This group forwards payments on Mondays because they feel it is the best day for it, especially because weekend sales are always the best.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase harvests of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is 30 years old and single. She started working as a traveling salesperson five years ago. She now has 400 clients with whom she works on credit. She provides merchandise according to what each client needs. Her father also worked in this trade, passing on the family business. 

With the loans she has received from Fundación Paraguaya, a Kiva partner, she has been able to expand her market and satisfy the needs of her clients. She has seen an increase in her income and has bought two motorcycles to help her work.  

Even though she is now living out of her parents’ home, she still contributes to her family’s expenses in order to cover any needs her younger brothers and sisters might have.

loans.use: For the purchase of garments for women, men and children

loans.name: Lucrecia Eduviges

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia C. se ha destacado por ser una dama que vende diferentes tipos de electrodomésticos comercializados en la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario ofrece dichos productos.

El motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los electrodomésticos y para ello espera que su crédito sea otorgado sin problemas y así salir adelante en su situación económica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucrecia C. works every day selling different types of appliances in the city of Chinandega. She is asking for a loan to Ceprodel that will be invested in the purchase of appliances. She hopes to get the loan so she can keep her business running and improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es: Lucía tiene 30 años, es natural de Junín (departamento de la sierra central peruana), hace 10 años que vino a radicar a Lima. Actualmente vive con su pareja, Enrique de 31, y sus hijos Maylin de 5 y Kenyi de un añito y medio. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su propio domicilio del distrito de Collique (a 3 horas y media del centro de Lima). Ella está muy agradecida con su trabajo, ya que gracias a él puede brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida, pues con el sueldo de su esposo, quien trabaja como obrero no les alcanza para todos los gastos, es por ello que Lucía le pone mucho empeño para sacar adelante su negocio. Su atención es de 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y no se puede quejar, pues su negocio es muy concurrido, bebido a que ella es muy carismática a la hora de vender sus productos, siendo muy querida por sus vecinos. Todo el esfuerzo de Lucía es porque quiere seguir mejorando su negocio y aumentando sus ventas. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, en su banco comunal, denominado “Estrella Azul”, le ha ido muy bien, ya que todos son muy puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos para su tienda, con lo cual espera satisfacer la demanda de su clientela.
texts.en:
Lucía is 30 years old, originally from Junín (a department of central Peru). Ten years ago she came to live in Lima. Now she lives with her partner, Enrique who is 31, and their two children, Maylin (five years old) and Kenyi (one and a half). For the past six years, she has sold groceries in her own home in the Collique district (three and a half hours from the center of Lima).

She is grateful for her work, because thanks to it she can give her family a good quality of life, since her husband's salary as a worker does not cover all their expenses. This is why Lucía puts forth so much effort to move her business forward. She works from 6:00 in the morning until 9:00 at night, and she can't complain. Her business is very busy, since she is very charismatic when she sells her products, and she is well-liked by her neighbors.

All of Lucía's efforts are directed towards improving her business and increasing her sales. This is her fourth loan with MFP, through her cooperative bank, "Estrella Azul" (Blue Star). These loans have gone well, since everyone is very punctual in their payments. With the money she is requesting, she will buy a greater quantity of products for her shop, with which she hopes to meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Safarali

texts.en: A. Safarali is 28 years old and lives in Istaravshan with his wife and three children. His wife supports him in their household. Safarali has been working in agriculture for three years and has a small farm, which he has managed to cultivate after much effort. He spends the majority of his time on his farm because he is keeping watch over anything that may happen. Safarali plans on improving his family’s living conditions so that he can offer them a better future. With this loan, he will purchase fertilizers to use on his crops so that he can sell more produce at a higher price. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja, con la que tiene un pequeño de 3 añitos. Actualmente viven en casa de su suegra. Hace un año atrás tenía una pequeña bodega en un espacio que le brindó su suegra en su casa, pero no le era muy rentable porque competía con otras tiendas más grandes. Entonces decidió alquilar ese local como almacén a una empresa constructora y al notar que había muchos obreros trabajando allí, inició un negocio de venta de comida brindando desayunos y almuerzos a estos trabajadores, y por las noches vende comida al paso en la puerta de su casa. Con este negocio lleva un periodo de 8 meses y le está yendo muy bien. Además, a Olga le gusta la cocina, por lo que atiende con mucho ahínco a todos sus comensales. 
Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y está muy contenta porque todos los integrantes de su grupo se llevan muy bien, son coordinados y no hay problemas por falta de pago. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en su nuevo negocio de la venta de comida, comprando utensilios e ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Olga is 27 years old and lives with her husband, with whom she has a little three-year-old. They currently live in her mother-in-law's house. One year ago she had a little grocery store in a space her mother-in-law gave her in the house, but it wasn't very profitable because it competed with much bigger stores. She decided to rent the space as a warehouse to a construction company, and, noticing that there were a lot of workers working there, she began a business selling breakfast and lunch to the workers. During the evenings, she sells food to-go from her front door. She's been doing this type of catering for 8 months and is doing very well. What's more, Olga likes to cook, which means she eagerly attends to all her diners. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is part of a community bank and is very happy because all the members of her group get along very well. They are well-organized and don't have problems with missing payments. She will invest the money she is asking for in her new food-sale business, buying utensils and ingredients for preparing food.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying utensils and ingredients for catering business

loans.name: Mary Luz Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Mary Luz son Mary Luz U., María Auxiliadora M. M. y Tania María V. C.. Ellas viven en barrio Loma linda de Managua.

Mary Luz U. de 56 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de videos y mp3, impresiones, fotocopias, levantado de texto y video juegos. Ella invertirá el crédito en la adquisición de nuevos equipos y video juegos.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Auxiliadora Mendez M. de 43 años ella tiene una pulpería y Tania María Vílchez C. de 25 años tiene un taller de costura.

loans.use: la adquisición de nuevos equipos y video juegos

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthy Nhem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who are located in Tang Nheat village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. All the members in this village bank loan will use the loan that they obtain for different purposes. Mrs. Chanthy N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Chanthy N. is a silk weaver in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave for her customers.

Mrs. Chanthy N. is 25 years old and the mother of two children who are both too young to work or study because they are at the ages of 4 years and 8 months respectively. Her husband, Mr. Tuy Vannak, is a farmer and he also helps his wife in the business.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave for her customers

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is 41 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Her first child is in senior high school and the rest are in primary school.

Vida always works hard to meet her target, and because of that she has acquired lots of marketing and selling experience. She is a trader and sells spices and vegetables like tomatoes, onions, peppers and so on in the community market. She takes delivery of goods from the surrounding villages and retails them to her customers. She sells her goods from the top of an erected table.

She is requesting a loan to buy lots of carrots, tomatoes, onions and spices to upgrade her stock. Vida dreams of saving more in order to take care of her children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy vegetables like carrots, tomatoes, onions, pepper etc.

loans.name: Filitaa

texts.en: Filitaa F. is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Gagaifo Lefaga. She is married and has three school-aged children. Filitaa owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 750 WST a month. Filitaa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Filitaa is now requesting a new loan of 2,750 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 42 años, vive con una de sus hijas en una casa  alquilada.
Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de diversos productos alimenticios como también artículos para el hogar. Este negocio lo desarrolla mediante viajes que realiza a otras ciudades, preferentemente los fines de semana, pues los otros días se dedica al abastecimiento de su mercadería en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad.
Adicionalmente, Delia teje a palito prendas que sus vecinas le encargan y eso le brinda un ingreso adicional para su hogar. Delia disfruta de su trabajo, especialmente de viajar, por ello desea que su mercadería aumentes para que sus ganancias sean más rentables.

Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y es muy puntual y responsable con sus pagos. En esta ocasión el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Delia is 42 years old and lives with one of her daughters in a rented house. For the past 4 years, she has been selling various food products and products for the home. She is increasing her business by traveling to other cities on the weekends. During the week, she is busy supplying merchandise to the large market in her city.

Additionally, Delia knits clothing items for her neighbors who order them, bringing in some extra income. She enjoys her work, especially the traveling, and this is why she wants to increase her inventory to make the business more profitable.

This is Delia’s third loan with MFD. She is a member of a communal bank and is very punctual and responsible with her payments. On this occasion, the loan will be used to purchase more merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is  a 36-year-old married woman who lives in the village of Villacen1, Prk Katilingban, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by buying and selling shoes and ready-to-wear clothes.

Elizabeth’s husband, Renato, helps her run the business. They have two children who are between 10- and 18-years-old. One is in college while the other one is in elementary school. They also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Elizabeth joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by buying and selling shoes and ready-to-wear clothes. Now she earns an average monthly income of  PHP 25,000 from her business activities.

Elizabeth is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 30,000 was used to fund operations for her business and had a positive impact in  both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, she is borrowing PHP 29,000 for her thirteenth cycle loan, which she intends to use for her business. Elizabeth is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family: to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of  thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon  word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon"--a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 36 años es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.Para Juan los días de trabajo comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su motocarro sale en busca de pasajeros para transportarlos , es muy atento con sus pasajeros y siempre esta pendiente de ellos, ya que desea darles muy buen servicio, para cuando lo vean de nuevo tomen otra vez su motocarro. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar por la calles de Juliaca, ya que se distrae mucho, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche.En el futuro espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un nuevo motocarro.Este es el primer préstamo de Juan con  MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querido.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas llantas para su motocarro, ya que las que tiene actualmente están gastadas por el arduo trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan is 36 years old and is a very hard-working man. He lives in a rented house, and what he most wants is to get ahead in life. For Juan, the work days begin very early in the morning, when he goes out with his motorcycle taxi looking for passengers to transport. He is very attentive to his passengers and is always waiting for them. He wants to give them very good service so that when they see him another time they will take his taxi again. His favorite part of his work is driving through the streets of Juliaca, which he enjoys very much. He has been doing this work for four years, and for him, the most difficult part is having to work until the late hours of the night. In the future, he hopes to be able to get enough money together to buy a new motorcycle taxi. This is Juan's first loan with MFP, and he feels the responsibility to repay it on time, since he does not want to cause problems for the members of his community bank, where he is well-liked. With the 800 PEN that he is requesting, he will buy new tires for his car, since the ones he has now are worn out through hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his vehicle

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda E. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Ermelinda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling coconut wine in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ermelinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ermelinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconut wine to make vinegar for her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconut wine to make vinegar to sell

loans.name: Angel Marcelo

texts.es:
Angel Marcelo C. tiene 26 años, es soltero,  no tiene   hijos.  Viven en el recinto Santa Deriana Parroquia San Jose del Tambo perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “Juntos Venceremos”.  La misma que esta conformada por 11 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.
Angel  trabaja en la agricultura desde hace algunos años como actividad económica para ayudar a su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son la naranja, maíz,  cacao, yuca y verde. También Angel se dedica a la crianza de animales en pequeña cantidad.
Angel  solicita el crédito para incrementar sus sembrios.  Su meta es con el tiempo dedicarse al negocio de ganado.  Los desafíos que enfrenta  en la zona son las permanentes plagas a los cultivos, por lo que gasta mucho dinero en insecticidas y pesticidas para el cuidado de sus productos.
En su tiempo libre, Angel le gusta el deporte, escuchar música, ayudar en los quehaceres de la casa a su mama.
texts.en:
Angel Marcelo C. is 26 years old, single, and does not have children. He lives in the Santa Deriana precinct, Parish of San Jose San Jose del Tambo, belonging to the Chillanes Canton, Province of Bolívar. He is a member of the rural solidarity group, “Juntos Venceremos” (Together We Will Conquer). This group consists of 11 members, the majority dedicated to agriculture and stockbreeding. Angel has worked in agriculture for some years as a means of helping his family economically. This region excels in the cultivation of oranges, corn, cocoa, yucca and vegetables. Angel also breeds a small quantity of animals. Angel requests the loan to increase his sown land. In the future, his goal is to devote more time to the cattle business. In this region, he faces the challenge of ongoing infestations to his crops, requiring spending large sums on insecticides and pesticides to control them. In his free time, Angel enjoys sports, listening to music, and helping with chores at his mother’s home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sown land

loans.name: Rosa's Group

texts.en:
Rosa C. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is thirty-two years old. Rosa is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosa is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from selling fish balls and other dimsums to the local community. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Rosa's second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta G. is a widow who supports her family through her general store, fish vending and pig fattening businesses. She lives in Sitio Buhian, Brgy. To-oy, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental with her 8 children who are 23 to 39 years old.  Some of her children already have a stable job which is a big help in the family.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, fish vending and pig fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000.

Violeta Gavillanes is now borrowing Php 16,000 so that she can use it as additional working capital for her general store, pig fattening and fish vending businesses. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 22,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Violeta  aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ndamaiyu Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is 38 years old and married with three children. She has operated a green grocery stall at the Kinoo trading center for some time. She also sells cooked beans to her neighbors and those passing by. She was introduced to KADET by an existing member and this is her sixth loan with them, having had no previous credit history. With this loan, she wants to pay school fees for her son Edward who is in class five at the primary school. Damaris hopes to put all her children through school.

loans.use: Damaris plans to pay school fees for son Edward

loans.name: Aïda

texts.en: Aïda G., 49 years old, married and the mother of three children, has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" DIAMAGUENE1 for two years and has always paid back her loans on time. Aida runs a small restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and dinner. With this loan, she wants to buy silverware and other equipment for her restaurant. The revenues from this business allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of fritters and cassava flour

loans.name: Mayira

texts.en:
Mayira C. is currently in the business of selling local brew at home and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell. Mayira is 35 years old and is married, with a husband that is a peasant. She has 3 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock crates of beer to sell

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena C. Z. de 35 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 17, 14 y 11 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, así mismo vive junto a un cuñado el cual trabaja como sastre, su esposo se encuentra en Los Estados Unidos, en donde trabaja para poder enviarle remesas a su familia. María es una mujer muy emprendedora quien no se cruza de brazos, sino que también trabaja mucho para poder tener una vida mejor y de esta forma ahorrar para cuando su esposo regrese. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa pan, bebidas, crema para el cabello, pasta dental, es un negocio bastante pequeño, el cual tiene todas las intenciones de hacer crecer. Así mismo cada noche trabaja elaborando pupusas, las cuales son un platillo muy típico salvadoreño el cual se hace a base de maíz, frijoles y queso, y así mismo pueda llevar otros ingredientes, ambas ventas estan ubicadas en su casa de habitación en el departamento de San Miguel. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos alimenticios como huevos, más pan, sopas instantáneas y otros más, y también comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para las pupusas, las cuales poseen gran demanda por tener un buen sabor. Ella se esfuerza mucho para poder contar con una vida mejor junto a sus tres hijos y de esta manera brindarles todo lo necesario a ellos, los cuales son la principal razón para seguir trabajando y esforzarse cada día más.
texts.en:
María Magdalena C. Z. is 35 years old and has three children (ages 17, 14, and 11) who attend school. She currently lives with her brother-in-law, who works as a tailor, since her husband is in the United States for work and sends home monthly remittances. María is an enterprising woman who does not like being idle. She works very hard to have a better life and build up savings for when her husband returns.

Maria manages a store where she sells bread, beverages, hair gels, and toothpaste. Her business is small, but she has every intention to make it grow. In the evenings, she prepares “pupusas” which are traditional in Salvadoran cuisine and made of corn, beans, and cheese, though they can be served with other ingredients. Maria operates both businesses from her home in the Department of San Miguel.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy food products such as eggs, bread, instant soups, and other items. Maria will also acquire ingredients in bulk for making pupusas, since they are in great demand because they taste good. She is determined to provide her three children with a better life and give them everything they need. They are the main reason why she continues to work and invest great effort every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store & ingredients for making pupusas

loans.name: Jaqueline De Paz

texts.es:
Jaqueline de la Paz E., tiene 46 años, reside en Jucuapa del departamento de Usulután, es madre soltera vive con su único hijo de 19 años de edad y una hermana, ella tiene un local de venta de café y comida.
Su madre le enseño sobre el negocio, y hace 10 años tiene su cafetín que está ubicado en la unidad de salud de Jucuapa, y atiende a sus clientes en un horario de 6: am -4:00 pm, ella vende pan dulce, café, refrescos carbonatados, jugos naturales y otros productos. Este negocio es el que le permite solventar las primeras necesidades de su familia, y apoyar a su hijo con sus estudios.
Jaqueline, es una persona responsable y trabajadora que ha  manejado su negocio muy bien, y ella necesita un préstamo para invertir en compra productos como son Harina de maíz, queso, carne, aceite, gas, para elaborar tortillas con estos productos y también comprar agua embolsa, jugos y otros artículos que le demandan sus clientes.
Las aspiraciones de Jaqueline son que con el dinero del préstamo invertir y obtener ganancias, dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaqueline de la Paz E. is 46 years old and lives in Jucuapa in the department of Usulután. She is a single mother who lives with her only son, who is 19 years old, and her sister. She has a store where she sells coffee and food. Her mother taught her about business, and for ten years she has had her cafe, which is located in the health clinic in Jucuapa. She serves her customers from 6:00am to 4:00pm. She sells pastries, coffee, carbonated drinks, natural juices, and other products. This business is what allows her to provide the necessities for her family and support her son with his studies. Jaqueline is a responsible and hardworking person who has run her business very well. She needs a loan in order to invest in the purchase of products like corn flour, cheese, meat, oil, and gas (propane) in order to make tortillas with these products, and also buy bottled water, juices, and other things that her customers ask for. Jacueline's aspirations are to invest the loan money and earn money, provide a better service to her customers, and to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Norma Maria

texts.es:
Doña Norma es una mujer trabajadora, casada y madre de familia de dos hijos, desde hace varios años esta vendiendo ropa y prendas para mejorar los ingresos de la casa, ya que ambos niños estudian.

Su esposo labora como conductor y solo con su salario no se ajusta es por eso decide iniciar su venta. 
Como madre lo que mas desea es un techo propio, ya que tiene varios años viviendo en casa de su suegra, tiene un cuarto a parte con sus electrodomésticos, pero no es igual a lo propio.

No han comprado el terreno por que no cuentan con el dinero en efectivo y los préstamo los invierte en mercadería para poder a justar con los gastos alimenticios, estudios y otros gastos.
Con este préstamo comprara ropa de dama, caballero y niños,  así como prendas para lograr aumentar las ventas. ya que tiene poca ropa en existencia.
texts.en:
Doña Norma is married and has two children. She is a hard-working woman. For the past several years she has been selling clothing in order to augment the household income since both of her children are in school. Her husband works as a driver and his salary alone is not enough. For this reason she decided to start her business. As a mother, what she wants most is a house of her own, since she has been living with her mother-in-law for several years. She has a separate room with appliances, but it is not the same as having her own home. She has not bought the land because she doesn't have the cash and she has used the loans to cover food, education and other expenses. With this loan she will buy men's, women's and children's clothing in order to increase her sales since she has little clothing in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy men's, women's and children's clothing to resell

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana owns a small business, selling women's underwear at the central market in Ivano-Frankovsk, Ukraine. She started this business 4 years ago, when she graduated from High school. She followed her mother's example, her mother had a similar business and extensive sales experience.

During the 4 years Tatyana has learnt the advantages and hardships of being in a small business. She enjoys being independent and is ready to work hard to reach her current business goal, which is to start a second location. Tatyana is asking for a loan of 12,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. 

Tatyana is single and this business is her only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Thlema

texts.en: Thlema D. is from the village of Lower Cogon, Agoho, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Thlema is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Thlema buys and sells coco husks, which are used for making household furniture like floor mats. Thlema has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Thlema joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thlema has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Thlema is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Thlema from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Orepa

texts.en: Orepa T. is 43 and married with five children whose ages range from 5 to 22. She plants and harvests taro for sale. Orepa has two years of experience in this business. Orepa needs a loan of 1,000 Samoan talas to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or about $125 per week) to improve/expand the business. In 2010, Orepa joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Orepa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La señora Herminia pertenece al Banco comunal “Las Retamas” desde hace seis años atrás, ubicado en el departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene estudios superior completo.
La señora Herminia tiene tres hijos de: 14, 10 y 8 años.
Herminia se dedica a la docencia y a la vez tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en comprar arroz y azúcar.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, para comprar productos de primera necesidad.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener una Mini Market. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal es la unidad, transparencia y la solidaridad.
texts.en:
Herminia has belonged to the community bank “Las Retamas” for six years, it's located in the department of Puno, she is 39 years old, married and finished high school. Herminia has three children ages 14, 10 and eight. Herminia is a teacher and also has a general store. With the first loan (300 new soles) from Manuela Ramos she bought rice and sugar. She requested a loan of 600 new soles to buy basic need products. Her dream for the future is to have a mini market. What she likes the most about her community bank is the unity, transparency and solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic need products.

loans.name: Thyaka

texts.en:
Thyaka M. is 46 years old, married and has five children aged between 14 and 25 years old. Her business is located in Nwingi and served by the Thika Branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. 

She has been selling clothes, shawls and bed sheets for a long time. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is hawking (selling on the street by calling out loud) over long distances. However she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more shawls, bedsheets and bed covers to expand her business. She hopes to open a boutique in the future. She describes herself as hardworking, cautious, patient and faithful.

loans.use: Shawls, bedsheets, bed covers

loans.name: Aitbubu

texts.en:
Aitbubu J. is a 63 year old farmer, who lives in the high-mountain Ak-Tala region in Kyrgyzstan. She is married and has six children. Her family has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 17 years, which is the only mean of subsistence for them. Today Aitbubu has five cows, four goats, one horse and fourteen sheep. To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, she pastures her livestock in the mountainous areas with native grasses. Also, Aitbubu is engaged in cultivating wheat and holy clover, part of which she sells to the local customers. With the revenues from these activities, Aitbubu managed to marry her two sons and give good dowries to her three daughters. 

Now Aitbubu is applying for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy bull-calves. With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business by means of breeding. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy parts for a motorcycle

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
La solicitante señora Placida P. D. V., es una persona mayor , casada con una hija dependiente D. ella D. 18 años-estudiante, con su actividad ha mejorado sus condiciones  D. vida y ha educado a sus hijos sin buscar otro empleo fuera D. la casa.  

La zona donD. trabaja y vive  es una zona lechera, a ocho kilómetros D. la ciudad, su casa es propia y para esta epoca no hay pastos (sequía muy fuerte en todas las zonas), le han faltado recursos para comprar forrajes (cáscara D. soya).  Ella elabora quesillos con la leche que produce. D. este modo continuara manteniendo a su hija y lograr que ella termine sus estudios, es uno D. sus máximos sueños.
texts.en:
Sra. Placida P. D. V. is an older individual who is married and has an 18 year old daughter who is a student and a dependent. Through her business, Placida is able to improve her living conditions and proviD. her children with an education without having to seek work outsiD. of the home.

The area where she lives and works is known for being a dairy producing region, located eight kilometers outsiD. of the city. Placida owns her home. This season has resulted in no grasses due to a strong drought that has impacted the entire area. She lacks the resources to buy fodder, specifically soybean husks. Placida makes cheese with the milk her cows produce in order to continue supporting her daughter and helping her finish her studies, which is one of her greatest dreams.

loans.use: Purchase fodder for her dairy cows

loans.name: Otuma Ole

texts.en:
Otuma Ole K. is 50 years old. He is married to Leah K. and is the father of seven children. He has been farming his own piece of land since 2007.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan, with which he is planning to plant more wheat and buy fertilizer. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat and purchase seeds and fertilizer.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer in wheat production.

loans.use: To plant more wheat on his farm and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
No one wants uncertainties in life, and our CCT* Partner, Estella E. or Stella for short, aims to eliminate uncertainties in her future and in the future of her children. At 51, Stella was separated from her husband, but it does not make her stop dreaming for a great future for her six children. Stella and her children reside in Caloocan City, Philippines.

Estella's current business is direct selling, in which she buys products such as clothes and shoes and sell them to her neighbors, business connections, and friends. With no official space for her business, Stella faces the hassles of the streets everyday just to bring her products closer to her market, who are people in the community. Estella has been in business for fifteen years now, and so she makes sure that she maintains the business that she has developed. Stella earns around Php400 everyday.

At present, Estella wants to be certain that she will earn profit and help meet the needs of her customers at the same time. To help her continue operations her business, she would like to apply for a Php26,000 loan. She plans to use the money she would get to increase the line of products she is offering to her customers. With these, she makes certain that her customers would appreciate additional options and would frequently come back to her with more orders. 

On her own without a life partner to hold on to, Estella nonetheless makes sure that her future with her children will never be uncertain and full of fear. With a business she keeps up the good health for everyone in the family, she is certain that a life well lived for her family is surely attainable. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: increase supplies of stock products

loans.name: Purreh

texts.en:
Purreh L. is from the village of Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Purreh is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Purreh owns & operates a business making & selling food, primarily preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Purreh has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Purreh joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Purreh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to provide additional capital for her business. Purreh is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the third loan taken out by Purreh from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Karla Karen

texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. Her name is Karla and she is 20 years old. Karla is single and doesn’t have any children.  

She is engaged in the sale of Christmas merchandise, from wrapping paper to Christmas bags and ribbons and other decorations. She buys her products wholesale on the border of Chile in Tacna, Peru. She also sells energy-saving light bulbs in the Baratillo section of Cusco. She plans on investing the loan in the purchase of more merchandise to sell for the holidays.

She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in Christmas merchandise

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna runs a small business selling jeans. She started this business a few years ago on the recommendation of her friends. Affordable prices and excellent client service helped Anna to develop her business. Today, she has many repeat customers and good sales. 

Anna is single. She lives with her mother and grandmother. Her business is the only source of income for her family.

Anna is a highly motivated person. She works hard to develop her business further. Anna would like to receive a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase more winter inventory. Anna's business goal is to open a small store to sell clothing that anyone can afford.

loans.use: to purchase winter inventories

loans.name: Mwena

texts.en:
Mwema is a married woman with eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over thirty years, she has operated a water distribution business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwema faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to start a vegetable business, purchase sacks of vegetables and tomatoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To start a vegetable business, purchase sacks of vegetables and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel C. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, in Camiguin Province. He is 30 years old and is single. To make a living, Abel owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies like fish ball, tempura, peanuts, flour-coated eggs (or kwik-kwik), juices and beverages in the local community. Abel has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Abel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Abel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients and fund working capital. 

Abel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, like eggs and flour. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Abel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for make food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda R. is from the village of Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 34 years old, married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Rosalinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be Rosalina's 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for sale

loans.name: Esi Comfort Fosuah

texts.en:
Esi Comfort Fosuah A. is a divorcee with six children. As the sole breadwinner for her family, she earns her income by selling cooked yams in Abrafo, a village near Abura. She has been in this business for six years now.

Esi is looking to grow her business to increase her income. She plans to use the loan to purchase more yams and other ingredients to increase her sales. Any additional profits she earns will be ploughed back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more yams and other ingredients to increase her sales.

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en:
Sieng S. is a hard-working woman who has spent most of her life cultivating crops and working as a cleaner in a garment factory for some extra income. She is 34, married, and lives in the Dongkor commune of Phnom Penh city. She and her husband have six children, two of whom are now attending school.  

The couple own a few ponds in which they grow lotus flowers. Three months after planting, they harvest them to sell. She has had great success growing lotus flowers, which is an annual process. They are able to plant the crops at least twice a year. With this loan, Sieng S. will purchase a good plot of farmland for planting rice from a villager. She will use the remaining cash to help sustain her lotus flowers.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland and to help sustain her lotus flower business

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is 36 years old and married with five children. His oldest child is 12 years old and the youngest is 5.

Ernesto is a farmer. He tills his own land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He has been growing rice for eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP from this farming. Ernesto works hard to provide for his family. He also makes sure to set aside a budget for his children's education.

This loan will be used to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 30 years old. She has two children  who are eight and six years old. She owns a store in which she sells foodstuffs such as beans, sorghum, and peanuts. She runs this business together with her husband. 

Francoise has run this business for three years and from that business, they built three small houses and they also bought a cow. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as beans, sorghum and peanuts.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a sugarcane farming business in the Philippines and also earns an additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  buy fertilizer for her sugarcane farming business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her sugarcane.

loans.name: Kodzovi

texts.fr: Père de 01 enfant, Kodzovi (il a porté une chemise blanche sur la photo) est marié à une revendeuse. En 2007, il a commencé par vendre des friperies (habits importés de l’étranger). Il veut renforcer son activité dans la vente des habits c’est pour cela il sollicite ce prêt. Il achète au marché de HEDZRANAWOE et revend dans sa boutique.
texts.en: Father of one child, Kodzovi (wearing a white shirt in the photo) is married to a reseller.  In 2007, he began selling used clothing imported from abroad.  He is requesting this loan because he would like to grow his clothing business.  He buys his products in the Hedzranawoe market and resells them in his store.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Miriam Marlene

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Miriam, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de cuatro años. El marido es chofer. Ella lleva en el banco comunal cinco ciclos, es la tesorera del mismo y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días ya que además de ser vendedora también dirige a un grupo de vendedoras ya que ella es líder de un grupo, nos cuenta que deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y luego ella tiene que distribuir a todo su grupo, ella como líder de grupo trabaja más y también gana un porcentaje por las ventas de todas las integrantes del grupo. Tiene más de un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería.

Su sueño es tener una distribuidora de estos productos.
texts.en:
In the community of 30 de Septiembre in the village of Rocafuerte, the members of the communal bank "Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro" meet every two weeks. This place is known for the delicious sweets prepared by the villagers, known throughout the country.

Here we meet Miriam. She is 21 years old and she is married common-law. She has a four-year old daughter. Her husband is a driver. She has been with her communal bank for five loan cycles. She is the treasurer and she appreciates the benefits that she receives from the institution.

She is a housewife who, in order to have her own income, sells Avon brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories). She works every day. In addition to being a salesperson she also directs a group of salespeople, as the leader of a group. She tells us that she sells her products on credit and she takes payments every two weeks. She receives the products at home and she later distributes them to the other members of her group. She has more than one year in the business and it is going very well.

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, skin lotions, cosmetics, and jewelry.

Her dream is to open a distribution centre for this products.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, skin lotions, cosmetics, and jewelry.

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe Benkadi IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Momina, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJENEBA, assise au milieu, compte acheter les intrants et payer les frais de labour (sarclage) pour entretenir environs  1 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the group Benkadi IV are married women who average 33 years of age and three children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Momina, a village in the Commune of Massigui, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activities as winter begins. The crops grown include rice and peanuts. The group members are on their fifth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, DJENEBA (seated in the middle in the photo) intends to buy farm inputs and to pay the cost of weeding to maintain about one hectare of rice and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village of Massigui to a customer base composed of women and men. DJENEBA plans on making an average profit of about 75,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, manure, herbicides, and weeding

loans.name: Bernadetha

texts.en: Bernadetha is married with 5 school-aged children. She is 45 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She sells snack items to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years, earning PHP 2,000.00 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 at GDMPC to buy more snack items to sell. Bernadetha has been a member of GDMPC for a year and hopes to expand her snack-vending business in the market and have a food stall of her own.

loans.use: to buy snack items to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 41 years old; she is single and blessed with one child.

Caroline owns a boutique.  She has been doing this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES 4,000 per month.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member.  She is applying for her second loan for KES 30,000 from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the whole amount to purchase more clothes for sale.  She will use the extra profit to pay school fees for her son.

She hopes to become a prominent business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor, who is 23 years old, married, and has a six-month old son, has been in the grocery business for the past three years, selling mangoes and oranges to customers at the Kakamega market. Victor intends to use his loan to purchase more mangoes and oranges to resell.

This will be Victor’s third loan with SMEP, his previous ones repaid on time. He hopes to use his profits to expand the business, and when he has enough money, aspires to buy a pickup truck to transport mangoes to nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Heidi

texts.es: Heidi de 23 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y su hijo de 2 años de edad; ella inició el negocio de vender mercancía variada especialmente ropa para damas y caballeros,  con tal  pagar sus estudios universitarios; sus mercancías estaban dirigidas a atender la clientela potencial existente en este centro de estudios; gradualmente el negocio de Heidi, ha ido creciendo, hasta lograr  extenderse a otras líneas y con el aumento de sus ingresos, apoyar el bienestar de su hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará suéteres para damas y caballeros y también overoles masculinos, inversión que resultará exitosa porque está fundamentada en encargos que le han hecho sus mejores clientes. Su meta futura es tener un almacén especializado en ropa femenina, masculina e infantil y generar puestos de trabajo que apoyen a las familias de quienes trabajan en el negocio. Mientras esto ocurre maneja sus cuentas por cobrar con una rotación de 35 días, una razón corriente  de 3,16 y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de un 35,38%.
texts.en:
Heidi is 23 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and two-year-old son. She started her business of selling various merchandise, especially clothes for women and men, so that she could pay for her university studies. Her merchandise is targeted to potential customers who are also college students. Heidi’s business has grown gradually and has been extended to other product lines to increase her income to support the welfare of her household.

At the moment she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Heidi will use the money to buy sweaters for women and men, as well as men’s overalls. This investment will result in success because these orders have been made by her best customers. Her future goal is to have a shop that specializes in clothes for women, men, and infants. She also hopes to create jobs in order to support the families of the employees who work in her business. Meanwhile, Heidi is able to maintain an accounts receivable period of 35 days, a current ratio of 3.16, and sales profitability of 35.38%.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's sweaters and men's overalls.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been selling clothes for the last two years in the town of Oloitoktok. She is 41 years old and is married to Zachariah. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan to buy trousers, skirts and T-shirts.

In the future, Grace hopes to own land in the town of Oloitoktok.

loans.use: to buy trousers, skirts and T-shirts.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz Elena se desempeñaba como empleada domestica en una casa de familia y luego de mucho tiempo decide retirarse y montar su negocio de miscelánea con su liquidación.

Ella siente muy feliz ya que pueda manejar su tiempo ya que su negocio está en la casa, además su calidad de vida ha mejorado notablemente y así puede estar mas pendiente de su esposo y de sus hijos.

Ella quiere que su negocio crezca para así poderles dejar a sus hijos cuando ella falte un forma de ingreso para su bienestar.
texts.en:
Luz Elena used to work as a maid in a private house.  After a long time, she decided to retire from this job and use her settlement pay to set up her own business - a general store.

Luz Elena feels very happy.  She is able to manage her own time because her business is located in her home.  Also, her quality of life has notably improved.  She is able to spend more time looking after her husband and children.

Luz Elena would like her business to grow so that she can leave her children a way of making income for their own well-being when she is no longer there.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a determined business man, age 44. He is married and blessed with three children. 

For the last three years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business and a retail shop business to earn a living. He has retained his business because of his good reputation with his customers. 

In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. With the loan of 100,000 KES, he wants to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Kodir

texts.ru: Кодир занимается выращиванием пшеницы и сельхоз культур. Выращивание пшеницы имеет свои доходы. Отходы от пшеницы идут на откорм скота. Но этот труд требует больших усилий. Кодир хочет приобрести займ для приобретения посевных семян и минеральных удобрений. Ведь для содержания жены и троих детей надо много работать, так как он является единственным кормильцем в семье.
texts.en: Kodir is involved in growing wheat and agricultural crops.  Growing wheat has its own income.  He uses the waste from the wheat to feed the livestock.  This labor requires a lot of effort.  Kodir wants to obtain a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.  He needs to work a lot in order to support his wife and three children because he is the sole provider for his family.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita is 57 years old and married with 8 children.

Jelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jelita has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 34 years and also earns an income from pig raising.

Jelita aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Magda

texts.es: La señora Magda se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado; también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la localidad donde vive. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de ganado, para criar, procrear y luego vender. Vive en casa en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la localidad de Palomar del departamento de  La Paz; es divorciada tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que Magda obtiene un crédito en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Señora Magda works in agriculture, raising cattle.  She also has a small grocery store in the neighborhood where she lives.  

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of cattle to raise, breed and ultimately sell.

She live in her own home, which is located in the Palomar neighborhood in the department of La Paz.  She is divorced with three children.

This is the first time that Magda has taken a loan from our institution.

loans.use: to purchase two calves to raise and ultimately sell, as this is one of her businesses.

loans.name: Siisa  Wg Group

texts.en:
Robai is the facilitator of the Siisa WG group. Robai and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Robai takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to grow enough to feed his family and to pay school fees. In the recent 2011 season, Robai had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Robai was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Robai and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Robai will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Siisa WG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Robai is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Felicidad Maria

texts.es: La cliente Felicidad tiene 33 años de edad con la actividad comerciante ambulante (venta de DVD, Memorias, cargadores de celular, audífonos) casada con el señor Ramiro quien es mensajero de una institución privada,  La pareja no tiene niños por el momento, pero su deseo en un futuro es tener familia, viven en casa del suegro de la Sra. felicidad ubicado en la zona de alto Escobar,  El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como ser dvd´s , flash memory´s y cargadores de celular al por mayor que es el comercio principal  que tiene la cliente y quiere abastecerse de mercadería para estas fiestas de fin de año, su deseo es el tener un puesto fijo para poder ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Sra. Felicidad is 33 years old and is a traveling saleswoman (she sells DVDs, memory sticks, cell phone chargers and earphones). She is married to Sr. Ramiro who is a messenger with a private agency. The couple does not have children at the moment, but their desire is to have a family in the future. They live in her father-in-law’s home in the Upper Escobar area.

Felicidad is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as DVDs, flash drives and cell phone chargers wholesale, which are her principle sales, since she wants to stock goods for the year-end holidays. Her wish is to have a fixed stall from which to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy DVDs and flash drives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.es:
Zosimo de 37 años de edad, convive con Antonieta de 32 años, fruto de este amor tienen 5 hijos.
Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de sivia. Zosimo es un agricultor dedicado al cultivo de cacao y café, pero en ocasiones que no tiene trabajo agrícola, se dedica a trabajar como carpintero en un taller de uno de sus vecinos, su ganancia es a destajo. Zosimo en un futuro desea abrir su propia carpintería por que ya cuenta con un ambiente adecuado como para éste rubro de trabajo, lo único que le falta es el capital económico. Es por esta razón que zosimo recurre a solicitar un crédito, a MFP donde fue atendido su pedido. Ahora espera concretar pronto sus planes, el tener un taller de fabricación de muebles de madera. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles, comprará una garlopa (cepilladora eléctrica) para madera.
texts.en:
Zosimo is 37 years old and lives with his partner Antonieta who is 32 years old with whom he has 5 children.

Together they live in their own house located in the district of Sivia. Zosimo is a farmer and grows cocoa and coffee. However, when he has no farming work he works as a carpenter in one of his neighbours' workshops. His profit is by piecework. In the future Zosimo wants to open his own carpentry workshop because he already has a suitable environment for this kind of ​​work; the only thing missing is the working capital. It is for this reason that Zosimo is asking MFP where they attended to his request for a loan. He is now hoping to finalize his plans soon, that is having a workshop making furniture from wood. This will be his first loan with MFP and so he agrees to make his repayments punctually. With the 3,000 soles (PEN) he will buy a joiner (an electric planer) for wood.

.

loans.use: to buy an electric planer.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Delfina tiene 54 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene seis hijos. 

Delfina se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, tarros de leche, conservas, pan y otras cosas más. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su domicilio donde expende sus productos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Delfina requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar. 

Delfina es integrante del banco comunal “Pillao”. Este  grupo está conformado con 13 socios que viven  en la provincia de Cusco del distrito de San Jerónimo.
texts.en:
Delfina was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born. Delfina is 54 years old and married, and from this relationship she has six children.  

Delfina works selling staple products such as rice, sugar, canned milk, packaged foods, bread and other items. She has a small store in her home where she sells her products. She has operated this business for several years, and it is going very well for her. Delfina needs the loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar. 

Delfina is a member of the “Pillao” communal bank. This group is made up of 13 members who live in the province of Cusco, in the San Jerónimo district.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a 59-year-old married woman.  She has seven children ranging in age from 18 years to 35 years.  She describes herself as social and responsible.  

Mwanaisha operates a food stall where she sells food.  She has been in business for seven years and her food stall is located in a residential area.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of ingredients for the food she sells.  She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to pay for the construction of a restaurant. 

Mwanaisha's business goal is to run a big hotel within five years.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a restaurant.

loans.name: Mahoukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUKPEGO est composé de trois  personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Akouèlé est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Akouèlé est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Akouèlé est mariée à un certain Omer. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Akouèlé vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Akouèlé vend des vernis depuis dix ans de façon ambulante. Akouèlé s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin.
