Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Akouèlé  ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUKPEGO, sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des vernis.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Joseph from Kapsowar, Kenya, who is a man from a community not known for farming, but he is earning a living through agriculture. He is happily married, and together with his wife, is blessed with a lovely family. 

For the past 15 years, he has been practicing mixed farming, and because of his experience, he commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers and is regarded as a mentor. Income from milk, eggs, and doing a small personal business has allowed him to earn a decent living. 

Joseph passionately loves dairy farming, and the animals on his farm have been given names. Milking and feeding his animals makes him very proud. Through milk selling, he has had quite good returns, and demand for milk has been growing. He uses his mobile phone a lot, firstly to receive orders from customers, and then to send a message to them when the milk is ready for collection. Because of using his mobile phone, he has had a competitive edge in his dairy business. 

Demand has been overwhelming, and he now needs another cow to fully satisfy demand. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Joseph does not intend to buy just an ordinary cow, but he wants to buy a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce rich, creamy milk. The dairy cow will produce between 10-20 liters of milk a day. The increased milk production will translate into more income, and Joseph will be able to improve his living conditions and secure the future of his school-going children. 

When anybody listens to Joseph speak, one cannot fail to see that he is an expert in dairy farming. With his passion and determination, he intends to beat all odds. This loan will change Joseph's living standards, and there is no doubt that you can find rewarding employment in dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une veuve femme  âgée de 54 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mère de six enfants, Afi est une revendeuse des produits alimentaires et de charbon de bois qu’elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois  au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Afi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches et des sacs de charbon de bois. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne revente, Afi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire puis à leur épanouissement.

loans.use: Acheter 02 paniers de tomates fraîches et 08 sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Dr Beatrice B. an Obstetrician gynecologist is one of the senior member and a consultant to the other junior network members of the KMET Network. She has applied for the loan to purchase a modern X-Ray machines costing US $ 10,418. She is ready to top up the balance from her savings to purchase this very essential equipment to improve the quality Reproductive health services at her facility.

loans.use: To purchase an ultrasound machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her small business in Kibera, Africa's largest slum

loans.name: Jerónima

texts.en:
Jeronima has the experience of 12 years, selling various items such as gifts, toys and foodstuffs. She began with some savings that she had thanks to the help of her husband, her gave them to her. On her own iniciative, she decided to sell lunches from her home. This business endeavor went very well and has been strong now for 7 years. She manages her activities with the help of her family. She works every day of the week from 12pm to 3pm.

Jeronima wishes for a loan in order to buy 2 tables and chairs for her dining area. She already has high demand around lunchtime and wishes to provide her customers with a better service.

Jeronima is married, with 4 children, 3 of whom attend school. Her husband is in charge of selling her product from the stand and in the market. She is the cook. Her goal is to give a good education to her children. Little by little, with the earnings she generates, her business will allow her to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Jerónima tiene una experiencia de 12 años vendiendo artículos como regalos, juguetes y también víveres. Se inicio con unos ahorros que tenia gracias al apoyo que le dio su esposo. Por iniciativa propia decide comenzar a vender almuerzos en su domicilio. Negocio que le fue muy bien y al momento tiene ya 7 años. Combina las dos actividades siempre con la ayuda de la familia. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 12 p.m. hasta las 15 p.m.

Jerónima desea el crédito para poder comprar 2 mesas y sillas para su comedor. Ya que tiene buena demanda de los almuerzos y desea darle una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Jerónima es casada. Tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian. Su esposo es la persona que se encarga de vender los productos de su tienda y bazar. Ella es la que se encarga de la preparación de los almuerzos. Su meta es poder darla una buena educación a sus hijos. Y poco a poco con la ganancia que genere sus negocios poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase tables and seats

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 36 years old. He has a small bakery in Kirkuk. He is working hard to earn more money for his family. He has a big family, and his father and mother live with him. This is his first loan from AL-Aman, and he wants to use it to purchase a new oven for his bakery.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new oven for the bakery

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is 30 years old. She is a married mother of 5 children. She has a small firewood business in her house, where people in the neighborhood come to buy. She has been with LAPO for 4 years and has 10 years of experience in her business. She lives in Benin City and needs the loan of $400 to buy more firewood for sale.

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Orizamoh

texts.ru:
Orizamoh B. is 39 years old and has a secondary technical education, by profession she is an accountant. Orizamoh is married and has 6 children. She has a sales stall in the central market of Yavan called “Mehrgon.” She has been working in this field for 7 years. The client plans to use the loan to purchase a new selection of goods for sale, specifically autumn clothing for children. This loan will give the residents of her region the opportunity to purchase necessary children’s clothing at reasonable prices without them having to leave their city and thereby saving them money and time.

Orizamoh plans to pay back the $600 loan o during a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобохонова Оризмох, возраст – 39 лет, образование среднее техническое, по специальности бухгалтер, замужем, имеет 6 детей. Оризмох имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке в городе Яване под названием «Мехргон» Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 7 лет. На полученный кредит клиент планирутет приобрести новый ассортимент продаваемого товара, а именно закуп осеннего товара детской одежды. Данный кредит даст возможность жителям данного района приобретать необходимые детские вещи по умеренным ценам не выезжая за пределы своего города, экономя свои денежные средства и время. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase autumn children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise for the coming Christmas season

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 44 year-old Elizabeth M.. She is married with 4 children, aged 13,19,23, and 26. In 2006, Elizabeth established a livestock business, and now requires a loan of $525 in order to to purchase additional stock. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional cows and chickens.

loans.name: Sevimnaz

texts.en:
Sevimnaz G., a 26-year-old mother of two, lives in Saatli, a town in southeast Azerbaijan. Breeding cattle is tradition in this rural area, where there are few job opportunities. Sevimnaz has raised calves since she was 14 years old. Today, she and her husband breed cows in their yard to sell at the local market or butcheries.

Sevimnaz hopes to grow her business, which is her family's only source of income. With $600, she'll be able to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. Because meat and dairy are mainstays in Azerbaijan culture, investing in more cattle would be a wonderful opportunity for her family's future.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Bakery A(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Kate N.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries. Kate is 49 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children ranging from age 27 to 33 and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business and diversify it.

Kate is joined in her small group by Jolly M., Mariam K., Mary N., and Annet B.. Jolly M. has a business running a retail shop and wants to add stock. Mariam K. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Mary N. operates a beauty parlor business and wants to purchase more cosmetics. Annet B. is currently in the business of operating a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more food and utensils.

loans.use: To add more stock to the shop

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en: Adnan is 36 years old and lives with his family in Lebanon's Bekaa Vally. He has three children and makes a living running  cultivation projects in farming areas.  This is the first time that Adnan has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. He plans to use the money to buy materials he needs to run and grow his business.

loans.use: to buy materials for a small business

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
I have time to work on my house but I lack the stucco to finish it. In order to have a place to live I am paying rent, which is making it difficult to finish the construction and pay the rent. I request a loan of $1000 in order to install the stucco and in this way bring my family to live in a more secure place of our own.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo tiempo que empecé a construir mi casa pero me esta haciendo falta la losa para ya tenerla terminada. Y podernos ir a vivir hay como estoy pagando renta séme esta haciendo muy difícil terminar la construcción y pagar renta. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls. Para la colocación de la losa y así llevar a mi familia a vivir a un lugar mas seguro y de ellos mismos

loans.use: To stucco the house.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung C. T. is 38 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. She raises pigs for a living, earning about 6 US$ per day. Livestock is often a financially secure business for rural Khmers. Her husband earns 10 US$ per day managing construction sites for a local firm. Together they have three children. The oldest two children have already been brought under their father’s wing and do construction. They are young so each only earns 75 US$ per month. Ung C. T. wants to invest in her own business by storing up pig feed but also help out her husband and oldest children by providing them with fine sets of construction tools to use on bigger projects.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and construction tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase of piglets, feed, and pay for transportation

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sina B., 42, and her husband, Mr. Phally Yim, 45, who live along National Road #1 about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1982 and have one daughter who is a garment factory worker. Her husband has been a mason since 1982.

Mrs. Sina has been selling fruit since 2006. She buys her fruit wholesale from farmers in her village and some from fruit market in Phnom Penh for resale at Kandal market in Phnom Penh. Currently, Sina needs some money to buy fruit "in contract," meaning that to secure a better wholesale price she needs to pay them before the fruit is harvested. To do so, Sina is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase fruit in contract for next season.

loans.use: To purchase fruit in contract for next season

loans.name: Cruz Del Sur Group

texts.en:
The Cruz del Sur group is maD. up of nine women and three men, all of whom live in a rural area outsiD. of El Alto, Bolivia. Most of the group members come from families of five or six people with limited resources and live in adobe houses.

The group is involved in various activies, but mostly in the food and clothing sales sectors. More specifically, Wilfredo, Valeria, Santuza, Eugenia and Salome make and sell clothing (sweaters, skirts and shawls). Viviana, Cristina, Feliza and Vicenta sell food, including prepared meals, chicken, fruits and chuño (dried potato). Santiago is a policeman, and Juan Carlos works as a mechanic.

For the most part, the group members plan to use their share of the loan to increase their inventory or to buy raw materials and ingredients to sew clothing and prepare food. Though there is healthy competition in all of these areas, most of the group members are able to remain competitive by offering a wiD. variety of inventory and introducing new items.

Most of the group members have had previous loans, either with this group or in other similar groups at different microfinance institutions.

loans.use: bulk purchase of food and materials to make clothing

loans.name: Massaran

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Massaran D. est âgée de 32 ans. Célibataire avec un enfant, elle vit dans le quartier lafiabougou à Selingué (une des sous préfecture de Yanfolila troisième région administrative du Mali). Dès son jeune âge, elle démarre une activité génératrice de revenus notamment la vente de produits cosmétique. Malgré son courage et sa volonté de réussite, elle est rapidement confrontée à un problème de ressources financières. Pour résoudre cette difficulté, elle intégra un groupe de prêt solidaire de l’institution Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant trois (3) ans. Avec l’augmentation rapide de son commerce et de sa clientèle, elle passa au prêt individuel et est à son quatrième prêt. Sa boutique est située au bord de la route principale de Selingué et est bien achalandée. 

Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt beaucoup de flacons de parfum, de perruques et autres articles de beauté de femme pour anticiper les grosses ventes liées à la fête de ramadan et la rentrée scolaire. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako une fois par mois et vend à selingué dans son magasin au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes de selingué et celles des localités environnantes. Elle jouit d’une bonne réputation en raison de son expérience et de la maîtrise des techniques de commerce.

Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et désire à la longue instaurer un salon de coiffure qui est une demande pressante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Miss Massaran D., 32, is single and has one child. She lives in the Lafiabougou district in Selingué (one of the sous-prefectures of Yanfolila, third administrative region of Mali). Since her youth, she began earning money, notably by selling cosmetics. Despite her courage and will to succeed, she quickly ran into financial difficulties. To solve this problem, she joined in a group loan through Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. As her business and her clientele grew rapidly, she moved on to requesting an individual loan and is presently on her fourth loan. Her little shop is located on the main road of Selingué and is well-patronized.

With this loan she intends to buy a lot of bottles of perfume, wigs, and other beauty products so as to be ready for the increased sales around Ramadan and the new school year. She does her buying in Bamako once a month and makes her sales in Selingué in her shop, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of the women of Selingué and those coming from surrounding towns. She has a good reputation because of her experience and mastery of her business.

She expects to make a monthly profit of 95,000F CFA which she will use to increase her working capital and she would like to start up a beauty salon which is a pressing need for her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying cosmetics and lingere to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start selling clothing accessories

loans.name: Mutungo Samali-Beatrice Group

texts.en:
Beatrice A. inherited a small plot of swamp land on the shores of Lake Victoria. Seemingly worthless, she found a way to turn it into an income-producing asset. She dredges the muddy clay soil and turns it into building bricks that she sells by the pallet to construction firms. Beatrice is perhaps the only woman in Uganda in this highly male-dominated profession. She employs village boys to help her with the hard labor of baking and piling the manufactured bricks.

Beatrice is 48 years old, married with 3 children aged 5-16. All her children are in school. She started her brick-making business a few years ago on a smaller scale to provide the income needed to pay school fees. This is her first loan. She will use the proceeds to buy firewood for the furnace, pay labor wages and purchase additional shovels and wheelbarrows. Beatrice can sell bricks for a bulk price of 80 to 100 Ush depending on the quantity. In a good week, she will sell 3,000 bricks and she feels her manufacturing capacity could be as high as 15,000 bricks per week. One of her business goals is to expand into this capacity. Her other goal is to buy a plot of land and built rental homes to provide further income so that she can save for university fees.

loans.use: Buying firewood for the furnace, pay labor wages and purchase additional shovels and wheelbarrows.

loans.name: Drev

texts.en:
Drev D., 40, rose above the situation of living without a stable job.  Her family's day-to-day needs and the education of her four children were the problem at hand.  She had been toying with the idea of starting a business selling soap, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar and eggs, but she had no idea where to start, especially finding the capital.  

Her husband is a laborer and farmer and could not raise extra money for the store's needs.  They were thankful to their uncle helped initially fund the business.  With very little capital, they were able to rise above their hardships.  

Their daily sales give provide just enough to support their necessities.  They were able to buy and sell of whole nuts for extra income.  They joined Paglaum MPC in order to gain additional capital and applied for PHP 8,000 loan.  They were attracted to Paglaum MPC for its savings and insurance services of the cooperative.  

They want to gradually expand their little store.  They want to taste the "good life" and have a descent home.  Drev smiles and dry up tears while describing her dreams.

loans.use: To invest in beverages and canned goods for her store

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Safiatou D. a 48 ans et vit dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses six (6) enfants (1 garçon et 5 filles) à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Safiatou D. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès, elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente de pâtes et tubercules de manioc afin d’ en faire de  l’Attieke. Elle a appris cette activité  depuis maintenant vingt (20) ans auprès d’une voisine venue de la république de Côte d’Ivoire. Elle mène son activité au domicile conjugal en compagnie de ses amies. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle, qui vient acheter en gros et les revendre en détail pour la qualité de ses produits.
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle decida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre (4) ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association de femmes de son quartier (Association SABALY de Sanooubougou I), elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel commerçant (PIC) , tous correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 30 sacs de pâtes de manioc (Tièkèdoro) à Bouaké (République de la Côte d Ivoire) et 15 sacs de manioc à Sikasso afin de les mélanger pour donner d’Attièkè de bonne qualité.
Vu son expérience dans l’activité au quartier, Madame   Safiatou D.   vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée trés généralement de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce , contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts.
texts.en:
Madam Safiatou D. is 48 years old and lives in a large family with her husband and six children (one boy and five girls) in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work without success, she got initiated in this work buying and selling pasta and cassava tubers in order to make "attiéké". She learned how to do this twenty years ago from a neighbor from the Republic of Cote d'Ivoire. She works at home in the company of her friends. Because of the quality of her products, she is in high demand by her customers, who come to buy wholesale and to sell retail.

To satisfy her growing customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After three solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, with a women's association in her district (Association SABALY de Sanooubougou I), she is on her second PIC (a commercial individual loan). She intends to use the loan to buy 30 sacks of cassava pasta (tièkèdoro) in Bouaké (in Côte d'Ivoire) and 15 sacks of cassava in Sikasso in order to mix them to make good quality attiéké.

Because of her work experience in the district, she sells her merchandise to customers composed mostly of women, cash or credit accepted. With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help cover family expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pasta and cassava root

loans.name: Nortoji

texts.en:
Nortoji is a very hard-working woman. She tries to make more money for the family by working hard each day. About 15 years ago, she decided to start raising and selling animals. This way she pays for the education of her three children who have high hopes for the future. She raises calves and sheep and later sells them according to her clients' demand at the markets. She prepares them ready to eat for the eating pleasure of the people in her country.

Since Nortoji aspires to a great future, she decided to expand her businesses with the sole purpose of improving her family's living conditions and help pay for her children's education so that they can one day become good citizens in society.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves to expand her business

loans.name: Hydie

texts.en:
Hydie C. is 26-years old, has one child, and tends a small rice field with her husband. Together, they go to their farm, check their crops, and remove the weeds in the sun's heat. This is how they provide meagar support for their family.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to improve her yield. Hydie is also planning to establish a new sari-sari (general) store in their village. This loan that Hydie will get will help her increase her yield and get started to a new business. 

CEVI provides their clients with credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage. CEVI works hard to continuously uplift people's lives. Through CEVI, more and more people are able to start their own businesses.

loans.use: To buy sacks of Urea and other fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Boco Kèmi

texts.fr:
Z. Boco Kèmi est née vers 1973 à Gbèdji, dans la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Boco Kèmi est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants tous scolarisés. Boco Kèmi est une vendeuse de « monyo », nourriture locale à base de maïs accompagnée de la sauce de tomate. Boco Kèmi veut developper son activité et accroître son revenu; mais pour cela elle a besoin de moyens financiers pour y arriver. Boco Kèmi exprime alors son besoin de prêt à ALIDé. 
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Z. Boco Kèmi was born around 1973 in Gbèdji, in the city of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin. She is married and the mother of three children, who are all in school. Kèmi sells “monyo”, a local food made from corn and accompanied by tomato sauce. She wants to develop her business and to grow her revenues. But to do so, she needs the financial means to arrive there. And so she is expressing a need for a loan from ALIDE.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some corn and condiments

loans.name: Nebah Florence

texts.en:
As a mother of five and a widow, Florence supports her large family by farming corn, groundnuts (peanuts), cocoyams and cassava, (a popular root vegetables in Cameroon used in many of the Cameroonian dishes).   She has been a GHAPE member since 1997 and plans to take out this loan to purchase seeds, corn, firewood, and for clearing of the farmland and labor.

By employing others to assist in the farm work, Florence is helping the community through the creation of employment opportunities.  In addition, because her produce are popular items in Cameroonian dishes and having been a farmer for a long time, Florence is confident that her business will continue to succeed in her area.

Since her husband died, Florence now handles all of the responsibility for her family of five children.  They have also confronted sickness and having thieves break in to their home. However, Florence and her family remain positive.  All of Florence's children are under the age of fifteen, so most of the profits from the loan will go toward their school fees and buying additional clothes for them!

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, corn, firewood and for farm labor.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Papaya production is the main livelihood of Mrs. Cristita A., a 54-year-old resident of Garang, Tangub City. She is a member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC- Tangub City Satellite Office. Her husband is a farmer and her partner in cultivating this tenanted papaya plantation. Sometimes her husband performs some labor jobs.

Regarding their business, her main customers are fruit-stand owners and that is why it was not hard for them to sell their products. Now she is applying for PHP 5,000.00 to finance her papaya production, specifically to purchase commercial fertilizers. It is her third loan in our co-op. Her hopes and aspirations for her family are to have their own lot and to give a better future to their only child.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer for papaya production

loans.name: Hayothon

texts.ru: Хаётхон работает в местной частной сауне. Это очень известное место в городе и в течении года постоянно многолюдно. Жители города приходят сюда мыться, здесь же есть парикмахерская, где можно подстричься. Кроме общего зала можно заказать номер и тут же предлагаются прохладительные напитки. Сама Хаётхон находится на столе заказов, где она принимает заказы, распределяет по номерам и кроме этого она содержит маленький магазинчик, где все желающие могут купить гигиенические товары, полотенца, мыло, шампуни и тп. Хаётхон получает займ в МикроИнвест для этой цели. Она подала заявку на новый займ и собирается приобрести товар для своего магазина.
texts.en:
Hayothon works at a local spa. It is a well-known place in the city that attracts many people all year round. Local citizens come here to wash and also to get haircuts at the on-site hair salon. Besides a common area, the spa also offers private suites that come with refreshing drinks. Hayothon works at the booking table where she accepts reservations and assigns private suites. Besides this, she also runs a small store that sells personal hygiene products, towels, soap, shampoo, etc. Hayothon wants to obtain a loan at MicroInvest for this purpose. She requested a new loan and plans to purchase goods for her store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of goods for a store

loans.name: Royena

texts.es:
ROYENA G. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUESTRA SEÑORA DE LA ESPERANZA” vive en el Jr. Huancavelica Nº 433, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 37 años de edad, 4 hijos, y su esposo es oficial de la Marina de Guerra del Perú.

Se inicio en el rubro de venta de comida y el primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, dinero con el que compró productos para preparar comida regional como; juanes, tacacho, pescado, etc. para venderlos a sus vecinos de su barrio.  Su negocio se mantiene estable. 
Con este préstamo de S/.1000.00 nuevos soles, quiere dedicarse a la venta de ropa y por las noches continuar vendiendo comida.

Ella es una señora enérgica y trabajadora que lucha por salir adelante y agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que apoya a mujeres dinámicas y emprendedoras capaces de desenvolverse por sí mismas para un mejor porvenir.
texts.en:
ROYENA G. V. belongs to the village bank "Our Lady of Hope". She lives on Jr. Huancavelica Nº 433, in the city of Pucallpa. She is 37 years old, has four children, and her husband is an official of the Navy of Peru. She started her business selling food and the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos was for 300.00 New Soles, money with which she bought products to prepare regional food; juanes, tacacho (mashed plantains), fish, etc. in order to sell them to neighbors in her neighborhood. Her business is stable. With this loan of 1000.00 New Soles, she would like to sell clothing and continue to sell food at night. She is an energetic and hard working woman struggling to get ahead. Thanks to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that helps dynamic and entrepeneurial women able to function and provide themselves with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba Marina Z. P. tiene 51 años de edad, es una mujer casada. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian con el duro esfuerzo que Alba realiza. Su actividad económica es una librería. Hace más de 28 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Sus inicios nacieron por que necesitaba proporcionarles a sus hijos el estudio para que ellos salgan adelante, y el día de mañana no pase por las dificultades que ella paso, además que esto no le impide salir adelante con su familia. Y es así como solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de más útiles escolares para su librería como cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros, borradores, reglas y marcadores. El sueño de Alba es mantener su actividad económica y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Alba Marina Z. P. is 51 years old, and is a married woman. She is responsible for her four children, who are all in school, working with the same great effort as Alba. She has run a paper goods shop for 28 years, which she started because she needed to provide her children schooling so they would be able to get ahead and not undergo the same hardships that she did. She will use the loan requested as working capital to purchase more school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, pens, erasers, rulers, and markers. Alba's dream is to keep her business going and improve the quality of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La socia Karina, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, entre sus actividades del hogar, está la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella tiene entre sus clientes a las compañeras de trabajo de su esposo que están en el área educacional.

La socia está muy agradecida y valora el préstamo y la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Doña Karina is a partner of the community bank "SIEMPRE UNIDOS", she is from the neighborhood of Santiago of the town of Cusco.

She is 35 years old, lives with her life partner and has 3 children, among her daily activities she sells beauty products from catalog. Among her clients are colleagues from her husband's workplace who are working in education.

The partner is very grateful and appreciates the loan and the opportunity through this means and she is committed to repay according to the timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia O. is from the village of Lantay, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Virginia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. She also earns  income by cooking a variety of delicacies. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Virginia's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and other family expenses. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nigar

texts.en:
Nigar A. is the 58-year-old mother of seven children. She dedicated herself to raising poultry in the small city called Bilasuvar.

After she suffered from the Armenian-Azerbaijan conflict in 1992 she started her life from scratch to provide the necessities for her children. She raises poultry and sells them to the local market traders. The most popular are chickens and turkeys. Nigar is very polite to all her clients and that’s why people come to her.

Now, Nigar has applied for a 2,000 USD loan to increase the number of her poultry. This will allow her to increase her income and improve her life conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry to increase her income

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
Exaltacion C. is 46 and lives in Malaking Tatyao, Silang, Cavite.  Her husband Reynaldo, also 46, is a driver.  They have six children, two of whom are already working.
Exaltacion manages a plant nursery, situated along the national highway, where she takes care and sells ornamental and flowering plants.  This business has been providing for her family for the last twenty years.  She earns P40, 000 a month.  
She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005 and has since been providing her the necessary assistance she needs for the continuity of her business.  She  just finished repaying her previous loan, which she used to buy wire mesh to fashion into trellises for their crawling plants.  From her profits, she was able to buy a washing machine for the family and a second-hand vehicle which she uses for plant deliveries,  and she was able to have their house renovated.
Exaltacion is applying for a new loan amounting to P24, 000.  She will use the funds to buy more plant seedlings, organic fertilizers and plant pots.  She hopes to put up another nursery in the next town soon.  


About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: plant seedlings, fertilizers and plant pots

loans.name: Rosa Irene

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Porvenir” que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 51 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 02 hijos, ella  estudio educación primaria completa, vive en el Barrio San Martín D. Porras. 

Inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. compra  venta D. quesos y carne, su negocio es una ves por semana en la feria D. los sábados. 

Su deseo es tener una tienda D. abarrotes.
A ella le gusta la  forma D. trabajo y las facilidades  que dan
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is a partner in the Community Bank New Future which is located in the district of Puno, in the Province of Puno, in the Department of Puno. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She completed primary school, and she lives in the San Martin D. Porras neighborhood. She began working with the Manuela Ramos Movement with an initial loan of 200 new soles, money that she invested in her business of buying and selling cheeses and meats. Her business is open once a week at the Saturday market. Inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. compra venta D. quesos y carne, su negocio es una ves por semana en la feria D. los sábados. Her wish is to have a convenience store. She likes her work and the terms of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheeses and meats

loans.name: Consuelo Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo  Consuelo son Consuelo del Carmen F. C., Judith  Elena M. G. y Brunildo del Carmen C.. Ellas viven en barrio Altagracia de Managua.

Consuelo del Carmen F. C. es la coordinadora del grupo, ella antes viajaba y tenía un tramo en el mercado de productos de belleza pero con la muerte de su esposo ella vendió su tramo se quedo como distribuidora.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Judith  Elena M. G. que vende ropa y cosméticos y Brunildo del Carmen C., el vende frijoles y verduras.

loans.use: compra de cosmetico como pintura labial, de uñas, lapiz de ceja, deliniador... etc

loans.name: Moringo

texts.en:
Moringo W. is currently in the business of selling cassava, maize and other produce at the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies of cooking oil to sell.  Moringo is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
M. Rustam is 34 years old. He is married with three adorable children. Rustam has always opted to make his life in his land and work hard and grow with it. That is why he decided to rear cows and dedicated himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time, for he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background.

Today Rustam wishes to increase the number of his cattle and for this reason, he would like to buy calves with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special little animals provide him. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 1900 USD. Extend your solidarity to Rustam so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves to expand the business

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
El socio JULIAN pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 55 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo varón y una hija mujer todavía ellos están el colegio estudiando.

El tiene un pequeño negocio de venta frutas al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco. El mercado “Virgen Asunta” tiene 3 años de fundación y la fruta lo trae de la ciudad de Quillabamba que esta a 12 horas de la ciudad del Cusco.    

El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas como papayas, plátanos, naranjas mandarinas, mangos, piñas etc.    
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JULIAN, 55, is a member of the “SIEMPRE ADELANTE” communal bank. He is married, has a son and a daughter, who are students still, and is from the city of Cusco. He has a small, wholesale and retail, fruit sales business in Cusco's "Virgen Asunta" market. The "Virgen Asunta" market has been in operation for 3 years and he brings the fruit from the city of Quillabamba, which is 12 hours away from the city of Cusco. He needs financing to increase working capital in his fruit sales business. He sells papaya, banana, mandarin orange, mango, pineapple, etc. He is grateful to the institution for the opportunity he has been given and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital in his fruit sales business.

loans.name: Blanca Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Blanca M. desde muy temprano inicia su venta de alimentos preparados por ella misma y comercializados en el mercado Central de Chinandega donde varias personas le compran por prepararlos con altas normas de higiene y por su puesto con muy buen sabor.
Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace cuatro años y hoy en día está solicitando un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así continuar ofreciéndolos en su localidad en su localidad y así generar ingresos para suplir las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca M. begins selling meals she prepares early in the day in the central market of Chinandega. Here various costumers buy her meals because she has high sanitary regulations and good tasting food. She has been dedicated to this job for four years and today is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to make her meals and continue offering them in her locale and make more profits to provide her household with necessary amenities.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials to prepare meals.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia A. lives in Villa Elena, Brgy. Tortosa, Manapla, Negros Occidental. She is married with 8 children who are between 17 to 37 years old, some of whom already have gainful work and have their own families.

She is 59 years old and still working to earn a living because she wants to save for her future and have financial security. She also desires for her business to bring progress to her family.

In 2002, Lucresia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to help her husband earn additional income for the family. When she received her loan, she put up a general store adjacent to her house.

As she continued to pay back her loans, she was granted new loans because of her good performance that showed that the loans helped to expand her business and she was able to add new products and gain more profit, with an average of Php 10,000 per month. The income gradually improved the quality of living for the family.

Lucresia's previous loan of 19500 PHP allowed her to expand her store by selling additional products that were in high demand in her community. The loan was paid on-time and in full.

Now she is borrowing her 12th loan for the same amount of 19500 PHP to purchase additional inventory for her general store. The income from the loan will help support them with their family needs.

About NWTF

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for general store.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina de 36 años es una mujer muy sincera y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 2 hijos Antony de 11 y Candy de 2 años, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios.El negocio al que Martina se dedica es la venta de ropa de forma ambulatoria, todos los días recorre las instituciones públicas y privadas de su ciudad, en busca de clientes que deseen comprar algo de lo que vende. La ropa la trae de otra ciudad, es por eso que los modelos que vende son muy novedosos y llamativos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que están de moda, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes. Para el futuro, espera tener el dinero suficiente para aperturar  una tienda, donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad y comodidadEste es el primer préstamo de Martina con MFP, y  esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que siempre le pone mucha  alegría a las reuniones.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa en la ciudad de Lima, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Martina, 36, is a very sincere and hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house along with her two children: Antony, who is 11, and Candy, who is 2 years old. She wants to give them a good education. Martina has an itinerant business selling clothing; each day she goes through public and private institutions in her city looking for customers who want to buy something that she sells. She brings the clothing from another city, and for this reason the fashions that she sells are very new and eye-catching. What she likes most about her job is advising her customers about the clothing styles that are in fashion. She has been carrying out this activity for 3 years, and she considers that the most difficult part is to have to walk all day in search of customers. In the future, she hopes to have sufficient money to open up a store where she can sell at her leisure with greater comfort. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is ready to work very hard in order to make her payments. In her communal bank she is very well liked, since she always brings a lot of happiness to the meetings. With the 1,800 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) requested she will buy more clothing in the city of Lima, in order to be able to offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing) in the city

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie B. is from the village of Quezon, Valencia City. She is 34 years old. Elsie is single. To make a living, Elsie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Elsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna, de 38 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo José (40) y sus 3 hijos; José (17), Jesús (14) y Cristian (12).
Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de golosinas en la puerta de su casa, para lograrlo adaptó una pequeña vitrina donde ofrece sus productos a sus vecinos y amigos. Este negocio es nuevo, pues ella trabaja como teleoperadora por las tardes y esto no le permite cuidar de sus hijos, por lo que ha decidido dejar ese trabajo para dedicarse del todo a su nuevo negocio. Actualmente, ella atiende su pequeño puesto por las mañanas y sus hijos lo hacen por las tardes.
Giovanna quiere implementar su negocio con otros productos comestibles, pues por su zona no hay una bodega cercana y está segura de que tendrá buenas ventas y ganancias. Para ello, posteriormente acondicionará la cochera de su casa para su futura tienda.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser muy responsable en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas porque quiere seguir progresando. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de variada mercadería para surtir su puesto y empezar a ampliarlo.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 38 and lives in a home she owns with her husband José (40) and her children José (17), Jesús (14) and Cristian (12). This hardworking woman sells candy at the door of her house. In order to make this work she has created a small shopfront where she offers her products to neighbors and friends. This is a new business for her, as she works as a telephone operator in the afternoons. This job does not allow her to fully care for her children, so she has decided to quit and to put all her efforts into her new business, Currently she works at her small store in the mornings and her children work there in the afternoons. Giovanna wants to expand her business with other foodstuffs, because in the area where she lives there is not a grocery store nearby and she is sure that her sales and earnings will be good. She is planning to renovate the garage of her house in order to set up the store there. This is her first loan with MFP [the lending field partner] and she promises to be very responsible in her repayments because she would like to continue moving ahead. The money she is asking for will go towards the purchase of a variety of merchandise to better stock her store and to begin to expand it.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter T. is 56 years old and married to Beatrice who is 43 years old. They have two children who go to primary school and they live in Makupe in Kilifi where Walter owns a quarry. He has been in the quarrying business for nine years and from this he has been able to meet all the family needs.

Walter joined KADET recently and is now borrowing his first loan. He plans to purchase quarrying equipment and to hire people to expand his quarry. His business is located in a busy area and mainly targets those who are doing construction work.

In future Walter hopes to own several quarries for commercial purposes and to build a better house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase quarrying equipment and to hire people to expand his quarry

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 53-year-old married man with 3 children one of whom is working. The two other children are still going to school. Hussein is the only provider of his family. He has owned a car repair shop since 1990 in his town and he repairs all type of cars. Hussein is well known by a large number of customers due to his long experience in this occupation. 

Hussein is requesting a loan $1,000  to buy a large quantity of car oil to sell to his clients.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of car oil to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose O. is a thirty-nine-year-old industrious lady who is married to Mr. Charles O., a clerical officer. They have seven children with the last-born aged nine years. Rose has been selling cereals for the last two years in Migori town.

Rose learnt about KADET through a friend who was already a member. She is taking her second loan from KADET and she hopes to use the money to buy more maize to sell. She hopes to reap more income because there is demand for cereals in Migori town at the moment.

Rose’s dream is to open a bigger and more spacious store for storing her cereal stock since her current storage area is not big enough. She also plans to expand her dairy farming business and benefit from the demand for milk in Migori town.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase underwear and jewelry

loans.name: Celia Pastora

texts.es:
Doña Celia es una mujer trabajadora, madre de cuatro hijos, tiene la edad de 36 años, y con ahorros provenientes de su esposo, producto de su trabajo como taxista logro poner una pulpería en donde vende una variedad como: granos básicos, golosinas, cereales, lácteos, gaseosa, pollo y mas producto de necesidad del cliente. Anteriormente vendía ambulante golosinas para poder ayudar a pagar los gastos básicos, ya que todo ha incrementado. 
Entre sus planes esta poder dar los estudios a sus hijos es por eso que con los financiamientos invierte en su pulpería para poder obtener ganancias y con esto ahorrar para pagar y comprar lo necesario de útiles para los estudios. Con este financiamiento comprara: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, jabón, aceite, golosinas, gaseosas, carnes y pollo con el propósito de dar un buen servicio de venta de productos consumibles diarios del cliente.
texts.en:
Celia is a hardworking woman. She is a mother of four children and she is 36 years old. With savings from her husband, product of his work as a taxi driver, she was able to open a convenience store. She sells a variety of things such as: basic grains, snacks, cereal, dairy products, sodas, chicken and more products needed by customers. Previously she sold snacks as a street vendor in order to help with household expenses, since everything has gone up. Among her plans is being able to give her children an education. That is why she invests her financing in her store in order to obtain profit and thus save and pay for and purchase the school suplies they need. With this financing she will purchase: beans, rice, sugar, soap, oil snacks, sodas, beef and chicken. She will do this in order to offer good service of daily food sales for the customer.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase: beans, rice, sugar, oil, soap, snacks, beef and chicken in order to maintain a variety of products to sell more.

loans.name: Jimena

texts.es:
La señora Jimena M. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Avaroa de la ciudad de El Alto con su hijo.
La señora Jimena trabaja como promotora en una empresa de venta de productos nutricionales, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción y acabado de su cocina, más el pintado del mismo.
Esta es la quinta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Jimena M. lives with her son in her parents’ house in the Villa Avaroa area of the city of El Alto. Jimena works as a promoter for a company that sells nutritional products. The income supports her family. The requested loan is for building and finishing her kitchen. It is also to paint the kitchen. This is the fifth time she has requested a loan. The completed socioeconomic evaluation qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of finishing the kitchen in her house and to paint the kitchen

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en:
Enhjargal N., 33, is married and the mother of two children. She and her family live together in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, in a small house which they own. Enhjargal and her husband operate a sun glasses trading business at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Mongolia. She has been selling sun glasses during the summer and leather gloves during the winter since 2001. Enhjargal purchases the gloves from local Mongolian producers and in Ereen, a Chinese border town.  She purchases her gloves from Mongolian wholesalers. Enhjargal has gained much experience over the past nine years. She sells her product from four locations in the market. Enhjargal employs her husband's sister to sell her products at one of the locations. 

Enhjargal is an enthusiastic person who has a great business mind. In February, 2010, a thief stole furniture from Enhjargal's home. Therefore, she purchased new furniture using capital from her business. She is requesting  34,000,000 MNT loan to maintain her small house for her family needs.

loans.use: to maintain her small house

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 48 años, tiene 7 hijos, dos D. ellos son D. su primer compromiso y 5 con su actual pareja Benjamin D. 40 años y juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 30 años, cultiva plátanos, café, cacao, achiote y frutas cítricas, en está actividad lo ayudan su esposo y sus hijos, por lo que desea brindarle lo mejor, ya que son el motor D. su vida. DesD. entonces cada mañana, se dispone a limpiar y cuidar sus plantaciones con mucho esmero. Disfruta mucho su vida en la selva, por la tranquilidad que le da sus chacras, sin embargo le disgusta cuando los compradores no valoran su trabajo, ofreciendo bajos precios por su cosecha. Por tal motivo busca el lugar adecuado para ofertarlos, pues en la actualidad, la venta por kilo D. café está alrededor D. S/. 8.00 soles, considerándolo muy rentable, ya que le permite cubrir sus gastos domésticos. En adelante desea sembrar todos los productos que crecen en la selva central del Perú, para tener mejores utilidades. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y cuenta que está contenta D. trabajar con su grupo comunal, porque confía mucho en las personas que la integran. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar las herramientas agrícolas necesarias como machetes, también contratará operarios para que limpien sus terrenos y retiren toda la maleza.
texts.en:
Bertha is 48 years old. She has seven children from a previous marriage and five from her current marriage to 40 year old, Benjamin. They all live together in their own home. She has been raising bananas, coffee, cacao, achiote, and citrus for more than 30 years. She gets help from her husband and children, to whom she wants to proviD. the best, as they are the engine that drives her life. Every morning she cleans and cares for her plantations with great effort. She enjoys her life in the jungle because of the tranquility of her farmland, but she doesn’t like when the buyers don’t value her work and offer low prices for her harvest. Because of this, she looks for good places to sell. At the moment the price of coffee is around 8 PEN ($3.00) per kilogram. She considers this to be profitable, as it allows her to be able to cover her household expenses. In the near future she will begin planting all of the types of crops that grow in the Peruvian jungle, in order to better utilize the land. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is happy to be working with her communal group because she trusts its members very much. She will use the money from this loan to buy farm tools, such as machetes, and will also hire some field hands to clear her land.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farm tools and labor

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa C. est une femme mariee.Elle est mere de 3 enfants dont 2 garcons et une fille.En meme temps que le commerce,elle fait aussi de la couture.Elle achete du tissus a Dakar,les coud pour ensuite les revendre.Elle a une experience de plus de 14 ans du metier.Elle fait ce metier pour gagner sa vie et subvenir a ses propres besoins et de ses enfants.Elle compte devellopper son activite en comptant sur des financements.
texts.en:
Awa C. is married and mother of 3 children: 2 boys and a girl. As well as her work in retail, she also sews. She buys her fabrics from Dakar, sews them and resells them. She has more than 14 years experience in the profession. She does this work to earn a living, and to meet her own needs and those of her children. She needs funding in order to develop her business.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: renforcement de son commerce

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 29-year-old single mother of one.  She has raised her 2-year-old child with income from her business. She has been selling clothes for three years.  

She joined a group under Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, so as to access loans and to save her money. So far, she has serviced two loans from Faulu Kenya. This has helped her improve her business. She is requesting another loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of clothes.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty F. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old and is married with six adult children. Betty owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fruits like mangoes and wild berries or rambutan (a tropical fruit) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Betty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fruits to sell. Betty is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Ariunzaya

texts.en: Ariunzaya M. lives with her husband and son  in their own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She has a one-year-old son who stays at home under the care of Ariunzaya's mother, while her husband helps out in the business that she started in 2006, a household goods and electric appliances retail enterprise at Narantuul market, one of the largest and most well-known markets in Ulaanbaatar.  Ariunzaya sells plastic and glass goods and some electronic products used in food preparation and home upkeep.  She hopes that both her and her husband’s businesses will enable them to improve their quality of life. Ariunzaya is now requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to import more household products from China.

loans.use: To import more household products from China

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta M. is from the village of Andarayan South, Solana, Cagayan. She is 46 years old, married and has 7 school-aged children. Marieta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling juices and foods near a school. Marieta has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

Marieta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marieta is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Marieta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yatt

texts.en: Mrs. Yatt T., 33 years old, is a married woman and the mother of one young son. She is a local farmer who has been farming since 2000. As another source of family income, her husband sells icecream to children in and near the local public school in his community. Mrs. Yatt T. will be using the loan to buy fertilizer for her crops, as well as to buy piglets to raise for extra income. (Mrs. Yatt T.’s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for crops and piglets to raise for extra income

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en:
Gansuh J. is 50 years old and lives with his wife and two adult sons in Hentiy province in Mongolia. Both of his sons are students. His wife has worked as a bookkeeper in the Huvch Jonon Co. Ltd. for five years and receives a monthly salary of 200,000 MNT. 

Gansuh has been driving a taxi since 2006 and has built a stable and successful operation. Over the years, he has gained not only experience but also many permanent customers. In the evening and morning, he provides a call taxi service within the town. 

He eventually earned enough money to trade in his old vehicle for a newer and more convenient car for 6,500,000 MNT. Also, his business earnings have enabled him to pay his children's tuition fees. 

Gansuh is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase two new tires and to repair his car's engine.

loans.use: Two new tires and engine repair

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 30 años, pertenece al grupo “Los emprendedores”, ella vive con sus padres, Oscar de 61 y Reyna de 60 años; a los que con dedicación; cuida y protege, juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Palcamayo. Ella, afirma que su mayor sueño es triunfar y darle a sus padres la calidad de vida que se merecen, y así lo esta siendo ya que como agricultora, ella tubo una gran idea y hace ya algunos años se dedica a la compra y venta de manzanilla; lo que después comercializa a las grandes empresas de filtrantes del país. Está muy contenta con ello y diariamente compra 5 kilos de manzanilla a los diferentes productores de su zona; las que luego traslada a Lima donde las empresas más importantes del rubro le compran en grandes cantidades. Ya todos la conocen, por ello tiene mayor cantidad de pedidos; por lo que ahora necesita más capital para poder comprar mayores cosechas de manzanilla. Con el tiempo y la experiencia ganada ella piensa comprar su propio molino, para poder abrir su empresa de filtrantes. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y como secretaria de su banco comunal, le gusta mucho trabajar por el desarrollo de sus integrantes. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más cosechas de manzanilla; para abastecer a sus clientes, asimismo planea abrir un almacigo (reserva de plantas de manzanilla).
texts.en: Marlene, 30, belongs to the communal bank "Los Emprendedores."  She lives with her parents, Oscar, 61, and Reyna, 60, and she is devoted to caring for them and protecting them.  They live together in her own home, located in the rural area of Palcamayo.  Marlene states that her biggest dream is to succeed and to give her parents the quality of life that they deserve.   Being that she had been a farmer, she had a great idea some years ago to buy and sell chamomile, which later she started to sell to the big herb processing companies in the country.  She is very content with this business; each day she buys 5 kilos of chamomile from the different producers in her area that she later takes to Lima, where the most important herb companies are located who buy in large quantities.  Now they all know her, and as a result she has a large quantity of orders.  Now she needs more capital so that she can buy larger amounts of harvested chamomile.  With the time and the experience she has gained she is thinking of buying her own mill so that she can have her own herb processing company.  This is her 3rd loan with MFP.  She is now secretary of her communal bank, and she very much enjoys working to develop the businesses of the other members of the group.  With the loan she requests, she will buy more harvested chamomile to supply to her customers.  In addition, she plans to put in her own seedbed so that she can have a reserve of chamomile plants.

loans.use: to buy chamomile that is already harvested, and to establish her own seedbed to have reserves of this plant.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma W. sells toilet bowl products. She plans to use her loan to expand her business so she can stock products frequently needed by her clientele.

This loan will boost her business and she believes this will maximize her profits. The additional income will contribute to he family's daily needs and living standards.

Elma will use additional income to educate her children and dependents.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Marcela Alexandra

texts.es:
Marcela de 43 años, vende ropa en un puesto de ropa. Vive con sus dos hijos en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil. 

Su ex esposo la abandono por eso decidió invertir sus ahorros y comenzar a tener una actividad comercial para poder mantener a sus dos hijos por lo que más fácil era la venta de ropa  en un puesto. En la actualidad tiene ya su puesto de ropa en un local en donde vende pantalones, blusas, chaquetas de hombre y mujer etc. Los precios son muy económicos, porque la ropa la comprar al por mayor. 

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar ropa para tener más ingresos para su familia. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y tene mas ganancias para darle una buena vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marcela is 43 years old.  She sells clothes from a clothes stall.  She lives with her two children in an urban area which is known for the fact that most of its inhabitants are salespeople.  It is the suburb of Guayaquil.

Marcela's ex-husband abandoned her and so she decided to invest her savings and start a business activity which would enable her to support her two children.  The easiest option was to sell clothes from a stall.  She currently has her clothes stall in premises where she sells pants, blouses, men's and women's jackets, etc.  Her prices are very cheap because she buys her clothes wholesale.

To continue with her business she would like to buy clothes to provide more income for her family.  In the future, she would like to increase her business and make more profit so that she can give her children a good life.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda U. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 53 years-old and married with seven adult children. To make a living, Luzminda owns and operates a business in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.
