While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk food in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Luzminda joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Luzminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school.  She lives in a rental that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

She has operated a poultry business for over two years and she sells in a shop and from home to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition she operates a boutique business which is her other source of income.  Millicent faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business.  She hopes to expand her boutique in the future.

With the 60,000 KES loan she wants to purchase 200 chicks, chicken feed and chicken medicine.  She decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve her business and her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase 200 chicks, chicken feed and chicken medicine.

loans.name: Creativas 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama CREATIVAS 1, porque son mujeres que día a día salen adelante con su trabajo. Está ubicado en  Atlacomulco, Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. Himelda S., es integrante del grupo. Tiene 26 años estudió carrera técnica, es enfermera y tiene 4 hijos: 3 hombres y 1 mujer. Ella se dedica a la venta de plantas desde hace 9 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar macetas y semillas, esto le va ayudar a mejorar su negocio con mayores rendimientos, crecimiento, calidad, competitividad y satisfacción del cliente en variedad de productos  (Malbon, Geranios, Agazanias, Pensamiento, Petunias, Noche Buenas, etc.). Es un objetivo a largo plazo, desea aumentar su productividad e invertir en plantas de sombra para aumentar su competitividad en el mercado. Observaciones: La señora Emma es la que se asoma en la foto, la segunda de izquierda a derecha.
texts.en: This group is called Creativas 1, because it is composed of women who progress everyday through their work. It is located in Atlacomulco in the State of Mexico. The group has 10 members. Himelda S. is one of them. She is 26, attended a vocational school, is a nurse and has four children: three sons and one daughter. She has been selling plants for 9 years. She applies for this loan to buy pots and seeds. This will help her improve the yield, growth and competitiveness of her business, the quality of her products and the satisfaction of her customers thanks to a greater variety of products (malvones, geraniums, gazanias, pansies, petunias, poinsettias, etc.). It is a long-term goal, she wants to increase her productivity and invest in shade plants to improve her competitiveness in the market. Note: Emma is the second lady on the picture, from left to right.

loans.use: To buy pots and seeds to increase her productivity

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a thirty-eight-year-old single mother of four children, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of providing the basics for her family, and her goal is to educate her children up to the university level. 

She is a poultry farmer and has been in this kind of business for six years, which has enabled her to generate a minimum of income for the family. Her desire is to have at least three thousand birds. Charity needs the loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: Purchasing chicken feed.

loans.name: Svay's Group

texts.en:
In Phngeas village, Takeo Province, four people are members of this group loan.  Mrs. Svay H. is the group president who has been selected by the other members, who will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's standard of living.  

She owns a general store in local village where she can sell groceries to earn some profit to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Ngen Ngor, is a farmer who owns 2-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family and he is also a fish breeder too.  Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it.  In order to do this, Mrs. Svay H. is seeking a loan to buy more groceries and to buy more fish food.  She is a mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Khat S. is a 55-year-old married woman. She works very hard as a fish-paste seller.  She sells around the community and typically earns around $3.75 per day. Khat S. has another financial earner in her husband, who is a local farmer.  This couple have seven children, two of whom are sewing workers in the garment industry. 

Khat S. wants to earn more income from her selling in order to support the increasing family expense. Therefore, Khat S. decided to pursue a loan to purchase fish-paste in bulk to stock up for sales.

loans.use: To purchase fish-paste in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Expanding Working Capital

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is a married lady. The husband is a casual laborer and they have four children between 19 years old and 8 years old. 

Her business is located at the busy Nyamasaria market in Kisumu, Kenya. Kisumu is the region of Kenya known for production of fish and well known as the lake basin. 

Beatrice owns a food kiosk and serves ready-made food to the local people. She has been in this business for the last four years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Beatrice is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy fish to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to expand her business and employ good cooks in the future. She also sees herself being able to supply fish to the local schools and organizations. She describes herself as loving, caring and humble.

loans.use: To buy fish to cook

loans.name: Wangninagbe Group

texts.en:
The Wangninagbe group of 20 entrepreneurs all live in the same village of Avrankou, just outside Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. This is their first loan with ALIDE.

Joulienne (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1979 in Avrankou. She now lives with her husband Antoine and their three children.  For the past 20 years she has sold fruits and meals around her neighborhood. This loan will enable her to purchase fruits, palm nuts, corn and condiments for sale and as ingredients for meals. Her aim in the long term is to build a beautiful home. She claims to have a very strong entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, nuts, corn and condiments for resale

loans.name: Emelina

texts.es:
Emelina tiene  33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 12 años, 11 años y 8 meses. Reside junto a su familia en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de pollo en el mercado Santa Rosa desde hace 3 años. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los destina para el sostenimiento económico de su familia, mejorando así su calidad de vida.

Emelina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más pollo de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes durante esta temporada, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Emelina is 33 years old, married, and has three children aged 12, 11 and 8 months.  She lives with her family in her parents' home, in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

Emelina's business is selling chicken in Santa Rosa market.  She has been in this business for three years.  She uses the income that she makes to financially support her family, improving their quality of life.

Emelina would like to expand her business by purchasing more chicken so that she can meet her customers' demand during this season.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more chicken to sell in the local market

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik P. is 40 years old; he lives in Zovaber village, Sevan area, with his mother, his wife and his two children. Arayik’s mother is retired, his wife is jobless and his children are in school.   
Arayik works at ''South Caucasian railway'' as a mechanic and, at the same time, he has been engaged in farming. On his farm he grows potatoes and raises cows, sheep and chickens. His wife helps him in this and, so, they solve their family's needs. 
Arayik is asking for a 650,000 AMD loan to buy potato seedlings and to sow them.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings to sow

loans.name: Nana Adjoa

texts.en:
Nana Adjoa A. is a baker at Elmina. She also freezes meat and fish for sale. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. 

Nana pays the school fees of her children as a way of helping her husband to reduce his financial burden. Her loan will be used to buy more fish and meat to freeze for sale.  She anticipates reinvesting her new profit.

In this picture she is showing a few bagged meat items.

loans.use: to buy more fish and meat to freeze for sale.

loans.name: Parandzem

texts.en:
Parandzem lives in Zovasar village in the Aragatsotn region, together with her family of five members. 

She is engaged in agriculture. She keeps livestock and cultivates land. Agriculture is the family’s main source of income. 

She would like to increase the livestock and develop agriculture. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase calves and cultivate the land. 

With the loan’s help, she will increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy calves and cultivate the land.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer.

Cecilia sells fresh fruits and vegetables such as pineapples, watermelons, tomatoes, plantains, cassava, yams, sweet potatoes, coco-yams and others at Elmina, where she has done so for three years. She uses her income to help her husband pay for household expenses.

Cecilia will use her loan to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale. With the profits from her sales, she plans build a kiosk from which to sell her produce.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Josseline Rocio

texts.es: Roció nació en el departamento del Huánuco (Perú) y tiene 41 años de edad. Actualmente, Roció vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus dos hijos. Roció se dedica a las manualidades como tejidos, costuras y bordados. Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Roció requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo lana de alpaca, hilos y tela. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Unión Latina” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Roció was born in Huánuco department (Peru).  She is 41 years old and currently lives in the city of Cusco, together with her two children.  Roció's business is knitting, sewing and embroidering handicrafts.  She has been in this business for five years and is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Roció needs a loan to buy materials such as alpaca yarn, threads and fabric.  She is a responsible and hard-working person and, because of these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's "Unión Latina" community bank.

loans.use: to buy materials such as alpaca yarn, threads and fabric

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 38 years old and hard working.  She is married and blessed with two children ages 17 and 10 years old. 

She has been selling second hand clothes for the last three years.  Previously, she was running a grocery shop.  She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for training her on business management.  She wants a loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shirts, dresses, and inner wears for children.

In the next five years, she hopes to run a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy shirts, dresses, and inner wears for children

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian has a food vending business to earn a living. She prepares and sells her products by peddling in her community. She sells snack foods like pancakes, peanuts, baked goods and refreshments. Lilian is married and the mother of three grown-up children. She is 62 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has been in her business for five years. She earns a total of 3,000 PHP from these activities. 

Lilian has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for food preparation. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Lilian hopes to gain more income and purchase a vacant space in the market for a snack stall.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Shadaan

texts.en:
Shadaan stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She is very active still at the age of 52 and performs her household duties very well.   She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. All of them are illiterate and couldn’t get an education due to financial constraints.
 
Shadaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s shoe making business. This is her family business and all of her children are involved in this business. With the loan, her son will buy shoe making materials such as leather, shoe laces, glue and shoe polish, etc. in larger quantity that will allow him to fill the customers' orders on time and earn better profits. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past 15 years. 

Shadaan hopes that an investment will be a profitable one for her son.

loans.use: To buy shoe-making material for her son's shoe-making business.

loans.name: Simba

texts.en:
Simba is 61 years old and married with four children. For the past 16 years, he has been running a small washing and ironing business and providing laundry services to residents in his area. Simba describes himself as respectful, friendly, and faithful.

Simba is requesting a loan to purchase a table and an ironing board. He plans to use the profits from his loan to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to be able to afford an electric washing machine and to hire someone to help him. Simba also hopes to continue paying for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a table and an ironing board

loans.name: Jenny Marisol

texts.es:
Jenny Marisol tiene 33 años de edad vive en unión libre con su esposo y con sus cuatro hijos de diecisiete, dieciséis, trece, once y cuatro años en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Jenny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno. En su  tiempo libre le gusta salir a bailar.
texts.en:
Jenny Marisol is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and their four children (17, 16, 13, 11 and 4) in the Pueblo Viejo canton, which is in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

The UNIDO SOMOS (We Are United) communal bank is located in the El Marañón precinct of Puerto Pechiche parish, which is in Pueblo Viejo canton. This communal bank works in agriculture, sowing corn, rice and beans on the short growth cycle (less than six months).

Jenny works in agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans. She buys her products at the Karlita agricultural supply center and sells at Castillo shopping center. She is asking for the loan to sow corn, rice and beans and to buy seeds, urea, farm supplies and organic and liquid fertilizers for the crops.

The loan will give Jenny the financial help to provide for her needs. Facing challenges like pests, diseases, and weather changes will be easier with the loan's help because she will be able to buy the supplies she needs.

Her dream is to buy her own land. Jenny likes to go out dancing in her free time.

loans.use: to sow corn, rice and beans and to buy seeds, urea, farm supplies and organic and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en: Kelvin is a hardworking business man aged 22 and he is single. For the last 1 year, he has been selling clothes to make a living. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shilling to buy more clothes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya , he has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es: Tatiana tiene 27 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, es casada pero hasta el momento no tiene hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, y sueña con ser madre pronto, por tanto ella y su esposo trabajan y ahorran lo suficiente para darle lo mejor a su ansiado hijo. Su trabajo consiste en viajar a la ciudad de Trujillo, ciudad conocida como la primera en producir zapatos de cuero y de calidad, ahí compra la cantidad necesaria y de los que le hacen pedidos sus clientes. Sus sistema de venta es a crédito, y cada cierto tiempo, realiza las cobranzas respectivas, de acuerdo a los ingresos de sus asiduos compradores. Por otro lado se dedica también en la venta de cosméticos que sus clientes previamente lo eligen por catálogo y bajo el mismo sistema de pago. Tiene tres años trabajando en ambos negocios, y hasta el momento lo hace sola, pues su esposo trabaja para una entidad del estado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que viaja cada dos meses y ese recorrido le distrae, por otro lado éste trabajo le permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a su hogar. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura pagará sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más ropa para que sus clientes no dejen de estar a la vanguardia de la moda.
texts.en:
Tatiana is twenty-seven-years-old. She is a happy woman and very hardworking. She's married, but at this point does not have any children. She and her husband live in their own house. Tatiana dreams of being a mother soon, so she and her husband are working and saving what they need to give the best to the awaited child.

Tatiana's work involves traveling to Trujillo, a city known for being first in the production of quality leather shoes. She buys as much as she needs and clients put in orders. She sells on credit, and every so often, when her regular clients have income, she collects payments.  She also sells cosmetics that clients pre-order from catalogs, and collects payment as she does with her other products. She's been working in both businesses for three years and thus far has worked by herself. Her husband works for a state entity.

What Tatiana likes about her work is that she travels every two months and enjoys  the trips. The work also allows her time to work in her house. This will be her first loan with MFP, so she assures us that she will make her payments on time. She'll use her loan to buy more clothing for her clients, who are always in the vanguard of style.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of clothing.

loans.name: Celine

texts.fr:
Femme remarquable de 48ans responsable ayant 5 personnes en charge. Commerçante des friperies. Elle à fait preuve d’un bon remboursement lors de son troisième  prêt. Le prêt lui appris la gestion de stock, comment tenir un journal de caisse et grâce à cela ses revenus journaliers ont augmentés de 35.000frs à 70.000frs. 

Avec l’octroi du quatrième prêt, elle va augmentée son stock pour faire accroître son capital en achetant divers ballots de friperie non utilisé comme les draps, des nappe de table, des torchons et serviettes non utilises. 

Elle à améliore ses conditions de vie  de ses 4 enfants, qui en plus ont été inscrits dans des institutions privées; elle tient à aller jusqu'au bout de son objectif, toujours avec Hope pour qu'elle accomplisse ses ambitions qui sont d’avoir un dépôt de ballots de friperie.
texts.en:
Celine is a remarkable 48-year-old woman who is responsbile for 5 persons. She sells cloths, and repaid her third loan without problems. The loan taught her stock management and how to maintain a cash journal. Thanks to it, her daily revenues increased from XOF 35'000 to 70'000 (ca US$ 70 to 140).

With her fourth loan, she will increase her stock in order to bolster her working capital, by buying various bales of new cloths, such as sheets, tablecloths, dishcloths, and towels. 

She improved the standard of living of her four children, who are now registered in private institutions. She's determined to reach her goal, together with Kiva's partner, Hope, in order to have her own cloth bales warehouse.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloths, sheets and towels

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 39, is married and has two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife has been running a general store in front of their house. 

He has supported his family by running a mechanical shop at his house for eight years. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying equipment and materials to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions and sending his children to school.

loans.use: To buy equipment and materials for his mechanical shop

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 40-year-old married man with three children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a teacher for 14 years. After realizing that his meager teacher's salary did not allow him to fully provide for his family, he ventured into the clothing business, and he has been in the business for a year.

His primary business challenge relates to the fact that he has limited funds to meet the high demand for his clothing. His dream is to set up a boutique and to educate his children. John is seeking this loan to buy clothes for resale purposes.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for resale purposes.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El señor  Luís trabaja en un restauran como chef. El crédito lo requiere para la compra  insumos como carne, verduras, condimentos, etc.,  ya que desea abrir su propio negocio. Vive en casa en anticretico la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de San Pedro  de la ciudad de La Paz; Luis es soltero  y no  tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y por sus deseos de superación y emprendimiento empresarial es que se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis works in a restaurant as a chef. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as meat, vegetables, condiments, and other products because he wants to open his own business. He lives in a rental house in the District of San Pedro in the city of La Paz. Luis is single and has no children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO. Because he desires to succeed in this entrepreneurial endeavor, his loan request is being referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies for starting a food business.

loans.name: Laura Matilde

texts.es:
Laura Matilde tiene 35 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo vive en Guaranda Sector Cuatro esquinas Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC Cuatro Esquinas Central está formada por 12 socios que pertenecen al sector cuatro esquinas, los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como son agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio y otros.
Laura se dedica a la crianza de  pollos brailers. Las compras y las ventas los realiza en el mercado de Guaranda.
Solicita el crédito para comprar animales y el alimento para los pollos. Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudará a tener ingresos para poder cubrir las necesidades.
El sueño es comprar terreno. No se le han presentado ningún problema.
En los momentos libres le gusta escuchar música, pasear y disfrutar de las festividades
texts.en:
Laura Matilde is 35 years old, married, and has one son.  She lives in Guaranda, Cuatro Esquinas, in Bolívar province.

The Cuatro Esquinas Central community bank has 12 members who live in Cuatro Esquinas.  The members all work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising, commerce, etc.

Laura raises broiler chickens.  She makes her purchases and sales in Guaranda market.

Laura is requesting this loan to buy animals and chicken feed.  The support of this loan will help her to make the necessary income to cover her needs.

Laura's dream is to buy land.  She hasn't experienced any problems.

In her free time, Laura likes listening to music, going for walks and enjoying the festivities.

loans.use: to buy animals and chicken feed

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es: Emerson, es un joven soltero y trabajador, tiene 28 años; vive en una casa alquilada. Lo que más anhela es triunfar en la vida. Él empezó a trabajar como empleado en una tienda comercial de su ciudad. Desde entonces y cada mañana se levantaba muy temprano para poder dirigirse a una librería, lugar donde trabaja y tiene la esperanza de que algún día pueda tener su propio negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que la gente con quien trabaja son amables, por ser un hombre responsable. Con el tiempo desea abrir su propio negocio, que es la venta de útiles escolares  ya que lo vio rentable y desea con ansias el apoyo de MFP para realizar sus sueños de triunfar en la vida. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles podrá abrir su negocio y vender útiles escolares como: cuadernos, libros, lapiceros, papelotes y plumones.
texts.en: Emerson is 28. He is a young, single, and hard-working man. He lives in a rented home. His greatest wish is to succeed in life. He is an employee in a bookstore in the city. Every morning he gets up very early to go to work. He hopes to have his own business soon. What he likes the most about his job is the kindness of his co-workers. He is very responsible. He wants to open his own business selling school supplies, since he believes this to be profitable. He is eager to have MFP's support in achieving his dreams of succeeding in life. This will be his first loan with MFP, and he hopes to get a small loan so that he can achieve his goals. With these 1,500 nuevos soles, he will be able to open his business and sell school supplies such as: notebooks, books, pencils, paper, and felt-tip pens.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books, pencils, paper, and felt-tip pens.

loans.name: Yhury

texts.es:
Yhury sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y él sigue dedicándose a la venta de cerveza. En estos últimos días Yhury se está dedicando también a la venta de artesanía. En esta oportunidad el socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de artesanía como chompas de alpaca.

Yhury está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Yhury continues to participate in the Asociación Arariwa "Comuzone III" community bank in the city of Cusco, and he still works as a beer vendor.  Recently he's also been selling handicrafts.  He is currently seeking a loan to buy handicrafts like alpaca sweaters.

Yhury is happy for the loan and promises to make all his payments.

loans.use: to buy more beer.

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
Sento is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Sento was born in in the township of Lunsar, about thirty-three years ago. She is married to an architect and the couple has three children, two of whom are attending primary schools. 

For over seven years now, Sento has been selling cigarettes, pen, pencils, etc. This is the first loan that Sento and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve  their living conditions. 

Sento will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her business. She will buy cigarettes, pens and pencils wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, pens, pencils, etc in wholesale to add to her current ones

loans.name: Fabio

texts.es: En la búsqueda de alternativas para generar ingresos que le permitieran continuar aportando de manera efectiva a los ingresos familiares, el señor Fabio recurrió a su experiencia como comerciante y opto por emprender hace ocho años una venta de frutas y verduras que poco a poco se ha conformado en una tienda. Dado una dificultad que se presentó, el señor Fabio se vio en la obligación de realizar un préstamo a un amigo quien accedió a este pero a tasas de interés muy altas, por lo que ha estado perdiendo mucho capital y por lo que requiere de un nuevo préstamo que le permita cancelar dicho saldo y así poder sacar adelante su negocio y familia.
texts.en:
In search of alternative ways to earn money which would permit him to continue contributing in a worthwhile way to the family income, Fabio used his experience as a merchant and decided to launch, after eight years of selling fruits and vegetables, little by little, a store. 

Because of a problem that presented itself, Fabio saw the necessity of getting a loan from a friend who agreed to do it but at a very high rate of interest. This is why he has been losing so much income and why he needs a new loan that permits him to pay off the balance so his family and his business can move forward.

loans.use: to pay off the balance of a loan and to buy an assortment of products for domestic use

loans.name: Rahmeh

texts.en: Rahmeh, 25 years old, has been married for almost a year now. In spite of being married, Rahmeh decided to continue studying to get her university degree. Now she wants to register for her last semester, so she can graduate and start her own business. She has applied for this loan in order to pay for her graduation semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her graduation semester fees.

loans.name: Nonvignono Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNONO est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Djima Justine 2 est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Djima Justine est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Djima Justine est mariée à un militaire du nom de Séverin. Le couple a trois enfants, aucun scolarisé et  à leur charge. Djima Justine vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Djima Justine vend depuis dix ans, des divers, des condiments et des fournitures scolaires. Djima Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Djima Justine ensemble avec les membres du groupe NONVIGNONO, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments et des fournitures scolaires.

loans.name: Yanina

texts.en:
Yanina has a store where she sells a variety of ítems. Mainly she sells basic foods and household necessities such as oil and soap. She also generates a good amount of revenue from her clothing sales. She buys from distributors who purchase their products in Peru for much lower prices. This allows her to offer her products at affordable prices to her clients. She hopes that before the holiday season approaches she can invest in a significant amount of merchandise. Yanin is 43 and is a single mother of one daughter.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in more affordable merchandise for her clients

loans.name: Démihindo

texts.en:
Born in 1967 and mother of seven children, Madame A. Demihindo also cares for her parents. For more than 10 years, she has worked in the sales of corn-balls (pasta) with different sauces. This activity has created an income that is not enough to support the needs of her family. Everything is used for daily food. The previous received and re-paid loans have enable her to better organize and to save. In order to have a consistant funds, she is asking for a loan of $750.00. This sum will allow her to stock primary food goods which she will use at the right moment to better serve her clients and to increase her earnings even if it is only by a little.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1967 et mère de sept (07) enfants, Madame A. Démihindo a à sa charge ses parents. Depuis plus de 10 ans, elle exerce comme activité la vente des boules de maïs (pâte) avec différentes sauces. Cette activité lui génère des revenus qui ne suffisent pas à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Ainsi dit, tout rentre dans la consommation quotidienne. Les crédits précédemment reçus et remboursés lui ont permis de mieux s’organiser et d’épargner. Afin d’avoir un fond de roulement consistant pour se relancer, elle sollicite un montant de $750. Cette somme lui permettra aussi de faire des stocks en matières premières alimentaires qu’elle va utiliser au moment opportun et de réhabiliter le cadre de travail pour mieux servir les clients et accroître ses revenus jusqu’ici très maigres.

loans.use: To stock primary food materials.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Mrs. Sau and her husband are old, 66 and 65, and they have no children. 
They have 3000 square meters of land but they must hire people to grow rice because they are too weak. So Sau is selling food for breakfast at their house. This is important for increasing their income, which averages $14/person/month. She wants to borrow $50 for her food sales business.

loans.use: retail sales

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Mr. Pablo F. lives in his own home in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz, with his wife, Mrs. Rosa Alvarez and he son. Mr F. works as a driver for a taxi company in our city, and he wife sells produce in the market in their neighborhood. He is requesting this loan to remodel their bathroom, which has unfinished interior walls and lacks a sink and shower, and to upgrade the cement and molding of the patio of their home. These improvements are important for the family’s health, and they qualify for line of credit for housing and improvement of living conditions. This is the first time that Mr. F. has requested credit through IMPRO, and a socioeconomic study has found him qualified to meet this credit obligation.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

El sr. Pablo Fernández vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de la Paz con su esposa, la sra. Rosa Álvarez y su hijo. El sr. Pablo Fernández trabaja como chofer empleado de una empresa de taxis de nuestra ciudad y su esposa se dedica a la venta de verduras en un mercado de su zona. El crédito que solicita es para la refacción del baño que en la actualidad no cuenta con lavamanos, ducha ni revoque interior, más el vaciado de cemento y acondicionamiento del patio en su vivienda. Estas mejoras son importantes para la salud de la familia y caen bajo nuestra línea de crédito de vivienda y mejoramiento del habitat. Esta es la primera ocasión que el sr. Pablo Fernández solicita un crédito en impro y el estudio socioeconómico lo califica para poder acceder y honrar su obligación crediticia.

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Mrs. Patricia I. is 51 years old, married, and has 8 children. Patricia is a dynamic client of LAPO who sells provisions and drinks to the community. She has been in this business since 2001. She said that with this business she is able to send her children to school. She is eager to buy more provisions and drinks and expand her business if the US$550 amount is approved for her.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & drinks

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Mrs. Vero A. is a 52 -year-old widow with eight children, and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs at a local market. She learned her business from her sister as a child and started hers in 2003. She is an LAPO member and would like a loan of $400 to increase her store's inventory.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Bimavdjuda

texts.ru:
Bimavdjuda D. is married. Her husband is away working as a seasonal laborer. Bimavdjuda has a child, who lives with her in-laws. Bimavdjuda’s husband sends money from time to time, but the money he sends is not enough to sustain the family. Bimavdjuda’s quality of life improved, since she turned to MicroInvest for help. Now she plans to increase the assortment of good and expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Джалолова Бимавджуда замужем, муж находиться в отъезде на заработке. У них один ребенок живет с родителями мужа. Муж время от времени присылает деньги, но эти средства не хватают для них. После того когда , он обратилась в Микроивесте , ее положение улучшилось. Ей необходимо и улучшить ассортимент и расширить бизнес.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Alejandra's Group

texts.es:
Eda, Apolonia and Alejandra have belonged to the communal bank Pura Vida (pure life) for 1, 6 and 8 years respectively. In their communal bank they were taught how to value themselves, be punctual, save, and manage their businesses.

Eda is divorced and has 4 children. Eda sells cheese and meat in the market of the city of Ayacucho. Her products are bought in different fairs of the region and she also offers a service of catering for different events. In addition to these two activities, she makes cloth crafts and decorations. On her part, Apolonia is a widow and has 6 children. Apolonia sells vegetables in a kiosk at the market of the Americas. At first, she sold in the streets, but then with her savings she was able to buy the stand in which she now works. In addition, Apolonia sells buckets and ojotas (shoes maD. out of recycled car tires) in the fairs of Uripa and Chincheros. Meanwhile, Alejandra has a recreational place in her house where she sells meals typical of the region on Saturdays and Sundays and in addition she has a small store where she sells sweets and beverages.

Eda, Apoloniia and Alejandra need loans for 400 soles, 400 soles and 600 soles respectively. These will be invested in buying ojotas carrot, onion, squash, culantro (long coriander), cloth, thread, craft materials, beer, soda, meat, corn, potato, rice.

The savings of Eda, Apolonia and Alejandra are for the education of their children and grandchildren. Their dreams are to open a new business of children's parties, that their children and grandchildren become professionals, owning a house, and having a larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Eda, Apolonia y Alejandra pertenecen al Banco Comunal Pura Vida desD. hace 1, 6 y 8 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal les enseñaron a valorarse, a ser puntuales, a ahorrar y cómo dirigir sus negocios.

Eda es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos. Eda venD. quesos y carne en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho; sus productos los compra en las diferentes ferias D. la región, y también brinda servicio D. preparación D. comida para diferentes eventos, además D. estas dos actividades ella hace manualidades D. telas y adornos. Por otro lado Apolonia es viuda y tiene 6 hijos, Apolonia venD. verduras en un kiosco en el mercado las Américas. Inicialmente vendía ambulatoriamente y con sus ahorros pudo comprar el puesto en el que trabaja. Además Apolonia venD. tinas, baldes y ojotas (calzado elaborado D. neumáticos D. carros reciclados) en las ferias D. Uripa y Chincheros. Mientras que Alejandra tiene un recreo en su casa donD. venD. comidas típicas los días sábados y domingos, y además tiene una tienda pequeña donD. venD. golosinas y bebidas.

Eda, Apolonia y Alejandra necesitan préstamos D. 400 soles, 400 soles y 600 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra D. ojotas, zanahoria, cebolla, zapallo, culantro, tela, hilo, accesorios para las manualidades, cerveza, gaseosa, carne, maíz, papa, arroz.

Los ahorros D. Eda, Apolonia y Alejandra son para la educación D. sus hijos y nietos, Los sueños D. ellas son abrir un nuevo negocio D. piñatería ( venta D. productos para fiestas infantiles), que sus hijos y nietos sean profesionales, tener casa propia y tener un negocio más granD..

loans.use: Eda, Apoloniia and Alejandra need loans for 400 soles, 400 soles and 600 soles respectively. These will be invested in buying ojotas carrot, onion, squash, culantro (long coriander), cloth, thread, craft materials, beer, soda, meat, corn, potato, rice.

loans.name: Twekembe Development Group

texts.en:
It is rare in Uganda for one to doubt a 48-year-old midwife with 17 years of experience. Mayi K., the chairperson of the Twekembe Development Group, can be best described as such. She is married with 4 children and provides for 6 of her relatives. She has a maternity home in Bulenga and she has been our client for 8 years. Her dream for the future is to have her own premises for the maternity home, which is currently in rented space. She believes her dream can only come true by having a loan together with her group. Mayi is result-oriented and hardworking.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Kato Mayi will invest more in her maternity home.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and their one child in Saida in southern Lebanon. Bassam is a barber, and he has a loyal customer base. Bassam is applying for a loan to help him buy an air conditioner for his barber shop because he would like to sustain and to continue to improve upon his business by keeping his customers comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase an air conditioner for his barber shop

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
The committee known as "Mujeres SolidA." from the Villa Madrid de Limpio area was formed thanks to previously formed groups that grew large and were then divided to reduce the number of ladies in each group. Thus this new group of entrepreneurs was formed.

These ladies are enterprising women, who above and beyond managing their own microbusinesses are also mothers and housewives. They persist daily to maintain their families. Their principal motivation is their children, since they all desire that their children study and have better luck than their mothers have had.

Currently these women are in the third cycle of the program. They manage a line of credit of from 300, 000 guaranies (Paraguayan currency) to 800,000 guaranies per member. Currently there are 16 members; each works in a different activity, such as lingerie sales, sales of fast food, jewelry sales, fruit and vegetable sales, beverage sales, sweets, products by catalog, etc.

They possess a great enterprising spirit and want to continue growing. They are happy with the program since the training they receive helps them a lot. The loans are also a great help since the women invest them in their microbusinesses. Currently they are requesting a new loan which they want to invest in the purchase of merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El comité denominado “Mujeres SolidA.” de la compañía Villa Madrid de Limpio se formo gracias a otros grupos que se formaron anteriormente y para reducir el número de señoras se dividieron y formaron otro grupo más.

Estas señoras son mujeres emprendedoras, que además de manejar sus propias microempresas también son madres y amas de casa. Ellas luchan día a día por mantener a sus familias, sus principales motores son sus hijos, ya que el deseo de ellas es que todos estudien y tengan una mejor suerte que las de ellas.

Actualmente se encuentran en el 3º ciclo del programa, la línea de crédito que manejan estas señoras es de G. 300.000 hasta G. 800.000 por cada integrante, actualmente son 16 integrantes y cada una trabaja en actividades diferentes como venta de lencería, venta de comidas rápidas, venta de joyas, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de bebidas, golosinas, productos por catálogo, etc.

Ellas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor y desean seguir creciendo, están contentas con el programa pues las ayuda mucho con las capacitaciones que reciben. Los créditos también son de mucha ayuda ya que los invierten en sus microempresas. Hoy día están solicitando un nuevo crédito que lo desean invertir en la compra de mercaderías para la venta.

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as lingerie, meat, fruits and vegetables, silver jewelry, sweets, perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Wahida

texts.en:
Wahida is 25-years-old and is married with two children, ages 1 and 5. Wahida has been selling clothes (bedsheets and khanga--traditional sarongs) since 2001. She works five hours a day and earns a monthly profit of $50.

She is requesting a loan to buy additional bedsheets and khanga for her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional bedsheets and khanga for resale

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita T. sells maize. She is married, but her husband's income from his job as a mason is not sufficient to support Rita and their two children.

She has a good following but is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for a loan to purchase a larger inventory of maize for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more maize

loans.name: Adriana Bernardo

texts.pt:
Adriana Bernardo L. is 41 years old. She is from Caia, a province of Sofala in the central part of Mozambique. She is married and has three sons that are 21, 20 and 18 years old. Besides supporting her three sons she also supports a nephew that lives with them. Adriana attended school up until the 6th grade. She did not continue her education due to financial reasons. In 2000, she left Sofala for Maputo through the church she attended and was involved in. She set up residence in Boane where she still lives. She has her own home located in zone 07. In 2006, she opened up a business that sold tobacco and, in 2007, she introduced a chicken raising and slaughtering business with help from an assistant. She learned how to raise chickens with friends and she has been doing it for a year now. The venture has been doing well despite difficulties in transportation and the rising cost of purchasing hens and tobacco. Weekly, she can sell up to 700,00mt - she has sold a can of tobacco (250g) for 10,00mt and a chicken for 90,00mt. She has not started to save yet because she prefers to invest all in the business. This is her third loan from Hluvuku. The first two were used to purchase tobacco and with the profits she strenghtened the chicken raising business. She now requests 14500,00mt to expand her chicken raising business. Adriana wishes to pay back the loan early so that she can request another loan to build additional aviaries and improve her housing conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Adriana Bernardo L. tem 41 anos de idade, natural de Caia provincia de Sofala ao centro de Moçambique. Casada e mae de tres filhos sendo o maior com 21 anos de idade e o segundo com 20 anos e o terceiro com o 18 anos, para alem de sustentar os filhos também sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele. Adriana estudou até 6ªclasse e nao continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Em 2000 ela saiu da provincia de sofala para maputo atraves da igreja onde prestava trabalhos de cultos. Onde veio a fixar se no distrito de Boane local que se encontra até data hoje. Tem casa propria no bairro 07. Em 2006 abre um negocio que consiste na venda de tabaco e em 2007 introduziu a criação de frangos de corte qual desenvolve com apoio de uma empregada. A criação de frangos aprendeu com amigas e passam um ano que exerce esta actividade. O negocio vai bem apesar das dificuldades de transporte e preços cada dia altos de aquisição do pintos e tabaca semanalmente consegue vender até 700,00mt tendo vendido uma lata de tabaco (250g) por 10,00mt e um frangos por 90,00mt. Ainda nao faz poupança porque prefere ainda ampliar o negocio. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku. Os primeiros dois emprestimos usou o dinheiro para compa de tabaco para revender e com os lucros ia reforçando actividade de criação de frangos. Assim pede este 14.500,00mt para ampliar o seu negocio de frangos. Adriana pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro para construção de novos aviarios e melhorar a sua casa.

loans.use: To increase chicken raising capabilities.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 53-year-old divorced mother of three children. She lives in a very poor neighborhood of Beirut.

She works in the clothes dry-cleaning business. She works for very long hours per day in order to guarantee her three girls a better life.

As the income she generates from her business is not sufficient to improve the livelihood of her family, Nadia also works as a salesperson.

Nadia is requesting USD 1,200 to expand her laundry business by replacing some of the fixed assets. Nadia has been a microcredit client of Al Majmoua for the past five years, and she always has repaid her debts on time.

loans.use: To replace fixed assets in her dry-cleaning business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes P. is 30 years old. She is married and has three kids who are currently in school. She sells maize in the local market of Sunyani, a town in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Her major difficulty has to do with funds to support the business. She requests a loan to enable her buy maize in bulk to grow her business and scale up her sales.

Agnes hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education to give them better future career opportunities. She belongs to the community group called Benjamin Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of maize.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia inició el negocio para poder apoyar en el estudio de sus hijos, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba. Comenzó hace cuatro años después que le ayudaba a su hermana a vender haciendo demostraciones, ella le empezó a pasar ropa para que la vendiera, y hasta la fecha ella es la que compra y le surte.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para poder surtir mercancía de temporada.
texts.en:
Celia started her business in order to help pay for her children's educations, when her husband's salary wasn't enough. She began helping her sister with wardrobe demonstrations about 4 years ago, and from there, her sister began giving her clothing to sell. Since then, she has been the one who sells it and supplies it.

She needs a loan of $575 US ($1 US = 3 soles, approx.) which she will repay in 6 months so she can stock up on merchandise for the season. Celia inició el negocio para poder apoyar en el estudio de sus hijos, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba. Comenzó hace cuatro años después que le ayudaba a su hermana a vender haciendo demostraciones, ella le empezó a pasar ropa para que la vendiera, y hasta la fecha ella es la que compra y le surte.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para poder surtir mercancía de temporada.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 31 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, es conviviente, madre de un hijo varón de 4 años de edad y vive en el Barrio 25 de diciembre del distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno. 

Por falta de capital decidió integrar el Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri. A los 23 años de edad tuvo su pareja y a los 25 años empezó con el negocio de ropa (chompas, mandiles, faldas, etc.), vendía en Conduriri, también se dedica a la compra y venta  de carne de alpaca y ovino, compra en Conduriri y vende en la ciudad de Tacna. Semanalmente lleva de 10 a12 degollados, y desde hace 02 meses se dedica al negocio de combustible.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 03 degollados a S/.120.00  y a S/.150.00 cada uno, dependiendo del peso y calidad.

Su meta es aumentar capital a su nuevo negocio y hacer estudiar a su hijo. “Desde que integra el Banco Comunal he aprendido a caminar a la hora” manifestó  Nancy.
.
texts.en:
Nancy is 31 years old and she completed high school. She is married common law and she is the mother of a little 4-year old boy. She lives in the area called 25 de diciembre (meaning December 25) in the District of Conduiri in the province of El Collao in Puno.

Given the lack of capital she decided to become a member of the Community Baqnk "Maria Parado de Bellido" in Conduiri. At the age of 23 she got married and at the age of 25 she started her business selling clothing (jackets, aprons, skirts, etc.), selling her products in Conduiri. She also buys and sells alpaca and beef meats. She purchases in Conduiri and she sells in the city of Tacna. On a weekly basis she takes 10 to 12 animals, and since about 2 months ago she got into the fuel business.

With this loan, amounting to S/.1000 and which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase 3 animals at S/.120 and S/.150 each one, depending on their quality and weight.

Her goal is to increase the capital for her new job so that her son can go to school. Nancy said " Since I became a member of the Community Bank I have learned to be a success."


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 animals.

loans.name: Muyibout

texts.en: Muyibout is 42 years old and married. She has 5 children. Muyibout sells medicinal herbs and native pots used to steep herbal teas. Muyibout’s family is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial support. Muyibout is asking for a loan of N140,000 ($1200) to increase her inventory of traditional herbal pots and herbs.

loans.use: To purchase medicinal herbs and herbal pots.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: La señora Ángela G. tiene la edad de 34 años habita el barrio altos del norte ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya , junto a su esposo , el cual le poya con los gastos del hogar ya que el trabaja como agricultor . Ellos tiene a su cargo cuatro hijos los estudian; los planes hacia un futuro de doña Ángela es mejor las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. Doña Ángela se dedica a la venta de leche desde hace tres años, ella ya tiene sus clientes que le entrega el producto y el mayor problema que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento, ella solicita el apoyo de Afodenic para poder compra mas cantidad de leche, para poder obtener mas ganancia y sastifacer a sus cliente ya que la demanda amerita invertir mas.
texts.en:
34-year old Señora Angela García lives with her husband and children in a community in the city of Masaya. Her husband also works and they share the household expenses. They have kids in their care who are in school. Angela plans for the future are to improve the living conditions of her children. For 3 years Angela has been in the business of selling milk. She already has her clientele, but the biggest problem she has faced is lack of financing. She is asking for Afodenic's help so that she may buy greater quantities of milk, to be able to obtain more sales and meet the higher demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia O. is sixty years old. She is divorced and the mother of ten children, four of whom are male and six female. She says for the past ten years, ever since she divorced, she has been taking care of the children. The grown-ups are now independent and working. She says her last born is in junior high school.

Cecilia lives with some of her children in a town called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Cecilia enjoys trading very much. She owns a provision shop in which she sells groceries such as milk, Milo (malted milk powder), sugar, biscuits, bread, and many other food items. She has been in business for ten years.

Cecilia also sells tilapia and some vegetables on a small tabletop in front of her store. She says that she procures most of her goods from the big towns nearby. Cecilia wants to use the loan to procure goods in large quantity to stock her shop. She hopes to increase the size of her shop.

loans.use: To buy provisions to expand her shop

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, and is now settled in the Fuzuli region in the village of Bala Bahmanli. Born in 1965, he is married and has two children. 

He has been in this business for five years. His minimum net profit is 200 AZN. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his business.

In the future, he would like to expand his shop and to sell spare parts for all types of cars so he will have a good income. He will spend his future income to build a second shop, where he would like to do wholesale of spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Pann

texts.en:
Mrs. Pann T. is a villager in Ta Suon village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chin Nhoen, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living. In this plantation, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to cultivate rice.

Thus, Mrs. Pann T. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, pesticide, fertilizer, and to plow her field. She is a 45-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are construction workers while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, pesticides, fertilizer, and plow her field

loans.name: Steve

texts.es: Steve es un joven muy activo y trabajador, tiene 21 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres, él tiene muchas ganas de mejorar su vida y salir adelante. Se gana la vida llevando clientes de un lugar a otro, junto a su inseparable taxi, recorren las calles de la ciudad de Puno en busca de personas que deseen tomar un transporte rápido y seguro. A Steve le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede pasear por la calles de la ciudad y distraerse, le gusta tanto conducir, que apenas cumplió la mayoría de edad, decidió ponerse a trabajar de taxista y ya lleva 3 años con esta actividad, anhela tener algún día una empresa de taxis y así mejorar su economía. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es saber decidir a qué pasajeros llevar y a qué sitios ir, ya que siempre está latente el peligro de que le pueda suceder algo malo, aun así Steve sigue trabajado todos los días sin descanso, en busca de alcanzar sus metas y está dispuesto a hacer todo lo posible para lograrlo. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesto a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable, ya que siendo el único varón, no quiere quedar mal ante el resto de las socias. El dinero que solicita es para arreglar su taxi, ya que últimamente está fallando mucho y esto le trae perdidas económicas.
texts.en:
Steve is an active and hard working young man. He is 21 years old, single and lives in his parent’s house. He really feels like doing something to improve his life and succeed. He earns a living taking his customers from one place to another. Inseparable from his taxi, he drives up and down the streets of the town of Puno looking for people who wish to use fast and safe transport. Steve really likes his job, he can walk through the streets of the town and relax. He enjoys driving so much that he had hardly reached adulthood when he decided to work as a taxi driver and has now been working as one for 3 years. He longs to one day have a taxi company and thereby improve his finances. The most difficult part of his job is to know how to decide where passengers will be and which places to go to. There is always the underlying danger that something bad could happen to him yet Steve continues to work every day without a break. He is looking to achieve his goals and is ready to do everything possible to succeed. This is his second loan through MFP. He knows that he must make all of his payments on time and is ready to do so. He is very responsible in his community bank because, being the only man, he does not want to do something wrong in front of the rest of the female partners. The money that he is asking for is to fix up his taxi, as lately it has been breaking down a lot and this is causing him to lose money.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Taxi repairs

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en:
K. Robiya has a responsibility that makes her work hard for improvement. She is a widowed mother and she wants her children to be well-educated, so that they can have a better future. Robiya has worked on farming for the last 8 years. Robiya is a woman of humble heart and position who works very hard every day in her fields to produce her family’s sustenance, planting and tending her potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumber.

Despite the losses Robiya and her family have suffered, they persevere, motivated by their desire for a better life, and that is why Robiya is asking for a loan to buy seed, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants to prepare one of her fields for cultivation. Show your solidarity with this noble but back-breaking cause!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Shuhratchon

texts.ru: Шухратчон – мужчина средних лет (36 лет), женат и отец 4-х детей. У Шухратчона есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состоящее примерно из 30 овец и 20 коз. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти. Шухратчон каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Шухратчона пока мало крупно-рогатого скота. Но Шухратчон за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Шухратчон очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что кредит ему очень помогает.
texts.en:
Shuhratchon G. is a middle aged man of 36, is married and has 4 children. He has a herd of about 30 sheep and 20 goats. His wife is a housewife who in her spare time spins yarn. Shuhratchon takes his herd out every morning into the mountains to graze and returns back with it in the evening. Right now he has a small herd. He would like to use the new loan to buy two average sized bulls. He will feed and fatten them up for about 3-4 months and then sell them at a profitable price. Shuhratchon appreciates being a member of our credit society, the loans have made a big difference for him.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bulls to feed and sell

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward M. is a married Tanzanian micro-businessman. He runs a business raising poultry in the Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. He has constructed four poultry cages where he keeps two egg-laying chickens and two broilers. He collects ten trays of eggs per day, which he sells wholesale by order. He manages to meet his family's daily needs including paying school fees and capitalization. He plans to expand his business by constructing more poultry cages and buying more chicks. He needs a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 (Tanzanian shillings) to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos Fran de 3 y Jenifer de 2 añitos, en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de arroz, el cual trae desde otras provincias para vender en la ciudad de Lima, felizmente la demanda es buena y los precios que ofrece son bastante accesibles, logrando que las personas prefieran sus productos. Angélica cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, y juntos salen adelante en beneficio de sus pequeños hijos. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le permite cumplir su labor de madre, ya que con dos pequeños hijos debe tener muchos cuidados. En el futuro le gustaría tener una gran tienda donde ofrecer de manera más cómoda su producto. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y espera que el trabajo en su banco comunal sea muy bueno, ya que ella pondrá mucho de su parte para que sea así. Con el dinero solicitado viajará a traer más arroz para vender en mayor cantidad, y así aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Angélica is 27 years old, and lives with her husband and their children, Fran, 3 and Jenifer, 2, in their own home. For the last 2 years, Angélica has sold rice, which she brings from other provinces to sell in the city of Lima. Happily, the demand is good and Angélica offers reasonable prices, hoping that people will prefer her products. Angélica relies on the help of her husband, and together they move forward for the benefit of their children. Angélica enjoys her work very much because it allows her to fulfill her duties as a mother, since two small children need a lot of care. In the future, Angélica would like to have a large store where she can more comfortably offer her products. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she hopes that her work with the community bank will go well, since she gives a lot of herself to make it go well. With the loan she has requested, Angélica will travel to bring more rice to sell in greater quantities, in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Mauricio Francisco

texts.es: Mauricio Francisco E. M. tiene 63 años de edad. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de Mauricio es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que su negocio nació con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos de su familia y de esta manera ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios, es importante resaltar que por medio de los financiamientos ha logrado mejorar los ingresos de su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, gaseosas entre otras cosas. El Señor Mauricio tiene como sueño mantener esta actividad económica y obtener los recursos para su familia, por lo que su familia es su mayor prioridad.
texts.en:
Mauricio Francisco E. M. is 63 years old. He has two children whom he takes care of. Mauricio runs a grocery store and has been working in the grocery business for more than 3 years. He started his business because of his desire to be able to take care of his family's expenses and to help pay for his children's education. It is important to highlight that through the previous loans he has received he has been able to make his business more profitable. The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase sweets, fruit drinks, soft drinks, and other grocery items. Señor Mauricio dreams of continuing to run his business and making enough money to take care of his family; his family is his top priority.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en la casa de sus suegros. Desde hace 6 meses se dedica a la venta de papa pelada y picada; anteriormente trabajó elaborando y vendiendo porciones de gelatina (postre) y con los ahorros que logró juntar decidió comprar la que es ahora su herramienta básica de trabajo: una picadora de papa, con la que puede realizar hasta 100 kilos al día. Con la ayuda de su esposo distribuye este producto a los principales restaurantes de su localidad y en una provincia aledaña. Las ganancias son satisfactorias y compensan el gran esfuerzo físico que hace, sobre todo levantarse de madrugada para avanzar con el trabajo. Para el futuro, Rebeca quiere tener máquinas más sofisticadas que produzcan mayor cantidad de papa pelada y picada. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está decidida a realizar un trabajo honesto y puntual en el cumplimiento de sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado a la compra de 15 sacos de papa de 100 kilos cada uno y el pago del transporte del mismo.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 36 years old and lives with her husband and children in her in-laws’ house. For the past six months she has sold peeled and chopped potatoes. Before this she made and sold dessert portions of gelatin and with her savings she decided to buy what is now her basic tool for her work: a potato mincer, with which she can chop up to 100 kilos a day. With the help of her husband she distributes this product to the main restaurants in her neighborhood and in a provincial village. Her profits are satisfactory and make up for the great physical effort that she exerts, including waking up at dawn to get started with her work. In the future Rebeca would like to have more sophisticated machines that will produce a greater quantity of peeled and chopped potato. This is the first time she has requested a loan from MFP and she is dedicated to working honestly and being punctual in fulfilling her payments. The loan that she requests will go towards the purchase of 15 sacks of potatoes of 100 kilos each and the payment to transport it.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. manages a medium-sized store. She has been in this business since 1996. So far, her business is doing well. Because of her business, she was able to buy a rice farm, which is 3 hectares in size. She was also able to send her two children in school.
 
Cecilia wants to make her business grow more. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (or about $525 US) to purchase assorted merchandise for her store. She thinks that the loan will help attract more customers, which will also help increase her family's income.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides loans, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase assorted merchandise for her store

loans.name: Safar

texts.en: Safar S. is a 43-year-old married father with two children. Safar has a small tea-shop where he provides clients with fresh and tasty tea. The tea ceremony is very important among Azerbaijani people and his place is quite popular in the region where he lives. He starts his working day at 11am and around 1pm people begin to come to his place which is usually open until 3-4am.  When his place became popular enough he was able to dedicate his whole time to the business.  Safar wants a loan to invest in tables, chairs and utensils.  He is requesting $2000 so he can expand his business, earn more profit, and in turn help his children complete their school studies and further continue studying at the University. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of his business and they will be grateful!

loans.use: To purchase tables, chairs, and utensils for his cafe.

loans.name: Djeynaba

texts.fr: djeynaba S. est un parent bénéficiaire spécialisée dans le petit commerce de produits pour enfants et surtout dans les produits saisonniers(mangues).elle a une expérience de plus de dix ans dans son activité.elle assiste beaucoup son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.par conséquent elle sollicite un crédit de cinquante mille(50 000)frs pour augmenter son fond et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Djeynaba S. is a recipient parent specialized in small-scale commerce in children’s merchandise and especially in seasonal goods (mangoes). She has over ten years of experience in her work. She helps her husband very much with managing day-to-day expenses. Consequently, she’s requesting a loan of 50,000 francs to increase her working capital and to satisfy her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza    es socia del Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, del  distrito de Ilave, provincia el Callao, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 26                      años de edad, es conviviente hace 6 años, ella tiene 1 hijo su pareja trabaja como mecánico, ella tiene estudio de superior incompleto.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/300.00 nuevos soles monto que le sirvió para adquirir cemento para techar su casa.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles con el préstamo ella podrá adquirir mas mercadería de calzados ya que se dedica a la venta de esto hace muchos años  los cuales los compra en Juliaca y Desaguadero y los vende cada domingo en Ilave.

Su mayor anhelo es convertirse en mayorista y así sus ingresos aumentarían, también pide siempre a Dios que su hijo sea un buen profesional.

Lo que le gusta de las reuniones de su banco comunal son las capacitaciones, los ahorros y no le gusta la impuntualidad.

loans.use: Para la compra de calsados

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn R. is from Pagadian City. She is 29 years old. Merlyn is single and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing new clothing to local community members. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Merlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Erland

texts.es: El Sr. Erland G. G. se dedica hace 14 años al servicio de transporte público, siendo durante mucho tiempo simplemente chofer, hasta que logro comprar su propio vehículo en el que trabaja desde hace 3 años, todos los días sale a trabajar a las 7:00 am y regresa a las 20:00 a su casa. Su esposa tambien le colabora en la economia del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a cuidar de sus dos hijos que van a la escuela primaria del barrio, el señor Erland tambien trabaja algunas veces por las noches, el crédito que le ha sido otorgado es de gran ayuda para él, puesto que su automovil  necesitaba entrar al taller  para mantenimiento, por lo que esta muy contento de contar con el apoyo que le brinda la institucion y esta muy comprometido en no fallar, para ser un ejemplo para su familia. Desea con el tiempo poder comprar otra movilidad para poder darle mejores oportunidades a su familia y asi no tener que estar mucho tiempo fuera de la casa y compartir más con su familia.

loans.use: Mejoras a la movilidad de trabajo

loans.name: Regina Rafael
