texts.pt:
Regina B. nasceu em Chibuto, Província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 45 anos de idade, divorciada mãe de 2 filhos, de 25 e 18 anos de idade, o mais novo esta a estudar. Estudou ate 5ª classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pelos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com os seus 2 folhos e sustenta também a sua mãe que vivi em Mahelane Distrito de Namaacha, enviando lhe géneros alimentícios.

Saíram de Chibuto 1992 a Maputo (bairro de Hulene) em casa de seus familiares, quando divorciou se do marido, enfrentando varias dificuldade na sua vida decide mudar se para Mahelane a procura de emprego. Começa a trabalhar em 2002 numa empresa de produção e venda de Banana (Bananalandia) onde trabalha cerca de 12h por dia. Esta actividade aprendeu com os pais em Chibuto desde 1972.

Nunca trabalhou com outras instituições de credito, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua sobrinha e colega de serviço que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, pedra, ferro, cimento e chapas de zinco) para melhorar a sua residência.

Tem como desafios no seu plano, o elevado preço de material de construção, para isso compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo, a fim de aceder a mais créditos no futuro e concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Regina B. was born in Chibuto, province of Gaza, in the south of Mozambique. She is 45 years old, divorced and mother of two, who are 25 and 18 years old. The younger of her children is attending school. She has studied up to 5th grade, and she hasn't continued to study because of her parents' financial problems. She lives in her own house with her two sons. She also supports her mother, who lives in Mahelane, Namaacha district, by sending her food.

They left Chibuto in 1992 to Maputo (Hulene neighborhood) for a relative's house when she divorced her husband. They were facing various difficulties in life and she decided to move to Mahelane and search for work. She started working in 2002 in a company that produces and sells banana (Bananalandia). There, she works about 12 hours a day. She has learned this activity from her parents in Chibuto, in 1972.

She has never worked with other credit institutions. She learned about Hluvuku from a niece and co-worker, who is also one of the institution's clients. This is her first loan, of MZN 10,000.00 ($350). She intends to use this money to improve her house, buying construction materials (sand, stones, steel, cement and zinc sheets).

One of her challenges is the price of the construction materials. For this reason, she undertakes to pay properly her debit in order to have access to new loans in the future and so, conclude the construction.


Translated from Portuguese by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials (cement, sand, zinc sheets and others)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grocery items to sell

loans.name: Petrona Cecilia

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras es la actividad a la que con mucho ahínco se dedica la señora Petrona E. en el mercado central del departamento de Chinandega ofreciendo chiltomas, tomates, ajos, naranjas, limones, zanahorias, cebollas y camarones.
Gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos, ella ha logrado desarrollar su negocio y a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo, poco a poco ha brindado mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
El crédito actualmente lo solicita para la compra de las frutas, verduras y los camarones para continuar ofreciéndolo a los fieles clientes que ella posee en su localidad.
texts.en:
Petrona E. very zealously sells fruits and vegetables in Chinandega's central market. She stocks such items as: peppers, tomatoes, garlic, oranges, lemons, carrots, onions, and shrimp. Thanks to her multiple efforts she has managed to develop her business and, over time, little by little, has been able to provide her family with better living conditions. The financing needed now is to buy fruits, vegetables and shrimp so that she can continue to offer them to her regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and shrimp.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda R. is from Mayor's Village in Lapasan. She is 40 years old. Luzminda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Luzminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Luzminda's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nike

texts.en: Nike's business is booming.  She is 50 years old and married with two children. She sells drinks, which she buys from distributors. She also rents plates, cups, etc for occasions. She has been in business for 10 years. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Nike wants to see her business grow bigger than this but one of the challenges she faces in her drinks business is capital.  She hopes for a loan of NGN 180,000 to purchase more drinks to sells. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 35-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ibrahim has owned a butcher shop for over fifteen years. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues due to the cost of his machines, the rent, and other expenses related to his shop, but he always did his best to manage and not to have debts.

He decided on opening his shop because he realized that there wasn’t a butcher shop in his region and that people had to go a bit far from their home to purchase their meat. Ibrahim is special in his work because he is known for his good quality meat. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase cows for his business. This is the first time that Ibrahim has requested a loan.

His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase cows for his business.

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
El señor José G. se dedica al trabajo de agente de seguridad en un colegio del municipio de San Rafael en Managua. Está comprometido con el bienestar de su familia por lo que ha tomado la decisión de comprar un terreno o espacio para construir su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida propia y de su familia.

Por esta razón es que está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de dicho terreno y así iniciar a construir la vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. José G. G. works as a security guard at a school in the municipality of San Rafael in Managua. He is dedicated to the well being of his family, for this reason he has decided to buy a piece of land on which to build a home. He intends to improve his own living conditions and the living conditions of his family. He is taking out a loan to invest in the purchase of land and to start building his home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construccion materials like blocks, sand and cement

loans.name: Jennith

texts.en:
Jennith B. is from the village of Tipan Oroquieta City. She is forty-seven years old. Jennith is married and has six grown children. To make a living, Jennith owns and operates a specialized retail store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her store comes primarily from selling charcoal  in the local community. Jennith has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jennith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jennith is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which she will use as additional capital. This will Jennith's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to better meet the needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a 34 year old mother of two children. She is a tailor and a dressmaker in Embakasi in Nairobi, but she was previously employed. Her husband is employed as a civil servant. She has been able to expand her business, which has been running for four years through Faulu Kenya. She has taken out one loan from Faulu Kenya in the past and she plans to take out a loan of Kes.40,000 to purchase more fabric. She hopes to have a textile industry in the future. She dreams of becoming a famous business lady in ten years.

loans.use: To add stock of fabric.

loans.name: Kezia

texts.en:
Kezia K. is a fifty-one year old lady. She is married to Basil Atenya, a farmer, and they have three children between the ages of 35 and 18 years. She has been running a small cafe in Shibuye market, Kakamega town for the last six years. The income she generates from this business has played a great part in uplifting her living standards. 

Kezia sells mainly cooked food and refreshments, and the quality meals and drinks she serves keep her customers coming back. Her clients are mainly shoppers in Shibuye market.

This is her third loan from KADET Ltd and she intends to use the money to buy more foodstuffs like baking flour, sugar and maize flour.

She aspires to purchase and develop a plot of land, where she can construct her residential home. She also wants to contribute to less fortunate members within her locality like orphans.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Jorge Gustavo

texts.es: El señor Jorge Gustavo S. D. cuenta con el negocio de transporte tiene un auto station wagon el cual el mismo lo maneja, eligio este negocio ya que es rentable y viene trabajando con una experiencia de mas de 30 años, tiene un ingreso de s/300 aprox. mensual. El crédito que se le esta otrogando lo utilizará en el mantenimiento de su vehículo. Es casado, su conyuge es cesante del ministerio de educación tienen dos hijos mayores de 34 y 29 años ellos son totalmente independientes ya que tienen familia. El señor Jorge tiene el sueño de comprarse otro auto mas adelante.
texts.en:
S. D. Jorge Gustavo, with identification number DNI 21403043, currently lives in the neighborhood of El Carmen, near Ica. His work is in the field of transportation. He is married and lives in his own house. He is requesting the loan for maintenance work on his car. He hopes to continue expanding his business in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in maintenance for his car as a business asset

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es:
La señora María Graciela G. es separada, tiene 48 años y tiene 5 hijos, 2 varones y 3 nenas.
María Graciela desde hace 13 años se dedica a la venta de mercaderías de uso domestico en forma ambulante esto recorriendo los negocios de varios lugares proveyéndoles de mercaderías, esta es la forma que pensó en su momento de trabajar y así ganar un poco de dinero para mantener a sus 5 hijos. María junto con sus tres hijas salen a vender ropa en forma ambulante.
Ahora la señora María con sus ahorro y con su esfuerzo ya habilitó también un pequeño almacén que lo atienden sus hijos cuando ella sale a vender sus prendas.
En la actualidad María pudo edificar su propio salón de ventas donde atiende cómodamente a sus clientes. En adelante quiere seguir aumentando el nivel de mercaderías para así satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela para este fin solicita el crédito
texts.en:
Señora María Graciela G. is separated. She is 48 years old and has five children, two sons and three daughters.

For 13 years, María Graciela worked as a walking vendor, selling household products. She went around to businesses in various locations, providing them with merchandise. This was how she was thinking at that time, that she would work and thus earn a little money to maintain her five children. Maria and her three daughters sold clothing as walking vendors.

Now María, with her savings and her effort, has also set up a small grocery store, which her daughters tend while she goes out to sell her goods.

At this time María has also been able to build her own sales room, where she can attend to her customers in comfort. In the future, she wants to continue increasing the level of merchandise to thus satisfy the needs of her customers. This is why she is applying for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy herbs, beans, sugar, rice, soft drinks, beer, oil, milk, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia Samuel

texts.pt:
Ofélia Samuel G. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província do Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 44 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 9 filhos de idades compreendidas entre 25 a 6 anos de idade, os 5 últimos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Manjacaze para Maputo no Distrito de Boane com seus pais quando tinha somente 2 anos de idade. Trabalha numa empresa de produção e venda de Banana (BANANALANDIA) e tem um negócio próprio que desenvolve depois de sair do seu trabalho. Não possui nenhum empregado consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.600,00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum mensalmente através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mercadoria (capulanas, panelas, chaleiras e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 3.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt para o comércio e habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua casa e desenvolver ainda mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Ofélia Samuel was born in the district of Manjacaze, in the Maputo Province, South of Mozambique. She is 44 years old, a widow and the mother of 9 children between 25 and 6 years old. The five youngest children go to school. She only completed 6th grade and didn't finish school due to her parents' lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her children and doesn't support anyone else. She left Manjacaze to the Boane district in Maputo with her parents when she was only 2 years old. She works in a banana growing and selling plant (Bananalandia) and has had her own business after work. She doesn't have any employees and has an income of around 4.600.00m per month, which goes to household expenses and she manages to save some money in a traditional rotational savings system (Xitique). She has never had loans with other banks. She came to know Hluvuku through work colleagues who are also partners of the same institution. This loan, in the amount of 15.000.00mt is her fourth. She intends to buy merchandise ("capulanas"- traditional garments from Mozambique, pots, kettles and others) to increase her inventory. The previous loans were for 3.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt and 10.000.00mt for trade and housing. She commits to paying this loan on time in order to be able to be granted other loans. In the future, she would like to request more loans to finish her house and to further improve her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (capulanas - traditional garments from Mozambique, pots, kettles and others)

loans.name: Vong

texts.en: Vong S., 29, is married and resides with her husband and three children in the Kampong Chnang province of Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She is a garment factory worker and earns an income of $2 USD per day. Her husband operates his truck to transport garment factory workers, earning an income of $5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD to buy a new truck to transport the workers. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new truck to transport workers from the factory

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta H. is a 57 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a fish and food vending business. She lives in Cadiz, Negros Occidental with her husband and their 5 children who are between 15-31 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish and food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 4,000.

Violeta is now borrowing Php 15,000 so that she could use it as an additional working capital for the business. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Violeta aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr: Diouma S. est une femme de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle est aussi tutrice de 02 élèves. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KOUTEDIOMBOULOU depuis le 28 mai 2008 et a eu 05 expériences avec le crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait un petit commerce de balais traditionnel faits à partir de feuilles de palmier, de l'huile de palme et de la pâte d'arachide. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter en quantité suffisante sa marchandises (balais, l'huile de palme et pâte d'arachide) Elle s'approvisionne à partir des marchés hebdomadaires de la zone et des villages environnants. Elle revend sa marchandise à Dakar. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de l'activité sont utilisés pour améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Diouma S. is 34 years old, married, with two children of her own and two children to whom she is guardian. She has been a member of the Koutediomboulou Banc Villageois since May 28, 2008, and she has had five previous loans that she has repaid without any problems. She has a small business selling palm oil, peanut butter and traditional brooms made from palm leaves. This new loan will allow Madame S. to buy her goods (brooms, palm oil and peanut butter) in much larger quantities. She stocks up at the weekly markets in her area as well as in the surrounding villages. She resells her goods in Dakar. Her earnings from this business activity are used to improve her family's standard of living and to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and develop her business

loans.name: Dorina Isabel

texts.es:
Dorina Isabel F. M. tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 8 años, junto a su familia reside en la colonia Colman en la ciudad de Juticalpa. Hace un tiempo atras comenzo vendiendo ropa usada, ahora ella tiene un negocio de venta de enchape de oro y lo hace de forma ambulante. Sale a vender junto a su tia por las tardes, ya que por la mañana sus hijos van a la escuela y ella tiene que esperar a que lleguen a casa para poder salir. 

El prestamo lo utilizara para construir una habitacion mas en su casa y para eso necesita comprar 700 bloques, 30 varillas, 30 bolsas de cemento, arena, aluzinc, alambre de amarrel. 

Con la construccion de la habitacion su familia estara mas comoda ya que su casa sera mas amplia. Su sueño es que sus hijos crezcan en un ambiente sano y que tengan una educacion para que sean personas autosostenibles.

Dorina ha sido cliente de FAMA por varios ciclos y eso le ha ayudado a darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Dorina Isabel F. M. is 27, married and has two children, 11 and 8. She lives with her family in the Colman neighborhood of the city of Juticalpa. A while ago she began selling used clothing. Now she has a business selling gold plated jewelry as a street vendor. She goes out in the afternoons with her aunt, since her children go to school in the mornings and she has to wait for them to get home before she can leave her house. She will use the loan to build a room on her house and for this she needs 700 cement blocks, 30 rods, 30 bags of cement, sand, aluminum-zinc and wrapping wire. Her family will be more comfortable after the room is built since the house will be bigger. Her dream is for her children to grow up with healthy surroundings and that they have a good education so that they can be self-supporting in the future. Dorina has been a client of FAMA for several cycles and this has helped her give the family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for a room

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn P. is from the village of Marapong, Sibutad. She is 38 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling assorted household items. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,300 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional working capital for her business. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stock to sell. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Merlyn from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina lives with her family in a city called Borewala which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She has spent twenty years of her life in this city. Her husband is a butcher by profession and sells chicken meat specifically. 

She is the mother of four sons and two daughters. All of them are getting their education and studying in different classes. It is very difficult for Zarina and her husband to afford their children’s education. Her husband is barely able to fulfill the family's basic needs. Therefore, Zarina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. 

With the loan, he will buy more chickens to fill larger orders, particularly during the wedding season.  Zarina is hopeful that her husband will be able to upgrade his business. He has been in this business for the past fifteen years and has vast experience in this field. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 3rd loan cycle. She has proven to be a responsible person in her previous two years of loan experience.

loans.use: Purchase chickens for chicken meat selling business

loans.name: Luyen

texts.en: Luyen N. T. is 36 years old and has four children who are attending either high school or secondary school.  She earns her income income by farming and raising pigs. Currently, she is taking care of rice in a paddy of 1,400 meters square and raising 300 chickens for eggs. It has been seven years since she joined our program. Her weekly repayment is very good.  She wants to take out a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Sincere Business Group

texts.en:
Urias D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Sincere Business.  He is 23 years old, single, and is currently in school.
 
For four years, he has been selling shoes and slippers on Randall Street in down town Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more shoes and slippers. 

He describes himself as a determine man whose goals are to improve his business, and continue with his education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Boakai is inset at the lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and slippers

loans.name: Cándida Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Cándida Rosa S. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, se desempeña como secretaria en el Ministerio de Educación donde tiene 17 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de mejorar su vvienda con el que compraría ladrillos y zinc.
texts.en: Cándida Rosa S. is from the city of Santa Rosa del Peñón. She works as a secretary at the Ministry of Education, where she has worked for 17 years. This is her first loan with Ceprodel. With this loan, she wants to improve her home and she will buy bricks and zinc sheeting.

loans.use: to buy bricks and zinc sheeting

loans.name: Maitza Clemencia

texts.es:
Maritza de 41 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. Tiene con su esposo una pequeña farmacia en un local lejano a su casa. 

Empezó hace 30 años en el cantón Vinces ayudando a su mama con el negocio de una farmacia vendiendo productos farmacéuticos, después de haberse casado con su esposo decidieron vivir en Guayaquil y tener su propia farmacia para poder mantenerse. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja con su esposo desde las 06h00am hasta las el anochecer. Tiene en la farmacia aspirinas desde $ 0.25 c/u, pañales a $ 0.40 c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, ladrillos y arena para construir mejor su casa y readecuar el local de la farmacia. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa propia y tener cuartos de alquiler para tener ingresos adicionales.
texts.en:
Maritza is 41 years old. She lives in an area called Fortín, characterized by its dirt roads and mountains. She has a husband and a small pharmacy in a locale far from her house.  

She started 30 years ago in the Vinces canton helping her mother in the pharmacy business selling pharmaceutical products. After she married her husband, they decided to live in Guayaquil and have their own pharmacy to be able to support themselves. Since then she has worked with her husband from 6 am until evening. She has aspirin at her pharmacy for from $.25 each, and diapers at $.40 each.   

With the loan, she wants to buy cement, bricks and sand to improve her house and refurbish the pharmacy locale. In the future, she wants to finish building her own house and have rental rooms to have additional income.

loans.use: Cement, bricks, sand

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with four children, one girl and three boys all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She operates a cloth material selling business going from door to door and from home.  Christine has run her operation for over twelve years. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. 

Christine faces a challenge because the price of materials fluctuates. She hopes to rent a stall to sell cloth materials and to avoid going from door to door in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of materials for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of matereials for resale.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona, de 42 años, es una mujer muy alegre y luchadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Frans de 41 años y sus 5 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. El cultivo de cacao, café y hojas de coca es la actividad que realiza diariamente Simona. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, lo cual ha generado que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad y muy bien apreciados en la ciudad de San Francisco, que es donde lleva a vender sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea tener el crédito suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras y así incrementar sus cultivos. Este es el décimo segundo crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café, sacos de abono y fertilizantes, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Simona, age 42, is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her 41 year-old husband and her five young children, to whom she desires to offer a better future. The cultivation of cocoa, coffee and coke leaves is the activity that Simona does daily. With much effort she has managed to make her lands be productive, which has made her crops be of good quality. They are well appreciated in the city of San Francisco, which is where she takes her products to be sold. What she likes the most about her work is caring for her crops and she does it with care. She has been doing this activity for five years. She thinks that the most difficult part of the job is transporting the products, since the sacks that she caries are very heavy and they make her very tired. In the future, she desires to have enough money to buy new lands and therefore increase her crops. This is the twelfth loan with MFP and she hopes to be punctual in her payments, since she doesn't want to cause problems for her communal bank, with which she feels very happy. With the 2,000 soles asked for, she will buy cocoa and coffee beans, and sacks of fertilizer, with which she hopes to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy cocoa beans, coffee, and sacks of fertilizer to improve her productivity.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome M. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 49 years-old and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Salome owns and operates a business in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from buying and selling daily use products such as junk food and beverages in the local community. She is also making and selling snacks such as banana chips. Salome has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Salome joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salome has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,010 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Salome is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Salome from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

loans.name: Henry Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Henry Cheruiyot B. is 29 years old, married to Mary Cheruiyot who is a business lady and this also is a source of additional income for the family. They have two children going to school aged three and two years old, their residence is in Eldoret-Kenya. He is selling milk and has been in this business for three years and earns a monthly profit of KES.8, 000.

Henry learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area and is applying for the first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to buy one cow.  He plans to use to the profits to expand on his Milk business.

In future Henry wishes to have a dairy farm. His deeper desire is to see his children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy one cow.

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofia tiene 72 años D. edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, resiD. junto a su esposo y a uno D. sus hijos en una zona marginal del distrito D. Cayaltí, la localidad se caracteriza por ser agrícola y por tener movimiento comercial considerable. Se encuentra ubicada a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como comerciante en una bodega que tiene instalada en su vivienda desD. hace más D. veinte años. Ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos D. uso diario, ente abarrotes y productos D. primera necesidad. Su negocio tiene bastante acogida entre la personas del lugar ya que suele ofrecer productos D. buena calidad y un buen trato a sus clientes.

Sofía desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería D. modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Sofia is 72 years old, married and has four children.  She lives together with her husband and one of her children in a poor area of Cayaltí district.  This is an agricultural area which has considerable commercial activity.  It is located more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Sofia works as a saleswoman in a small grocery store which is located in her home.  She has had her store for more twenty years.  She offers her customers a range of daily-use products, both groceries and convenience store items.  Her business is quite popular with local people since she usually offers good-quality products and provides good customer service.

Sofia would like to expand her business, acquiring more merchandise so that she can satisfy the demand that she currently has.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire more merchandise so that she can satisfy the demand that she currently has

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and six young children who are still attending school. He has worked as a private taxi driver for more than five years. Because of his old age, some of his children must replace him from time to time in the client’s transportation business to maintain the family in a reasonable financial state.     

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to make the necessary repairs on the car and do some painting so that he can serve his customers in an appropriate means of transportation.

loans.use: To make the necessary repairs on the car and do some painting

loans.name: Danga

texts.en: Danga is currently in business selling tomatoes, onions, fish, rice, etc. She is 32 years old, married to a working class husband, with three children and all go to school. Danga took out a loan to stock more tomatoes, onions, fish, rice, etc to sell. With extra profits, Danga hopes to expand her business further in the future.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes, onions, fish, rice, etc. to sell out of her home

loans.name: Mrs. Neang Chanthol Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fourteen people from the village of Chumrov, in Takeo province. Mrs. Neang C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. The members will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living situations. Mrs. Neang C. is a widow with a child who is attending the local public school. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her famiL.. She is also a weaver. Since her weaving business is going well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Neang C. is applying for a loan to buy more silk for weaving.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pea seeds

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 58 years old, and a mother of three children ages: 35, 25 and 20.  She has been practicing dairy farming for over seven years.  She also does horticultural farming.  She has been able to boost her farming through Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to become a large-scale farmer in the future.  She requested 50,000 kes which she will use to a buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nicolas Alonso

texts.es: Nicolás de 59 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene un negocio de servicio de reparación de bicicletas. Comenzó su negocio hace diez años cuando él se jubilo, pues siempre ha sido un hombre activo y necesitaba una actividad para mantenerse ocupado es por eso que decide establecerse con este negocio. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo mejorar su local de trabajo. En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano, el es muy conocido en su localidad y todos sus clientes saben del buen servicio que ofrece. Este crédito es para la compra de llantas, asientos, calcomanías, cadenas y acondicionar su lugar de trabajo. En el futuro quiere tener más ingresos para asegurar su futuro
texts.en:
Nicolás is 59 years old.  He is a hard-working man who has a bicycle repair business.  He started his business ten years ago when he retired since he has always been an active man and he needed something to keep himself occupied.  This is why he decided to set up his business.  Gradually, with a lot of effort and dedication, he managed to improve his work premises.  He currently works from very early in the morning.  He is very well known in his town and all his customers are aware of the good service that he offers.

Nicolás will use this loan to buy tires, seats, decals and chains, and to fit out his work premises.  In the future, he would like to make more income so that he can secure his future.

loans.use: to buy tires, seats, decals and chains, and to fit out his work premises

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Sek S. is a 29-year-old woman who has been living in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is married without any children. She works as a tailor, repairing and sewing clothes in her village in order to earn a daily profit. She has a life partner in her husband who owns a workshop along the street where he provides a haircutting service. Sek S. is requesting a loan of $300 in order to buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine was born in 1977. She has 3 children who are aged between 11 months and 7 years. Her two oldest children are in school while the youngest isn’t. Delphine owns a general store in which she sells different kinds of food stuffs such as Irish potatoes, rice and green bananas. She has been doing this business for 4 years and it has helped her to meet her family's needs. Delphine’s husband runs the business with her. She is requesting a loan to add more inventory to her shop.

loans.use: To increase her shop inventory.

loans.name: Sister Ama

texts.en: Sister Ama A. sells rice, oil, sugar, tomatoes, salted fish and other items at Elmina near Abreshia, a village in Cape Coast. She has been in this business for a long time and wishes to expand it. A loan from Kiva will help her to expand her business by purchasing more of the items she sells. She hopes to build a store from her sales one day.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, sugar, tomatoes, salted fish, etc.

loans.name: Aide Plus Group

texts.en:
Aide Plus is a community bank of 12 owners of small businesses chaired by André. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRCongo to grow their businesses.

André, 45, is married. He sells loaves of bread in his area. He became a micro-entrepreneur in 2009. André is loyal client who received already seven loans from the microfinance institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. He intends to use the next loan to purchase some more baskets of loaves of bread to resell in order to reinforce his working capital. Currently, he earns a profit of $75 a week. His ambition is to open a bakery in his environment. André has six children whose ages vary between 2 and 15 years old.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his business by purchasing some more baskets of loaves of bread to resell in order to reinforce his working capital.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a 32-year-old married man and father of two children from A. Ashrafieh, Jordan. Jihad owns a grocery store. He is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to purchase more products in order to offer his customers more variety and to increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase more products

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old, married and has three children. Myrna is in the agricultural business of raising hogs in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and feed for her pigs.

Myrna has been raising hogs for five years, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: Hilaria tiene su negocio que es una pulpería, hace más de 20 años, que tiene esta actividad. Ella es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de obtener un medio de vida para mantener a su familia. Ella solicita el financiamiento para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas, granos básicos y enlatados. Sus objetivos son de comprar una gran variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Hilary has a business that is a grocery store; she has been doing this for over 20 years. She is a very responsible person and enjoys earning a living to support her family. She is requesting funding for the purchase of candy, soda, bread, crackers, basic grains and canned goods. Her objectives are to buy a good variety of products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy candy, soda, bread, crackers, basic grains and canned goods

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 25 years old and single. He is a farmer who tills a land in Trinidad, Bohol. He primarily grows rice for sell. Michael earns about 6000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Michael requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor. He hopes for this loan to help increase his harvest.

In the future, Michael hopes to improve his house and have his own family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Neker

texts.en:
Neker is 37 years old and lives in the airport community. She is not literate. She is married and has four children between 11 and 16 years old. They are in school.

For the past 25 years she been selling soft drinks, beer and cold water. One of the problems she faces is a shortage of goods.

She is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks, beer and cold water for her business. Her plan is to build a community clinic, keep her children in school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beer and cold water for her business,

loans.name: Zhora

texts.en:
Zhora is 69 years old and lives in the village of Tskaltubo. He lives with his wife, Fatula, and their son, daughter-in-law, and 20-year-old grandson. All of the family members are involved in the family agricultural business which is their only source of the income, along with the pensions received by Zhora and Fatula. 

Zhora’s family has four cows and Fatula produces approximately 80 kilograms of cheese each month that is sold at the local open market. The family also operates a small pig farm with one pig that provides piglets that they sell. Zhora and his family also have a plot of land with 80 peach trees that are harvested and the fruit is sold locally on the open market. The family’s total average monthly is 672 GEL.

Zhora is requesting a loan to purchase chickens and chicken feed. The family owns a hen house, which is currently not in use but is well-equipped and able to be used. Zhora will sell the hens and eggs at the local market. 

This new business initiative will significantly increase the family’s income and have a positive impact on their living conditions. For the first year, Zhora plans to reinvest the entire profit received from his new poultry farm back into the same business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 57 years of age and married with three children. She owns and operates a business selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.  Ana needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Ana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Ana's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth lives in GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is 36 and married to Ferdinand, an overseas contract worker, with whom she has three children. Her oldest child is already in college, while the youngest is still in elementary school. Along with her husband, she works hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Lilibeth sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through direct sales programs such as Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. When a customer orders a product, Lilibeth orders it from the company, and the customer is given one month to pay his or her bill. Her customers are her neighbors and people in her community.  Each week, she earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from sales.

Lilibeth plans to use this 10,000 PHP loan as up-front cash to fulfill orders for her customers. She hopes the loan will enable her to expand her business and boost her income. 

Lilibeth faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other direct sales products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru hace mas de 10 años. Rosa tiene un Panificadora, empezó con $2.00, poco a poco junto $10.00 y le dieron de préstamo $50.00 dólares, con ese dinero compró harina para hacer los panes pero en ese entonces era poco lo que tenía, ahora el préstamo que esta solicitando lo utilizará para comprar de harina para la preparación de los panes, ella agradece todo el apoyo que le brindaron para seguir con su negocio, ya que ahora la meta que tiene es poder tener su propio horno, por ahora lo alquila. Le encanta las capacitaciones, y dice que aprendió mucho para poder tener un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the 'Granito de Mostaza' community bank.  She is 37 years old and has three children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than 10 years.  Rosa has a bakery.  She started out with $2.00, gradually added $10.00 and received a loan for $50.00.  With this money, she bought flour for making bread but, back then, she didn't have much at all. 

Rosa will use the loan that she is currently requesting to buy flour for making her bread.  She is grateful for all the support that she has been given to help her continue in her business.  Her goal is to own her own oven because she rents the one that she currently uses.  Rosa enjoys the training sessions and says that she has learned a lot which has enabled her to have a good business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making bread

loans.name: Campde Garde /mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Mame Diarra est créé en Novembre  2006  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 23 femmes qui toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Dalanda ,  (Assise en deuxième position de la  gauche vers la droite), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 65 ans, est mariée et mère de 07 enfants.

Elle est  vendeuse de crème glaces et de jus dans son quartier  depuis plus de 15 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter en quantité les différents produits pour la préparation de jus et crème glacée.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins domestiques et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The Mame Diarra group was created in November 2006, the day of the inauguration of the "banc villageois". It is composed of 23 women who are all from the same neighborhood. Their principle activity is small-scale retailing. 

Madame Dalanda (seated in second position from left to right) is the leader of the group. She is 65, married and the mother of seven children. She has been selling ice creams and juice in her neighborhood for more than 15 years. With this loan she counts on buying various products in large quantity for making juice and ice cream. 

The profit from her business will permit her to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses of the household and to add to her savings.

loans.use: to buy in large quantity the various products needed for making juice and ice cream.

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Далер перспективный и умный юноша. Ему 21 год, не женат. Несмотря на свою молодость, он имеет за его плечами 4 летний предпринимательский опыт. Далер занимается куплей и продажей мебели. Он продает спальные гарнитуры, шкафы, столы и стулья, диваны  и многое другое. Ему привозят товары из  центра на общую сумму $1500 США. Далер открыл свою точку и хочет расширить  бизнес, но не имеет нужной суммы. Он запрашивает займ на сумму $2000 США для  покупки мебели и увеличения товарооборота. Этот займ поможет Далеру в развитии бизнеса.
texts.en: D. is a promising and smart young man. He is 21 years old, he is not married. Although he is young he has four years of experience doing business. D. buys and sells furniture. He sells bedroom sets, dressers, tables and chairs, sofas and many other things. The merchandise is delivered to him from the city center for the total amount of $1,500 USD. D. opened his space and wants to expand the business, but does not have the necessary amount. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $2,000 USD to buy furniture and increase commodity circulation. This loan will help D. in growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy furniture and increase commodity turnover.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 37 years old and married with three children. He has been carrying out farming in Kitale town, Western Kenya for 16 years and currently employs one farmhand. His produce of maize, beans and poultry birds goes to the local market. In addition, he runs a timber hardware business in the local market.

Alex has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the acquisition of another dairy cow will improve the family income and make life better, especially for the children. He is optimistic the business will continue to grow.

He laments of unreliable rainfall and animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es: El señor Fermín tiene un vehículo que funciona como “trufi” (significa que tienen una ruta establecida) y  está afiliado en uno de los sindicatos de choferes de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehículo, pues necesita un cambio de todos los aceites y fluidos, además de un chequeo de frenos y del motor. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Achachicala en la ciudad de La Paz. Fermin es divorciado y tiene tres hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita que su crédito sea canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Fermín has a vehicle that functions as a “trufi” (a taxi that has an established route). He is affiliated with one of the taxi driver unions in the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be used for the maintenance of his vehicle. All of the oil and fluids need to be changed. In addition, the brakes and the engine need to be checked. Fermín lives at his parents’ house in the District of Achachicala in the city of La Paz. He is divorced and has three children.

This is the second time that his loan request is being referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro de Villa Adela, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: elaboración de polleras, compra de tela.

La señora Margarita  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confesión de polleras que viene trabajando hace años atrás. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de telas) que comprará de las galerias y posteriormente lo comercializará en su local. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los servicios.
texts.en:
A.C. “ESTRELLITAS” (Little Stars) will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Pro Woman).  As part of the Centro de Villa Adela, this group is made up of seven members and is managed by a leadership commitee where the lady Margarita is the treasurer.  The businesses that the members of the community association carry out are varied; among them, we have: making polleras (long traditional style pleated skirts), with the purchase of fabric. 

Margarita indicates that this is her first cycle that she has worked with Pro Mujer, joining by the invitation of an assessor.  Currently, she has a skirt making business that she has been working at for many years. 

The loan that she is taking out is to increase her capital, purchasing fabric which she will buy in the galleries and then market in her home.  This form of work permits her to generate resources in order to support her family.  She is married with three children.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the services provided.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Luordes vive en casa de sus padres, ella desea el credito debido a que ahora se aproximas las festividades de fin de año y desea comprar mercaderia como harinas, huevos y otros de modo que ahora podra surtir su pequeño de ventas de alimentos y no vender solo verduras, de este modo que pueda obtener mejores ingresos y poder brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su hija.
Lourdes comprara todo tipo de insumos, desde alimentos ya procesados como insumos para procesar.
El credito anterior que obtuvo le sirvio de mucho ya que se dio cuenta que ella tiene la capacidad de poder generar mejores ingresos al invertir en capital. Por ello se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que confiaron en ella.
texts.en: Lourdes lives in her parent’s house.  She wants this loan because now that the end of the year festivities are coming up she wants to buy products like flour, eggs, and others so that she may vary her food sales, not just vegetables.  In this way she will make more income and be able to give her daughter a better quality of life.  Lourdes will buy all kinds of supplies, from prepared foods to ingredients.  The last loan she received helped her a lot and she realized she has the capacity to generate more income to invest in capital.  She is very grateful for the people who believed in her.

loans.use: Compra de insumos y mercaderia para actividad de venta de tienda de barrio

loans.name: Joel Elias

texts.es:
Joel, vive acompañado de su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, el administra un taller de estructuras metálicas elaborando puertas, ventanas, portones todo elaborado de hierro, este negocio nació con la intención de mejorar los ingresos familiares y administrar su propio negocio.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de hierro, electrodos, discos, acero y lámina, éstos maten materiales le ayudarán para dinamizar su trabajo haciendo más fácil la entrega sus trabajos en menor tiempo y con mayor calidad.
La aspiración de Joel y crecer en su taller y montar otro en un lugar cercano para ir creciendo en la zona
texts.en:
Joel lives with his wife and two young children. He runs a metal workshop where he makes structures such as doors, windows and gates, all produced from iron. This business was started with the intention of improving the family's income and of running his own business.

He is requesting a loan to buy iron, electrodes, discs, steel and laminates. These materials will help him to boost his business, making it easier for him to complete his jobs more quickly and to a higher quality.

Joel's wish is to develop his workshop and set up another nearby so that he can grow within the area.

loans.use: to buy iron, electrodes, disks, steel and laminates.

loans.name: Lurgia

texts.es: Lurgia, de 20 años, es una mujer sociable y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su  pareja Rafael de 25 años y sus 03 queridos hijos; y lo que más desea es brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos, para lo cual está dispuesta a trabajar arduamente. Los verdes campos del poblado de Santa Rosa, han sido en la vida de Lurgia, un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja sembrando sus cultivos de café, con mucho esmero y sacrificio junto a su pareja trabajan constantemente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Lleva 04 meses realizando esta actividad en sus tierras y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio situado en la localidad de Santa Rosa. Con el crédito solicitado comprará plantas de café para poder tener una buena producción. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, por lo que se compromete en seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está conforme con su banco comunal, ya que todos cumplen con sus compromisos de pago. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de café para incrementar en sus tierras.
texts.en:
20-year old Lurgia is a friendly hardworking woman who lives in her own house with 25-year old husband Rafael and their three beloved children. Her greatest wish is to provide them with a good education so she works hard to do this. 

The green fields of the small town of Santa Rosa are part of Lurgia’s life. It’s a pleasant place in which to work. As a small child she was taught by her parents how to work the land, and now she has her own fields where she and her husband grow coffee. It’s demanding work that takes up all their time. Lurgia most enjoys harvest time when she feels that the months of hard work have paid off in high quality coffee. She’s been doing this work for four months and considers that the most difficult part of the job is transporting the coffee from the fields to the warehouses in Santa Rosa.

With the loan Lurgia will buy coffee plants so she can have a good harvest. As time goes on she hopes to save enough money to buy more land. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to make her repayments according to the schedule. She is happy with her community bank as all the members fulfill their financial obligations. With the S/. 2,000 she will buy coffee plants for her fields.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria es de la ciudad de Santaní, es soltera y tiene dos hijos, los cuales son aun peuqeños y van a la escuela. María vive en casa de sus padres y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de articulos de merceria en forma ambulante.
Cuenta que hace un tiempo ya que se dedica a esto, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien formada ya que vende sus mercaderias por toda la ciudad y así es como se hace conocida. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, la cual día a día se esfuerza para poder darle a sus hijos un mejor futuro y que no tengan que pasar por privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, fundas, y demás artículos para la venta, ya que tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes y le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos. Esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que se le da de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
María is from the city of Santaní. She is single and has two small children who both attend school. María lives in her parents' house and tells us that she sells notions in an ambulatory manner.

She explains that she has been doing this for some time. She has a well-developed client base because she sells her merchandise all over the city and, in this manner, has become well-known. She describes herself as a very hard-working and spirited woman who struggles day in and day out to be able to provide her children with a better future and to ensure that they do not lack any necessities.

María is requesting this loan to buy sheets, blankets, bedspreads, and other items to sell, as she has many orders from her customers and would like to be able to fill them. She is very grateful for this opportunity to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets, bedspreads, and other items to sell

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 38 years old and has two children. She has been selling cereals for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,500.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd in the amount of KES 20,000. She will use the funds to purchase stocks of cereals, such as maize and beans, for her business. With the anticipated profits, she will save to diversify into farming.

Her hopes and dreams are to do both her cereals business and dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy stock of cereals such as maize and beans.

loans.name: Belal

texts.en:
Belal is a 29 year old single man from Al Russeifeh Jordan.He is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for his home improvements,he will be repainting his home and he would like to improve his home decorate. 
Since Belal is under 30 year old,his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Illary Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY,el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Ana continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua con la venta de arroz,azucar,leche entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de leche, gasesoas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de ropa, docentes, restaurante, manualidades, salón de belleza, mecánico, maestro constructor, tienda de abarrotes.
La foto fue tomada en dos grupos por el número de socios.
Los socios que salen en la foto  adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the ILLARY village bank. The bank is located in the department of Cusco. The member Ana continues with her grocery store business. The member is a responsible and enterprising person. The member continues with the sale of rice, sugar, milk, among others for all of her customers that order from her, this being the manner that the member gets her family ahead.

The member applied for the loan for the purchase of milk, soda, among others. The member feels thankful for the loan granted and commits herself to fulfilling her established installments. The other members work as clothing sellers, teachers, restauranteurs, crafters, beauty salon owners, mechanics, construction foreman, grocery store owners.

The photo was taken in two groups because of the number of members. The member who appears alongside the photo asked permission to arrive to the meeting late because of work. The person who appears with the covered face doesn't belong to the village bank.

loans.use: to purchase milk, soda, among others.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a Babban Gona farmer from Gayya Village. She joined Babban Gona so that she could realize better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Rahila no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed her family and children.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds, that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will increase her income considerably. This season Rahila has ambitious plans to harvest 10 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, she now has the opportunity to ensure that all her children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.en:
Miss Afiwa S. was born on 8th December 1967 at Kovié in the district of Zio. She is single with two (02) children. As a qualified hairdresser, Miss S. is know as a hard worker, she is sincere, kind and has a good sense of management. Mistress of a hairdressing shop in Lomé, she does a very good job, and gets more and more customers. On request from her customers, Miss S. began the sale of cosmetic and beauty products in her shop, which provides her additional income. She perfectly masters her job and correctly used the credit of $ 300 she obtained. She realized that to meet the demand that comes her way, she must imperatively have a more efficacious equipment and an important stock of cosmetic products. And this new project requires a large amount of money she does not have. Therefore, she requested a credit of $ 800 to buy modern driers and have funds to buy and sell cosmetic products.

Mlle S. Afiwa est née le 08 décembre 1967 à Kovié dans la préfecture du Zio. A ce jour, elle est célibataire avec deux enfants. Coiffeuse de formation, Mlle S. est connue pour son efficacité au travail, sa sincérité, sa générosité et son sens aigu de gestion. Maîtresse d’un salon de coiffure à Lomé, elle fait un travail très apprécié, ce qui lui attire une clientèle de plus en plus importante et exigeante. Ainsi, à la demande de sa clientèle, Mlle S. a commencé la vente des produits cosmétiques et de beauté dans son salon de coiffure ; ce qui lui procure des revenus complémentaires. Elle a une parfaite maîtrise de sa profession et a bien géré le crédit de $300 obtenu. Aujourd’hui, elle s’est rendue compte que pour être à la hauteur de l’importante demande qui s’offre à elle et répondre aux exigences qu’impose la profession actuellement, elle doit impérativement avoir un matériel plus performant et avoir un stock important de produits cosmétiques. Et ce nouveau projet fait appel à un coût aussi important qu’elle ne dispose pas. C’est à cet effet qu’elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $800 pour acquérir deux séchoirs modernes et disposer d’un fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la vente des produits cosmétiques

loans.use: to buy modern driers andcosmetic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Eunice wants to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en: Seyran Q. is from the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan where he currently lives with is wife and three children. He is 39 years old. Seyran started selling agricultural goods about 12 years ago from a remote location and currently is selling his products at the bazaar. His sales have greatly increased after receiving his first loan from Normicro last year. Seyran is currently requesting a loan to purchase more goods and to offer a more diverse variety of agricultural products.

loans.use: to purchase more goods

loans.name: Sergio Gerardo

texts.es:
Sergio is an entrepreneurial person and is very responsible. He used to work in a hardware store, but he lost that job three years ago due to problems in the business. Sergio began his own business. When Sergio was let go by the hardware store, they offered part of his severance pay in cash and the other part in hardware materials. This helped him out in the beginning with his paint store, where he sells items necessary for construction and other hardware. Sergio is married and the desire to be able to offer the best to his family is what motivates him to work harder and harder everyday.

Sergio is requesting a loan of $475.00, which he will use to buy merchandise. He is committed to returning the loan in 5 months. Be part of the development of this business! Sergio and his family thank you for the opportunity you provide them to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Sergio es un hombre emprendedor y muy responsable, anteriormente él trabajaba para una ferretería, hace tres años después que le dieron de baja en su empleo por algunos problemas de la empresa Sergio inició su propio negocio, para pagarle su liquidación le ofrecieron una parte en efectivo y otra en material ferretero esto le ayudo un poco en el comienzo de su tlapalería, donde vende artículos necesarios para la construcción y de ferretería. Sergio es casado y el deseo de poder ofrecerle lo mejor a su familia es lo que lo motiva a esforzarse cada día más.

Ahora Sergio necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, en busca de darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio para continuar creciendo, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Se parte en el desarrollo de este negocio, Sergio y su familia agradecen la oportunidad que les brindas con tu apoyo de mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.es:
Ludivina is a married mother of a 14-year-old son. They are originally from Cadereyta, Nuevo León. Her husband works at a local factory, but his salary is very low. To improve her family's quality of life, a year ago Ludivina decided to start her own business selling shoes. She started selling to her neighbors and loved ones but thanks to her quality of service she soon found success and increased her number of clients.

Now, thanks to the high quality of products she offers, she has many orders to supply and needs a $475 loan, which she plans to repay within four months. Ludivina is grateful for the opportunity to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Ludivina es casada y tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad, ellos son originarios de Cadereyta en Nuevo León, su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica de la localidad pero recibe un salario muy bajo y para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia hace un año Ludivina decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de zapatos, comenzó a vender entre sus vecinos y amistades pero gracias al buen servicio que ofrece pronto logró incrementar su número de clientes.

Ahora, gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa, tiene muchos pedidos por surtir y necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 4 meses. Ludivina agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Sau

texts.en: Sau's family has five members. The parents and their two oldest children work as day labourers. Sau has kidney problems and often needs medicine. Their youngest daughter is in the 8th class. Their average income is $12.50 per month/person. Sau is requesting a loan of $75 to raise chickens and increase the family's income. The loan will be repaid during four months.

loans.use: To raise chickens

loans.name: Kutfi

texts.ru:
Kufti G. has one daughter. Before Kutfi worked as a secondary school teacher, but because of the low pay she decided to start her own business. She has been selling children’s clothes for the past 4 years. This year she started working with MicroInvest and she wants to use her loan to expand her inventory and increase sales turnover.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Гадойбоева Кутфи мать единственной дочери. Раньше работала учительницей в средней школе ,но т.к. зарплата не достаточна она решила начать предпринимательскую деятельность.Занимается уже как 4 года продажей детской одежды . В этом году начала кредитоваться и хочет увеличить свой товарооборот.

loans.use: To increase sales turnover

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
We find 46 year old Juana in her humble home, avidly preparing her merchandise to sell to the inhabitants of her community. She is the mother of six children, four of whom still depend on her and that is her main motivation to shape the vision of the future. She offers a great variety of knitted ponchos. While she sells ponchos, her husband, Victor, works as a driver providing private service in their city. Juan wishes to have a secure place with a great variety of clothing items, she is sure that with this expansion she will strengthen her business and improve their quality of life. In order to make this happen she needs a loan to invest in the purchase of a large quantity of products to sell, and thereby little by little obtaining better opportunities for the benefit of her family. Juana is awaiting your collaboration.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a doña Juana de 46 años de edad, en su humilde domicilio, preparando ávidamente su mercadería para ofertarlos a la población de su comunidad, ella es madre de seis hijos, cuatro de ellos aún dependientes y es la principal motivación que posee para conservar su deseo de progreso. Oferta una inmensa variedad de ponchos tejidos.Mientras ella se dedica a esta labor, su esposo, Víctor, trabaja como chofer brindando servicio de movilidad rural en una empresa privada de su ciudad.El deseo de doña Juana es poseer un puesto seguro de ventas con una inmensa variedad de prendas de vestir, ella está segura que con esta ampliación fortalecerá su negocio y mejorará su calidad de vida.Para concretar sus planes requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de mayor volumen de productos para comercializarlos, y así poco a poco conseguir mejores utilidades para el beneficio de su familia.Juana en este momento está en espera de tu colaboración.

loans.use: Increased capital to be able to offer a greater variety of articles in a secure locale.

loans.name: Mov

texts.en: Mr. Mov C., 56, is the father of nine children who lives in Batambong province, Cambodia. He runs a stand at a busy local market, where he makes about $5 a day selling groceries. His wife stays at home cooking food for the family and caring for their children. One of their children works as a laborer and another is a motor-taxi driver; several are married and now live away from home. Mr. Mov C. hopes to use this loan to buy more groceries to sell to his customers, because demand for his products is strong.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
